Title: Exxon says Montana pipeline repairs to take weeks
Body: HOUSTON, July 6 Exxon Mobil Corp  isworking on a plan to repair and restart a ruptured Montanapipeline that spilled up to 1,000 barrels of crude into theYellowstone River last weekend, but restoration is not expectedfor at least two weeks, an executive said on Wednesday.

Title: Montana pulls out of oil spill joint command,UPDATE 2-Chesapeake Energy trust files for IPO,Canada crude-Heavy spreads narrow as Montana fears ease,Exxon says Montana pipeline repairs to take weeks
Body: BOZEMAN, Mont, July 7 Montana Governor BrianSchweitzer said on Thursday he has pulled the state out of thejoint command team directing cleanup of oil spilled from aruptured Exxon Mobil  pipeline over the weekend., * Chesapeake shares rise 4 pct post-market (Adds details from filing, industry background), CALGARY, Alberta, July 7 Canadian heavy crudespreads narrowed on Thursday as refinery problems following aMontana pipeline rupture proved less severe than first feared.,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp is working on a plan to repair and restart a ruptured Montana pipeline that spilled up to 1,000 barrels of crude into the Yellowstone River last weekend, but restoration is not expected for at least two weeks, an executive said on Wednesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil steps up Yellowstone River cleanup,Indonesia torture case vs Exxon Mobil revived,UPDATE 4-Indonesia torture case vs Exxon Mobil revived,US Cash Products-Harbor gasoline basis firms as prices tumble,Indonesia torture case vs ExxonMobil revived,Impact expected from upset at Beaumont TX refinery,UPDATE 1-Total wants Russia offshore deal that Chevron quit,UPDATE 1-Montana pulls out of oil spill joint command,ExxonMobil finds 2 oil spots beyond 20 miles of spill,UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil finds 2 oil spots beyond 20 miles of spill
Body: July 8 ExxonMobil Corp's unit said itstepped up efforts to absorb the oil spilt from the rupturedpipeline in Montana and put more people at work to clean up theYellowstone River.,NEW YORK Indonesian villagers who accused Exxon Mobil Corp's security forces of murder, torture and other atrocities have regained their right to sue the giant oil company in the United States., * Exxon Mobil said to hire soldiers who committed torture, NEW YORK, July 8 New York Harbor gasolinemarkets rallied Friday even as outright prices tumbled amidrenewed buying interest. Traders cited potential outputproblems at one or more of the refineries servicing thenortheastern United States, which led to the strongerdifferentials for F2 RBOB and M2 conventional gasoline versusthe New York Mercantile Exchange's August RBOB futurescontract.,NEW YORK A U.S. appeals court revived on Friday a lawsuit against Exxon Mobil Corp by Indonesian villagers who accused the oil giant's security forces of committing murder, torture and other wrongdoing., HOUSTON, July 8 Exxon Mobil Corp  expects "someimpact to production" from an electrical malfunction in a processing unitlate Tuesday at its 344,500 barrel-per-day refinery in Beaumont, Texas, aspokesman said Friday., * Chevron quit Black Sea oil project with Russia'sRosneft, (Adds details, quotes throughout; Exxon and EPA comment),ExxonMobil said it found two separate spots of oil beyond 20 miles from the point of release from its ruptured Montana oil pipeline, but there was no oil between 20-40 miles from the site of the release., July 7 ExxonMobil  said it found twoseparate spots of oil beyond 20 miles from the point of releasefrom its ruptured Montana oil pipeline, but there was no oilbetween 20-40 miles from the site of the release.

Title: Exxon submits draft clean-up plan in Montana oil spill,UPDATE 1-Exxon submits draft clean-up plan in Montana oil spill,US House panel to examine oil pipeline safety,ExxonMobil steps up Yellowstone River cleanup,Montana governor threatens lawsuit over oil spill,Montana governor threatens lawsuit over oil spill
Body: BILLINGS, Montana ExxonMobil on Saturday submitted a draft clean-up plan of its Yellowstone River oil spill to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency., (Adds details, background throughout; previously WASHINGTON), WASHINGTON, July 9 A U.S. House ofRepresentatives panel will examine pipeline safety next week asExxon Mobil Corp  works to clean up a spill from arupture in one of its lines in Montana that released as much as1,000 barrels of crude oil.,ExxonMobil Corp's unit said it stepped up efforts to absorb the oil spilled from the ruptured pipeline in Montana and put more people at work to clean up the Yellowstone River.,BILLINGS, Montana Montana Governor Brian Schweitzer continued on Friday to press Exxon Mobil over an oil spill into the Yellowstone River and threatened to take the company to court as clean-up continued a week after the leak., BILLINGS, Mont., July 8 Montana Governor BrianSchweitzer continued  on Friday to press Exxon Mobil over an oil spill into the Yellowstone River and threatened totake the company to court as clean-up continued a week afterthe leak.

Title: UPDATE 2-Chesapeake to invest in natural gas fuels market,Exxon: Joliet refinery not affected by power outage,Analysis: Study warns of leak risks of Canada-U.S. oil pipe,Chesapeake to invest in natural gas fuels market,Study warns of leak risks of Canada-U.S. oil pipe,Exxon says Baytown, Texas HCU back in production,BP halts output at Azeri Chirag field for 2 weeks,Government asks Exxon to retool Yellowstone spill plan
Body: * Chesapeake shares edge up post-market (Adds analyst comment), NEW YORK, July 11 Exxon Mobil  said onMonday operations at its 238,600 barrels-per-day refinery inJoliet, Illinois were not affected by the power outages thathit the Chicago area.,WASHINGTON TransCanada Corp, a company that hopes to build a $7 billion pipeline to take crude from Canada's oil sands to Texas, has underestimated the number and volume of leaks that could occur on the duct and hurt water supplies, an analysis released on Monday said., HOUSTON, July 11 Chesapeake Energy Corp plans to spend as much as $1 billion over the next decadeinvesting in companies and technologies to replace gasoline anddiesel with fuels derived from abundant natural gas., * Assessment needed before US decision on pipe-professor, HOUSTON, July 11 Exxon Mobil Corp's    560,640-barrels-per-day Baytown, Texas refinery has returnedhydrocracking unit No. 1 to production, a company spokeswomansaid on Monday., BAKU, July 11 Output at the Chirag oil field,part of Azerbaijan's Azeri-Chirag-Guneshli (ACG) project, hasbeen halted for two weeks for maintenance, shutting in output of80,000-85,000 barrels per day, operator BP said onMonday., BILLINGS, Mont, July 10 Federal regulators saidon Sunday they want Exxon Mobil  to retool itspreliminary plan to clean up oil spilled into the YellowstoneRiver in Montana from a ruptured pipe at the start of July.

Title: UPDATE 1-Firestone wins Liberian child labor case in U.S.,Firestone wins Liberian child labor case in U.S.,Firestone wins Liberian child labor case in U.S.,UPDATE 1-Exxon starting unit at Beaumont, Texas refinery-trade,Exxon starting unit at Beaumont, Texas refinery-trade
Body: * Companies can be held liable for human-rights abuses abroad  * Claims of 23 Liberian children still rejected  * Children worked on Firestone rubber tree farm (Adds statement from Firestone in paragraph 6),NEW YORK A federal appeals court threw out a lawsuit accusing the Firestone tire company of illegally using child labor in Liberia, but found that U.S. law allows companies to be held liable for human rights abuses abroad., * Alien Tort Statute applies to corporations -Judge Posner, HOUSTON, July 12 Exxon Mobil Corp  wasrestarting a reformer at its 344,500-barrels-per-day refineryin Beaumont, Texas after shutting it for unplanned work lastweek, traders said on Tuesday., HOUSTON, July 12 Exxon Mobil Corp  wasrestarting a reformer at its 344,500-barrels-per-day refineryin Beaumont, Texas after shutting it for unplanned work lastweek, traders said on Tuesday.

Title: ConocoPhillips to split in two; shares rise,UPDATE 8-ConocoPhillips to split in two; shares rise,Biggest US oil firms see refining as core strength,RPT-U.S. cash crudes - HLS leads grades up as Brent expires,U.S. chemical demand fragile, trade group says,RPT-Exxon Mobil shuts part of HLS line for maintenance,Exxon Mobil shuts part of HLS line for maintenance,Chronology: Big Oil's years of merger mania,Government probe of Exxon pipeline leak to take months,CHRONOLOGY-Big Oil's years of merger mania
Body: NEW YORK/HOUSTON ConocoPhillips  will spin off its refining arm in a bid to improve investment returns for shareholders, abandoning the bigger-is-better strategy that drove oil giants into mergers., * Mulva had said no to split in March (Rewrites to bring rivals higher, adds reserves graphic linkand closing share price), SAN FRANCISCO, July 14 The very biggest U.S.oil companies seem perfectly happy holding on to their refiningarms given that expertise in processing oil and gas afterextraction looks likely to be more in demand in the future., * SPR release, HLS pipeline issues, diesel exports drive, NEW YORK, July 14 Demand for U.S.-madechemicals is slowly improving in the United States and islargely driven by foreign customers, a chemical industry tradegroup said on Thursday., (Repeats to widen distribution, no change to headline ortext), HOUSTON, July 14 Exxon Mobil  PipelineCo has shut part of the Heavy Louisiana Sweet crude oilpipeline system in south Louisiana for maintenance, a spokesmansaid Thursday.,ConocoPhillips'  plan to split itself into two stand-alone public companies marks a reversal from a nearly 15-year trend of consolidation among big oil companies.,WASHINGTON It will take several months to investigate the cause of the leak on ExxonMobil's Silvertip oil pipeline crossing the Yellowstone River, the U.S. pipeline safety regulator told Congress on Thursday., July 14 ConocoPhillips'  plan to splititself into two stand-alone public companies marks a reversalfrom a nearly 15-year trend of consolidation among big oilcompanies [ID:nL3E7IE1Z0].

Title: Partners could buy Shell Mackenzie stake: analysts,US Cash Products-Harbor gasoline dips on higher supply,U.S. cash crudes-Mars closest to LLS in 13 months,No more oil to spill from Montana pipeline: EPA,UPDATE 1-No more oil to spill from Montana pipeline-EPA,UPDATE 1-Anadarko, Exxon developing Lucius field,No more oil to spill from Montana pipeline-EPA,Trans Alaska Pipeline restarts after planned weekend shutdown
Body: CALGARY, Alberta, July 18 Buyers could bescarce for Royal Dutch Shell Plc's  stake in theplanned C$16.2 billion ($16.9 billion) Mackenzie gas project inCanada's Arctic, but the pipeline's other backers may be themost logical buyers, analysts said on Monday., * Harbor RBOB, conventional gasoline down on excess supply, HOUSTON, July 18 Mars sour  sold for$17.80 a barrel over West Texas Intermediate  Monday,within $2.10 of Light Louisiana Sweet , which dealt for$19.90 over, traders said.,HOUSTON The danger of more oil leaking from Exxon Mobil Corp's ruptured pipeline in Montana has ended, the Environmental Protection Agency said., * Exxon shares down 0.5 percent (Adds information from Exxon, share price), HOUSTON, July 18 Anadarko Petroleum Corp and Exxon Mobil Corp  said on Monday that the twocompanies and their partners had finalized an agreement todevelop the deepwater Lucius field in the Gulf of Mexico., HOUSTON, July 18 The danger of more oil leakingfrom Exxon Mobil Corp's  ruptured pipeline in Montanahas been removed, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agencysaid., July 17 The Trans Alaska Pipeline Systemrestarted Sunday afternoon at the end of a scheduled maintenanceshutdown, the system's operator said.

Title: Industry study: Penn benefits from natgas drilling,U.S. cash crudes - Grades mixed on WTI expiry day,U.S. cash crudes-Mars, LLS up from late Tuesday deals,UPDATE 5-Dow Chemical, Mitsui in Brazil sugar cane venture,UPDATE 1-Turkey's TPAO plans 4-5 deep exploration wells in Black Sea,UPDATE 4-Dow Chemical, Mitsui in Brazil sugar cane venture
Body: PHILADELPHIA, July 20 A study funded by thenatural gas drilling industry on Wednesday said Pennsylvania'seconomy will get a $12.8 billion boost from drilling this year,more than double the amount from 2009, while reaping nearly140,000 jobs., * LLS sells $19.60 and $19.20 over LLS, from $19 Tuesday, * Mars sour done WTI plus $17.60, from $16.75 late Tuesday, * Move challenges Braskem's play in green plastics (Adds company comment), * Plans to drill four to five extra-deep exploration wells, * Mitsui to buy 50 pct stake in Dow sugar cane operation

Title: Dow Chemical, Mitsui in Brazil sugar cane venture,UPDATE 3-Dow Chemical, Mitsui in Brazil sugar cane venture,U.S. cash crudes-Diffs ease as arb narrows a bit,UPDATE 2-Exxon seeks partners for Indonesia project
Body: NEW YORK Dow Chemical Co and Mitsui & Co Ltd have formed a joint venture to turn sugar cane into ethanol and plastic, an area widely considered the future of the chemical industry., * Move challenges Braskem's play in green plastics (Adds executive interview, plant timing; updates stock), * WTI-Brent spread narrows to near $19 in favor of Brent, * Drilling results so far have been good (Adds Exxon confirmation, share price, background)

Title: U.S. cash crudes-Grades mixed in second day of roll,PREVIEW-Earnings up but output down at many oil companies,U.S. cash crudes - Thunder Horse $1 stronger,Worker killed at Exxon's Fawley, UK's largest refinery,BP investors turn up heat on CEO Dudley,Australia's CHAMP seeks buyers for Energy Services
Body: HOUSTON, July 22 Mars sour  eased butLight Louisiana Sweet  Thunder Horse light sour gained on a desultory second day of roll Friday., HOUSTON, July 22 The world's largest oilcompanies, including Exxon Mobil Corp  and Royal DutchShell Plc , are expected to report out-sized quarterlyprofits, but investors are likely to respond with a yawn,focusing instead on the companies' ability to raise output., HOUSTON, July 22 Thunder Horse light sour sold $1 stronger at $21 a barrel over West TexasIntermediate  as roll bid-asks widened a bit on thesecond day of roll trade., July 21 Exxon Mobil Corp confirmed the death of a contractor on Thursdayin an incident at its 330,000 barrel-per-day refinery Fawley refinery, the largest in Britain.,LONDON, Jul BP boss Bob Dudley is under pressure to clear up confused strategy and revive the oil giant's share price when it reports second-quarter earnings next week that will lag well behind its peers., MELBOURNE, July 22 Australia's CHAMP PrivateEquity is seeking buyers for its International Energy Services(IES) business for a price up to A$375 million ($405 million),and has had interest from domestic and Asian logisticscompanies, a source told Reuters on Friday.

Body: SALMON, Idaho, July 15 ExxonMobil  saidon Friday a pipeline that failed two weeks ago, leaking oilinto the Yellowstone River, routinely transported a heavier andmore toxic form of crude than the company and federalregulators initially acknowledged.,CALGARY, Alberta Royal Dutch Shell Plc  has put its stake in the C$16.2 billion ($16.8 billion) Mackenzie gas project up for sale, the first crack in the partnership set up to develop vast reserves in Canada's Arctic and build a pipeline to take the gas south., * Imperial Oil still committed to project (Adds details and comments), * Recent leaks show need to examine safety of Keystone XL, * Mars deals a bit stronger in August-September boxed deal, * Committee to vote on pipeline bill after summer recess,LONDON/WASHINGTON BP Plc promised improved drilling practices on Friday as the company balances twin aims of rebuilding investor and public confidence after the Gulf of Mexico oil spill while not admitting flaws in its own procedures.,* Declines to say whether tightening internal procedures, HOUSTON , July 15 Light Louisiana Sweet  sold 40 cents weaker at $18.90 a barrel over West Texas Intermediate  Friday as U.S. cash crude traders started a new, narr5368709131870095730,LONDON BHP Billiton's $12.1 billion agreed takeover of U.S. shale gas producer Petrohawk Energy Corp shows environmental concerns and weak margins have not cooled interest in this controversial energy source.

Title: No toxic chemicals found in Yellowstone leak: EPA,UPDATE 2-No toxic chemicals found in Yellowstone leak - EPA
Body: BILLINGS, Montana Water downstream from a ruptured Exxon Mobil pipeline that leaked oil into the Yellowstone River showed no detectable levels of toxic petroleum chemicals, according to U.S. Environmental Protection Agency documents released on Saturday., (Recasts with EPA results, five treated at hospitals sincespill)

Title: Tropical Storm Don forms over Gulf of Mexico,UPDATE 2-FACTBOX-Energy firms prepare for Gulf of Mexico storm,UPDATE 5-Tropical Storm Don forms over Gulf of Mexico,CEOs say yes to Congress on removing tax breaks,US CEOs say yes to Congress on removing tax breaks,Potential U.S. downgrade highlights strong balance sheets,IFR-Potential US downgrade highlights strong balance sheets,US House bill may bury pipelines deeper under rivers,BP finishes repair at Azerbaijan's Chirag oilfield
Body: HOUSTON Tropical Storm Don, the first major Gulf of Mexico storm this year, formed over the southern part of the oil-rich basin on Wednesday on a track toward the Texas coast., July 27 Tropical Storm Don formed in thesouthern Gulf of Mexico on Wednesday near the northeast coastof the Yucatan Peninsula and could reach the Texas Gulf Coastby the weekend, the National Hurricane Center said.[ID:nL3E7IR2EB], HOUSTON, July 27 Tropical Storm Don, the firstmajor Gulf of Mexico storm this year, formed over the southernpart of the oil-rich basin on Wednesday on a track toward theTexas coast.,WASHINGTON The CEO of Wal-Mart Stores Inc. and other major U.S. employers told Congress on Wednesday they would be willing to give up tax breaks that benefit their companies in return for a steep drop in the country's 35 percent corporate tax rate., * No specifics at hearing focused on tax role in hiring,NEW YORK, July 27 (IFR) - A U.S. sovereign downgrade is likely to drive down yields on U.S. investment grade corporate bonds, as wary investors snap up these cash-rich credits and the government deals with its own messy balance sheet., NEW YORK, July 27 (IFR) - A US sovereign downgrade islikely to drive down yields on US investment grade corporatebonds, as wary investors snap up these cash-rich credits andthe government deals with its own messy balance sheet., * Transportation Dept would study burying pipelines deeper, BAKU, July 27 Repair work at Azerbaijan's Chiragoilfield, part of the Azeri-Chirag-Guneshli (ACG) project, hasbeen completed and production is resuming after a suspension ofmore than two weeks, operator BP said on Wednesday.

Title: House passes bill to speed up oil sands pipe review,UPDATE 1-US House passes bill to speed up oil sands pipe review,BP plans slow return to Gulf drilling,UPDATE 2-BP plans slow return to Gulf drilling,UPDATE 4-PDVSA debt to suppliers leapt to $10.9 bln in 2010,BP fails to convince investors on strategy,UPDATE 5-BP fails to convince investors on strategy,Analysis: Advisers say time is right for high-yield stocks,REFILE-UPDATE 3-BP fails to convince investors on strategy,RPT-BP investors press CEO Dudley for strategy clues
Body: WASHINGTON The House of Representatives on Tuesday approved legislation that would set a firm deadline for the Obama administration to decide the fate of a proposed $7 billion pipeline that would transport Canadian oil sands crude to the U.S. Gulf Coast., * State has said will make decision on project by Dec 31,LONDON BP Plc has not yet applied for permission to drill its first new Gulf of Mexico oil well since the 4 million-barrel Macondo spill a year ago, the oil major said on Tuesday, although it received permission this month to plug an old well., LONDON, July 26 BP Plc  has not yetapplied for permission to drill its first new Gulf of Mexicooil well since the 4 million-barrel Macondo spill a year ago,the oil major said on Tuesday, although it received permissionthis month to plug an old well., * Plans investments of $142 bln between 2011-2015 (Updates throughout with more Ramirez quotes, edits),LONDON BP Plc Chief Executive Bob Dudley's pledge of strong long-term growth failed to reassure investors concerned about the company's post-oil spill strategy and second-quarter results well shy of forecasts. |Â , * BP among biggest fallers on FTSE 100 (Adds background, detail, updates shares),WASHINGTON Prompted by a host of financial and economic developments, a growing number of investment advisers are steering their clients toward dividend-paying stocks., (Repeats to additional clients, removes extraneous word from4th paragraph),LONDON, July 26 BP boss Bob Dudley is underpressure to outline his post-oil spill strategy and revive the share price when he unveils second-quarter earnings on Tuesday.

Title: BP investors press CEO Dudley for strategy clues,US Cash Products-Midwest refinery problem boosts Aug gasoline,U.S. cash crudes-Mars higher as roll nears end
Body: LONDON, July 26 BP boss Bob Dudley is underpressure to outline his post-oil spill strategy and revive the share price when he unveils second-quarter earnings on Tuesday., NEW YORK, July 25 Chicago gasolinedifferentials rose 3.50 cents a gallon on Monday as increasedbuying inflated values following reports of regional refineryproblems., * Markets worldwide await the outcome of U.S. debt dispute

Body: OTTAWA Canada will boost monitoring of pollution from its oil sands projects, hoping to speed up U.S. approval of a pipeline to transport crude to the Gulf Coast, Environment Minister Peter Kent said on Thursday., * Canada hopes plan will speed approval of key pipeline,SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc boosted its spending to lobby the U.S. government by 54 percent in the second quarter, as the world's No.1 Internet search engine faces an investigation by the Federal Trade Commission., SAN FRANCISCO, July 21 Google Inc boosted its spending to lobby the U.S. government by 54 percentin the second quarter, as the world's No.1 Internet searchengine faces an investigation by the Federal Trade Commission., BANGALORE, July 21 Exxon Mobil Corp confirmed the death of a contractor on Thursday in an incidentat its 330,000 barrel-per-day refinery Fawley refinery, thelargest refinery in Britain., BANGALORE, July 21 A worker was killed onThursday following an accident at Exxon Mobil Corp's refinery in Fawley, Britain, according to a local mediareport.,OTTAWA Canada will boost monitoring of pollution from its oil-rich tar sands and hopes this will speed up Washington's approval of a proposed $7 billion pipeline to transport heavy Canadian crude to the U.S. Gulf Coast, Environment Minister Peter Kent said on Thursday., (Refiles to remove extraneous word "rich" from firstparagraph), * Pushing contract forward without delivery minus 20 cents, * Zero tax rate for the Black Sea and Okhotsk Sea oil fields

Body: NEW YORK Stocks faded in the afternoon on Thursday to end mostly lower, with investors skeptical a key vote by Congress would lead to a deal to avoid a U.S. default. |Â ,HOUSTON Gulf of Mexico producers reduced oil and natural gas output on Thursday as Tropical Storm Don churned northwest toward the Texas Coast, where it could make landfall by the weekend., * 148 mln cubic feet/day natgas output idle on Don-BOEMRE, * White House urges compromise to head off debt default, * White House urges compromise to head off debt default, * Billings, Montana refinery running at reduced rates (Updates throughout, adds byline),HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp reported a higher quarterly profit that missed Wall Street estimates as maintenance slowed its international refining and production, and its shares closed down 2 percent. |Â , * Shares down 2 pct (Adds details from conference call; updates shares),NEW YORK Oil edged up on Thursday as a tropical storm heading toward the Texas coast forced producers in the Gulf of Mexico to begin shutting in production and evacuating support staff., * U.S. jobless claims fall below 400,000, supporting oil

Title: UPDATE 4-BP, BHP to re-man Gulf platforms, Don heads for Texas,Chevron profit jumps with oil, output growth slow,UPDATE 5-Chevron profit jumps with oil, output growth slow,UPDATE 1-Russia faces oil price battle as Iraqi output grows,WRAPUP 2-Oil majors Total and Eni hit by weak dollar, Libya,WRAPUP 1-European oil majors hit by weak dollar, Libya,UPDATE 2-Total Q2 profits fall despite higher oil prices,UPDATE 1-Total Q2 profits fall despite high oil prices
Body: * Traders eyeing new system east of Lesser Antilles (Updates with Apache increasing shut-in output),NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Chevron Corp, the second-largest U.S. oil company, booked a 43 percent jump in quarterly profit, beating estimates as high oil prices and fat refinery margins offset weaker output., * Q2 EPS $3.85 vs Wall St view of $3.56; revenue up 30 pct, * Traders say brought crude after Russian oil becameexpensive, * Total Q2 net ex one-offs 2.79 bln eur vs f'cast 2.85 bln, * Eni Q2 comparable earnings 1.67 billion euros vs f'cast1.65 billion, * Q2 net profit misses analysts forecast, strong euro bites, PARIS, July 29 Oil major Total  posteda 6 percent drop in quarterly profits as high crude pricesfailed to make up for output losses in conflict-torn Libya andthe North Sea, and weakness in its refining business.

Body: Aug 1 U.S. oil and gas producers ramped up restarted productionat Gulf of Mexico platforms on Monday after Tropical Storm Don came ashore latelast week. [ID:nN1E7701JE], (Corrects to fix units of total oil and gas lost to barrelsand billion cubic feet respectively in paragraph 6), HOUSTON, Aug 1 Exxon Mobil Corp  hasrestarted oil and gas production that was shut in last week byTropical Storm Don, a spokesman said., HOUSTON, Aug 1 Exxon Mobil Corp  asbegun turnarounds on hydroformer, hydrotreater and severalaromatics units at its 560,640 barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery inBaytown, Texas, a spokeswoman said., HOUSTON, Aug 1 U.S. oil and gas producers on Monday rampedup output that had been shut in for Tropical Storm Don, which dissipatedshortly after coming ashore late Friday.,The Nigerian naira strengthened against the U.S dollaron the interbank market on Monday after sales by three oilmultinationals boosted dollar supply.

Title: Corrosiveness of oil sands crude an unproven science,UPDATE 2-Marathon can up Garyville, Louisiana refinery output,UPDATE 1-Imperial brings replacement fuel into Nova Scotia
Body: CALGARY/WASHINGTON, Aug 2 A recent series ofoil spills has amplified a debate over the safety of shippingoil sands-derived crude through pipelines, but there is littlehard evidence that the Canadian oil is more corrosive thanconventional crude, scientists and regulators say., * Amount of sour crude processed increased in Q2 (Adds detail, quotes, byline; adds NEW YORK to dateline), CALGARY, Alberta, Aug 2 Imperial Oil Ltd said on Tuesday that cargoes of fuel have started toarrive in Nova Scotia to replace volumes lost due to alonger-than-expected outage of its Dartmouth refinery thatcaused some service stations to run dry.

Title: Exxon's Baytown, Texas, refinery shuts hydrofiner
Body: HOUSTON, July 31 Exxon Mobil Corp reported flaring from the planned shutdown of a hydrofiningunit at its 560,640 barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery in Baytown,Texas, the nation's largest, according to a weekend filing withTexas pollution regulators.

Title: Analysis: Cash-rich shale drillers boost output, cap prices,FACTBOX - Schedule of U.S. SPR oil deliveries,COLUMN-The Utica shale: the next US oil surprise?-Campbell,UPDATE 3-Cairn Energy Greenland well comes up dry,REFILE-Japan's TonenGeneral ups reformer capacity by 3,000 bpd
Body: NEW YORK Until recently, the nascent U.S. shale gas industry faced a major constraint on its growth, one that was bigger than environmental risk, more vexing than technology, and more challenging than the scrum for new acreage: capital., WASHINGTON, Aug 3 Following is the U.S. Energy Department'slatest update on the companies that have received the oil they bought from theStrategic Petroleum Reserve., -- Robert Campbell is a Reuters market analyst. The viewsexpressed are his own. --, * Sees farm-out deal funding Greenland exploration next year, TOKYO, Aug 3 Exxon Mobil's group refinerin Japan, TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK , has raised thecapacity of the No.3 reformer at its Kawasaki refinery nearTokyo by 3,000 barrels per day to 34,000 bpd, a trade ministryofficial said.

Title: UPDATE 4-Fire shuts Valero's 180,000-bpd Memphis refinery,UPDATE 1-Exxon will need $1.3 bln for full capacity at Cepu-BPMigas,Exxon will need $1.3 bln for full capacity at Cepu-BPMigas

Body: * Regulator says Enterprise recovered 3,000 gallons of NGL (Adds details), CALGARY, Alberta, Aug 15 Imperial Oil Ltd said on Monday its Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, refinerywas restarting after more than two weeks of planned maintenancethat contributed to some fuel shortages on Canada's EastCoast.,LONDON Greenland said it was going to publish its oil spill contingency plan later on Monday, in a move which could help dampen some of the controversy surrounding oil exploration in its waters., * Says oil spill plan to be available on website later onMonday, WASHINGTON, Aug 15 Following is the U.S. EnergyDepartment's latest update on the companies that have received theoil they bought from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.,NEW YORK A leak in a natural gas liquids pipeline operated by Enterprise Products Partners spilled fuel into the Missouri River in Iowa, the company said on Monday., * Spill of that scale would be biggest since 2000 - govt, LONDON, Aug 15 Greenland is due to publish itsoil spill response plan later on Monday, the territory's deputyminister for Mineral Resources said, in a move which coulddampen some of the controversy surrounding oil exploration inits waters.,DUESSELDORF, Germany E.ON AG  is considering selling its natural gas transport network, a company source told Reuters, as Germany's decision to abandon nuclear power forces the group to shed assets and jobs., (Company corrects number of employees at Open Grid Europe unitto 1,800 from 1,400 in second paragraph)

Title: Wall Street sinks for fourth straight week

Refineries, otherpipelines and other energy infrastructure reported nosignificant impacts., NEW YORK, Aug 23 ExxonMobil Pipeline company, aunit of ExxonMobil Corp.  is expected to begin drillinga bypass to its 40,000 barrel per day Silvertip crude oilpipeline as early as next week, Montana environmentalregulators said on Tuesday., NEW YORK, Aug 23 ExxonMobil Pipeline Company, aunit of ExxonMobil Corp , received approval to restart a20-mile (32-km) section of the Silvertip pipeline runningbetween Laurel and Billings, Montana, federal regulators saidon Tuesday., NEW YORK, Aug 23 ExxonMobil Corp received approval to restart a 20-mile (32-km) section of theSilvertip pipeline running between Laurel and Billings,Montana, federal regulators said on Tuesday.,BAGHDAD Shell, Europe's biggest oil and gas company, is likely to face long delays in bringing a $17 billion gas deal with Iraq into operation as it tackles infrastructure, export constraints and sufficient access to gas from oilfields run by industry rivals., * Says offshore production facilities running at fullcapacity (Adds analyst comment)

Body: HOUSTON BP Plc on Wednesday became the first major oil producer to say it was evacuating some workers from Gulf of Mexico oil and gas platforms because of a tropical disturbance that could become a named storm this week., * Other oil producers monitoring weather system (Updates with Anadarko evacuating workers, adds details,background, bylines), Aug 31 The following bids, mergers, acquisitionsand disposals involving European, U.S. and Asian companies werereported by 1400 GMT on Wednesday:, HOUSTON, Aug 31 Chevron Corp , thesecond-largest U.S. oil company, is still talking with Rosneft about potential deals, despite the pact signedbetween larger rival Exxon Mobil Corp  and the Russianstate-owned oil company.,MOSCOW Black-clad special forces raided BP's Moscow offices on Wednesday, deepening the British company's problems in Russia after its attempts to salvage an oil exploration agreement in the Russian Arctic collapsed. |Â ,MOSCOW Prime Minister Vladimir Putin's blessing of a deal with ExxonMobil to extract oil and gas from the Russian Arctic sends a strong signal that he will return to the Kremlin in an election next year.,Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin is widely expected to run for president in the 2012 election but President Dmitry Medvedev has indicated he would like to stay on if his mentor decides not to run., Aug 31 Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin iswidely expected to run for president in the 2012 election butPresident Dmitry Medvedev has indicated he would like to stay onif his mentor decides not to run.,Unwelcome in the Gulf of Mexico since last year's oil spill and now spurned by the political elite in Russia, BP  is hamstrung in two key producing zones and needs new sources of growth and security of supply., * Raid on Moscow office highlights vulnerability in Russia

Body: NEW ORLEANS Tropical Storm Lee moved slowly across southern Louisiana on Sunday as New Orleans' flood defenses appeared to pass one of their biggest tests since Hurricane Katrina devastated the city in 2005. |Â ,HOUSTON More than half of crude oil output in the Gulf of Mexico was shut in on Sunday as Tropical Storm Lee hindered efforts to restaff and restart oil and gas platforms in the basin., * Slow-moving Lee hindering Gulf restaff, restart efforts, * Another storm strengthening - hurricane center (Adds Alabama fatality, updates oil outage figures), HOUSTON, Sept 4 Exxon Mobil Corp  wasrestaffing offshore Gulf of Mexico operations and restartingsome shut-in production after Tropical Storm Lee came ashore inLouisiana, the company said., * Center of storm on Louisiana coast - hurricane center, WASHINGTON, Sept 4 Tropical Storm Lee  hit the coast of southern Louisiana on Sunday asNew Orleans prepared for one of the biggest tests of its flooddefenses since Hurricane Katrina in 2005., NEW ORLEANS, Sept 3 New Orleans, devastated byHurricane Katrina six years ago, faced a new threat on Saturdayfrom Tropical Storm Lee, which was set to challenge the city'sflood defenses with an onslaught of heavy rain., * Lee shuts 60.3 pct of U.S. offshore oil production (Updates with storm position, more mayor quotes)

Body: ABUJA, Sept 30 Gunmen boarded a ship supplyingan Exxon Mobil oil platform offshore Nigeria on Friday,wounding one on board and abducting another, the local unit ofthe U.S. oil major said., * LyondellBasell plant closure rekindles industry concern, PARIS, Sept 30 French refinery unions decided onFriday against calling for a strike at the Fos-sur-Mer, La Medeand Lavera plants after the announced closure of a refinery inthe Berre industrial site in southern France, a top CGT unionofficial at the Lavera plant told Reuters after a union meeting.	When asked whether workers at those refineries would joinstrikers at LyondellBasell's Berre plant, Marc Sarde said: "No,not in the short-term.", PARIS, Sept 30 Labour union officials of fouroil refineries based in the Berre industrial site, in southernFrance, were meeting on Friday to discuss possible action afterLyondellBasell said it would shut its plant there., KIEV, Sept 30 Ukraine's state-run energy firmNaftogaz and U.S. oil and gas major ExxonMobil havesigned a preliminary agreement on exploring and developing shalegas deposits in Ukraine, Naftogaz said late on Thursday., Sept 30 ExxonMobil will shut its Altonarefinery in Melbourne during October and November for a plannedmaintenance turnaround, the firm said on Friday.

Title: Exxon L.A. refinery reports breakdown
Body: Oct 16 Exxon Mobil Corp's 149,500barrel per day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery in Torrance,California, reported a breakdown on Saturday that triggeredflaring, according to a notice the company filed with statepollution regulators.

Title: UPDATE 7-Exxon signs Kurd deals; Baghdad issues warning,Exxon signs Kurd deals, Baghdad warns,Exxon signs Kurd deals, Baghdad warns,Iraq govt warned Exxon against Kurdish deals-official,Exxon signs exploration deals with Iraqi Kurds-FT
Body: LONDON/BAGHDAD, Nov 11 Exxon Mobil hassigned oil and gas exploration deals with Iraq's Kurdistan, anadviser to the Kurdish government said on Friday, promptingwarnings from Baghdad that the bold step could jeopardise thecompany's future in the country.,LONDON/BAGHDAD Exxon Mobil  has signed oil and gas exploration deals with Iraq's Kurdistan, an adviser to the Kurdish government said on Friday, despite warnings from Baghdad that the move could jeopardize a major oilfield project.,LONDON/BAGHDAD Exxon Mobil  has signed oil and gas exploration deals with Iraq's Kurdistan, an adviser to the Kurdish government said on Friday, despite warnings from Baghdad that the move could jeopardize a major oilfield project.,BAGHDAD, Nov 11 Iraq's government warnedExxon Mobil last month that any oil exploration contractit signed with the Kurdistan Regional Government would beillegal and could result in termination of its deal to developthe West Qurna oilfield, a senior Iraqi oil official said onFriday.,LONDON, Nov 11 Exxon Mobil lastmonth signed oil and gas exploration deals with Iraq'sKurdistan, becoming the first oil major to deal with the regionwhich has had strained relations with Baghdad, the FinancialTimes said on Friday.

Title: Total says no strike at its Antwerp refinery
Body: PARIS, Nov 18 Total workers atthe group's 360,000 barrels-per-day Antwerp refinery will notjoin a strike planned at ExxonMobil's refinery in the sameBelgian city, after management reached a deal over pay on Nov.17, Total said on Friday.

Title: UPDATE 4-Iraqi Kurdistan confirms Exxon oil deal-minister,Iraqi Kurdistan, Exxon signed deal on Oct. 18-minister
Body: ARBIL, Iraq, Nov 13 Iraq's Kurdish regionhas signed an exploration deal with Exxon Mobil, aKurdish official said on Sunday, confirming a deal that Iraq hassaid could jeopardise the U.S. oil giant's southern oilfieldcontract.,ARBIL, Iraq, Nov 13 Iraq's semi-autonomousnorthern Kurdish region signed a deal with U.S. oil major ExxonMobil on Oct. 18 for six exploration blocks in thesemi-autonomous region, Kurdish energy Minister Ashti Hawramisaid on Sunday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Suncor restarts Terra Nova field after maintenance,Nigerian Qua Iboe oil tankers delayed -trade,UPDATE 1-Japan's Marubeni buys PNG gas project stake from JX,Japan's TonenGeneral confirms refinery repair work,Japan's JX to sell PNG LNG project stake to Marubeni
Body: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov 14 Suncor Energy Inc , Canada's biggest oil and gas company, said on Mondayit resumed normal operations at the 50,000 barrel-a-day TerraNova field off Newfoundland following a four-week maintenanceshutdown.,LONDON, Nov 14 A tanker of the benchmarkQua Iboe Nigerian crude oil grade has been dropped from theDecember loading programme and at least one other cargo has beendelayed, trade sources told Reuters on Monday.,TOKYO, Nov 14 Japanese trading houseMarubeni Corp said on Monday it had bought a smallstake in an Exxon Mobil-led liquefied natural gas (LNG) projectin Papua New Guinea for 23 billion yen ($298 million), boostingits presence in Asia's rapidly growing LNG markets.,TOKYO, Nov 14 Exxon Mobil's Japanese refiner TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK said on Mondayit was conducting unplanned repair work at its 156,000 barrelsper day (bpd) Sakai refinery this month in western Japan.,TOKYO, Nov 14 JX Nippon Oil & GasExploration Corp, a unit of Japan's JX Holdings, saidon Monday it would sell a small stake in an Exxon Mobil-ledliquefied natural gas (LNG) project in Papua New Guinea totrading house Marubeni Corp.

Title: Companies cited by US EPA for fake biofuel credits
Body: * Clean Green Fuel accused of selling 32 mln fake credits

Title: WRAPUP 1-Kurd, Baghdad oil officials meet on Exxon spat,Shell pulls out of Kurdistan oil talks - FT
Body: LONDON, Nov 17 The most senior energyofficials from the Kurdish region of Iraq and from the centralgovernment were due to meet on Thursday to try and resolve aspat over a major oil deal involving U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil.,LONDON, Nov 17 Royal Dutch Shell Plc has pulled out of oil-development talks with the Kurdistanregional government in an effort to protect lucrativeinvestments in southern Iraq, the Financial Times reported onThursday.

Title: Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions,UPDATE 2-Exxon Mobil says HLS pipeline shut indefinitely,Workers plan strike at Exxon's Belgium refinery,Exxon looking at North American LNG exports -exec,Azeri oil company buys Exxon Swiss unit,Exxon Mobil says HLS pipeline shut indefinitely,UPDATE 2-Iraq says to act against Exxon over Kurd deal
Body: Nov 16 The following bids, mergers,acquisitions and disposals involving European, U.S. and Asiancompanies were reported by 2100 GMT on Wednesday:,HOUSTON, Nov 16 Exxon Mobil Pipeline Cohas shut indefinitely its Southwest System Pipeline, a carrierof Heavy Louisiana Sweet crude oil, after the governmentrefused to ease repair requirements, a spokeswoman saidWednesday.,BRUSSELS, Nov 16 ExxonMobil willhave to start shutting down its Antwerp refinery in Belgium onFriday if it does not reach an agreement with workers over pay,a spokesman said on Wednesday.,Nov 16 Exxon Mobil Corp is activelyassessing options to export liquefied natural gas from NorthAmerica, where it is a top producer of the fuel.,BAKU, Nov 16 ExxonMobil  hasagreed to sell its Swiss fuel supply business, Esso Schweiz, toAzeri national oil company SOCAR, giving the Caspian energypower access to end-users in Europe.,HOUSTON, Nov 16 Exxon Mobil Pipeline Cohas shut its Southwest System Pipeline, carrier of HeavyLouisiana Sweet crude oil, indefinitely, a spokeswoman saidWednesday.    Shutdown of the 12-inch line effective Oct. 31 came afterthe U.S. government refused a request to modify repair criteriafor the segment from South Bend to Krotz Springs, Louisiana, aspokeswoman said by email.    Exxon Mobil made alternative arrangements available toshippers, the spokeswoman said.,BAGHDAD, Nov 16 Iraq's government said itwould move to end a major contract with Exxon Mobil after the U.S. oil giant signed a deal with semi-autonomousKurdistan to explore fields there, which Baghdad on Wednesdaycalled a violation of the law.

Title: UPDATE 4-Iraq may penalize Exxon after Kurdistan gamble,US State Dept says had warned over Iraq oil deals,Iraq to decide on Exxon sanctions before year-end,Iraq attacks Exxon for signing deal with Kurdish region,UPDATE 2-Iraq attacks Exxon, says U.S. supports Baghdad,Iraq considering sanctions against Exxon: Shahristani,UPDATE 1-Iraq considering sanctions against Exxon- Shahristani,Iraq considering sanctions against Exxon- Shahristani
Body: * Shahristani says sanctions on Exxon possible by year-end,WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 The U.S. State Departmentsaid on Tuesday it has warned Exxon Mobil and otherU.S. firms of the risks of signing contracts in Iraq withoutnation-wide approval, but would not say whether it talked withExxon before it struck a controversial oil deal in Iraq'sKurdistan region.,LONDON, Nov 22 Iraq will take a decisionon sanctions against U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil beforethe end of the year, Iraqi Deputy Prime Minister for EnergyHussain al-Shahristani said on Tuesday.,LONDON Iraq said on Tuesday it would slap sanctions on U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil  for signing a deal with the Kurdish region, which it said came without any approval from either Baghdad or Washington.,* Says US would have asked Exxon to clear deal with Baghdad,LONDON Iraq is considering imposing sanctions on Exxon Mobil  after its decision to sign a deal with the country's Kurdish region, Deputy Prime Minister for Energy Hussain al-Shahristani said on Tuesday.,* Kurdish region says Exxon has signed deal to explore area,LONDON, Nov 22 Iraq is consideringimposing sanctions on Exxon Mobil after its decision tosign a deal with the country's Kurdish region, Deputy PrimeMinister for Energy Hussain al-Shahristani said on Tuesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Iraq oil min: awaiting reply from Exxon Mobil,Iraq oil min: awaiting reply from Exxon Mobil
Body: * Iraq PM, oil minister, PCLD sent letters to Exxon -oil min,TOKYO, Nov 21 Iraq's Oil MinisterAdbul-Kareem Luaibi said on Monday that both he and PrimeMinister Nuri al-Maliki, who are now visiting Tokyo, havewritten to Exxon Mobil and are awaiting a reply. He didnot state the content of the letters.

Title: Analysis: Exxon Kurdistan foray tests Iraq's centralist resolve
Body: BAGHDAD Exxon Mobil's venture into Iraqi Kurdistan challenges Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki's resolve against growing regional separatism and tests the investment strategy of the oil majors in Iraq.

Title: Iraq sees Exxon's interest in south larger than Kurd deal,Iraq sees Exxon's interest in south larger than Kurd deal
Body: BAGHDAD Iraq believes Exxon Mobil  has less interest in pursuing a disputed oil deal in the country's semi-autonomous Kurdistan region because it has much larger contract in southern Iraq, its oil minister said on Saturday.,BAGHDAD, Nov 19 Iraq believes Exxon Mobil has less interest in pursuing a disputed oil deal in thecountry's semi-autonomous Kurdistan region because it has muchlarger contract in southern Iraq, its oil minister said onSaturday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Iraq demands Exxon explain Kurdish oil deal,Iraq demands Exxon explain Kurdish oil contract-Oilmin
Body: BAGHDAD, Nov 27 Iraq will send Exxon MobilCorp a further letter demanding an explanation of itscontract with the semi-autonomous Kurdistan region afterreceiving no response from the U.S. oil group, Iraq's oilminister said on Sunday.,BAGHDAD, Nov 27 Iraq will send Exxon Mobil a further letter demanding an explanation of itscontract with the semi-autonomous Kurdistan region afterreceiving no response from the U.S. oil giant, Iraq's oilminister said on Sunday.

Title: Japan's TonenGeneral restarts CDU after inspection
Body: TOKYO, Nov 29 Exxon Mobil's Japanese refining unit, TonenGeneral Sekiyu, restartedits sole 156,000 barrels per day (bpd) crude distillation unit(CDU) at its Sakai refinery in western Japan on Nov. 24, a firedepartment official said on Tuesday.

Title: ExxonMobil offers 3rd Dec-loading high-viscosity fuel oil lot
Body: SINGAPORE, Nov 30 ExxonMobil has offeredthe largest volumes of high-viscosity fuel oil, totalling about120,000 tonnes, from its Singapore refinery since August, amidimminent global specification changes to reduce the levels ofsulphur in marine fuels, traders said on Wednesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Atlas Pipeline to provide services to ExxonMobil unit,UPDATE 1-Exxon's PNG LNG project on track for 2014 sales, costs up on FX
Body: Dec 1 Atlas Pipeline Partners L.P. said it would provide natural gas gathering and processingservices to an ExxonMobil unit from the Woodford Shaleto Velma processing facility in Oklahoma.,Dec 1 ExxonMobil's Papua NewGuinea liquefied natural gas project is facing a cost increaseof over 4 percent to $15.7 billion due to the impact of astronger Australian dollar on capital costs, Exxon's projectpartners said on Thursday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Atlas Pipeline to provide services to ExxonMobil unit,UPDATE 1-Exxon's PNG LNG project on track for 2014 sales, costs up on FX
Body: Dec 1 Atlas Pipeline Partners L.P. said it would provide natural gas gathering and processingservices to an ExxonMobil unit from the Woodford Shaleto Velma processing facility in Oklahoma.,Dec 1 ExxonMobil's Papua NewGuinea liquefied natural gas project is facing a cost increaseof over 4 percent to $15.7 billion due to the impact of astronger Australian dollar on capital costs, Exxon's projectpartners said on Thursday.

Title: Exxon Beaumont refinery restarts SRU-filing
Body: HOUSTON, Dec 11 Exxon Mobil Corp restarted a sulfur recovery unit at its 344,500 barrel per day(bpd) Beaumont, Texas, refinery on Saturday, according to anotice the refinery filed with state pollution regulators.

Title: Oil rallies with euro, equities on EU deal
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices rallied on Friday, after a choppy start, as an agreement for a closer euro zone fiscal union and news of a Chinese fund for U.S. and European investment lifted the euro and equities markets.

Title: Oil drops more than 4 percent as commodities plunge,Russia woos foreign firms to explore for minerals
Body: NEW YORK Oil tumbled more than 4 percent on Wednesday, the biggest drop in over two months as a commodities selloff led to breaches of key technical support. |Â ,MOSCOW, Dec 14 Rosgeologia, Russia's newlycreated state holding company for geological exploration, hasoffered foreign companies a chance to work jointly with it inexploring for mineral resources, its director said on Wednesday.

Title: Oil falls on euro zone worry, dollar strength,Exxon Antwerp refinery talks fail, strike possible
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices fell on Monday, pressured by concerns that Europe's agreement on closer fiscal union will not solve its debt crisis and might deepen a regional slowdown.,BRUSSELS, Dec 12 Pay talks between unionleaders and management at Exxon Mobil Corp's refineryin the northern Belgian port city of Antwerp failed on Monday,reviving the possibility of a strike, a union official said.

Title: Oil jumps 2 percent on Iran jitters, OPEC meeting eyed
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices rose 2 percent on Tuesday as geopolitical jitters about Iran combined with threats to supply and key shipping lanes sent U.S. crude above $100 a barrel. |Â

Title: Exxon mulls $10.9 billion approach for Gulf Keystone: report,UPDATE 1-Exxon mulls 7 bln stg approach for Gulf Keystone-paper,Exxon mulls 7 bln stg approach for Gulf Keystone-paper
Body: LONDON U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil Corp is mulling a 7 billion pound ($10.9 billion) takeover of Kurdistan-focused explorer Gulf Keystone Petroleum, the Independent on Sunday reported.,LONDON, Dec 18 U.S. oil major Exxon MobilCorp is mulling a 7 billion pound ($10.9 billion)takeover of Kurdistan-focused explorer Gulf Keystone Petroleum, the Independent on Sunday reported.,LONDON, Dec 18 U.S. oil major Exxon MobilCorp is mulling a 7 billion pound ($10.9 billion)takeover of Kurdistan-focused explorer Gulf Keystone Petroleum, the Independent on Sunday reported.

Title: Oil falls a second day in volatile expiry trade
Body: New York - Oil fell a second straight day on Thursday in light volume trading, giving up early gains as investors remained cautious about prospects for economic growth in Europe and China. |Â

Title: UPDATE 1-Venezuela sees oil claim verdicts this year
Body: CARACAS, Nov 28 Venezuela expects verdicts inhigh-profile international compensation claims from oil majorsExxon Mobil and Conoco Phillips later thisyear, Energy Minister Rafael Ramirez said on Monday.

Title: UPDATE 2-Imperial Oil sees no Syncrude expansion before 2020,UPDATE 1-U.S. says hopes Iraq, Exxon can resolve dispute
Body: * Imperial wants to focus on reliability of base operation,WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 The U.S. State Departmentsaid on Wednesday it hopes Iraq and Exxon-Mobil Corp. will resolve their dispute in a way that will not undercut thefuture development of Iraq's oil resources.

Title: Oil slips on Europe concern, posts second weekly loss
Body: NEW YORK Oil edged lower in volatile trading on Friday, posting a second consecutive weekly loss as caution about Europe's debt crisis and year-end positioning continued to spark selling into rallies. |Â

Title: Oil edges up on supply worry; EU, North Korea eyed,Gulf Keystone not talking to Exxon on $11 billion sale,No Gulf Keystone bid talks with Exxon: source,No Gulf Keystone bid talks with Exxon-source
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices rose on Monday in choppy trading as protests in Kazakhstan raised fears of supply disruption even as concerns about Europe's debt crisis and uncertainty about North Korea after the death of leader Kim Jong-il kept investors cautious. |Â ,LONDON Explorer Gulf Keystone Petroleum  said it was not in talks with U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil Corp  about a 7 billion pounds ($11 billion) sale, scotching a newspaper report that sent the Kurdistan-focused group's shares 24 percent higher.,LONDON Explorer Gulf Keystone Petroleum  is not in talks with U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil Corp  about a 7 billion pounds ($10.9 billion) sale of the Kurdistan-focused group, a source familiar with the company's thinking said.,LONDON, Dec 19 Explorer Gulf KeystonePetroleum is not in talks with U.S. oil major ExxonMobil Corp about a 7 billion pounds ($10.9 billion) saleof the Kurdistan-focused group, a source familiar with thecompany's thinking said.

Title: Oil rises as U.S. stockpiles slump to near 3-year low,Total buys Exxon out of Antwerp chemicals plant
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices rose for a third straight day on Wednesday as U.S. crude inventories dropped to their lowest in nearly three years, overshadowing worries about the euro zone debt crisis. |Â ,PARIS, Dec 21 A subsidiary of oil majorTotal has agreed to buy Exxon Mobil's 35percent stake in Fina Antwerp Olefins, a Belgian chemicalsplant, for an undisclosed amount, the French group said onWednesday.

Title: Oil up on supply worry, supportive U.S. data
Body: NEW YORK Oil rose for a fourth straight day on Thursday in thin, choppy trading on fears of potential supply disruptions from Iraq and Iran and supportive U.S. economic data. |Â

Title: Oil up on supportive economic data, supply worry
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices rose on Tuesday, posting the biggest percentage rise since October, on supportive economic data that also lifted the euro and equities, coupled with worries about potential supply disruptions in Iran and Kazakhstan. |Â

Title: Oil rises on supply worries, supportive data
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices rose for a fifth straight day on Friday, on concerns about potential supply disruptions in Iran and Iraq and recent signs of a strengthening U.S. economy. |Â

Title: Oil rises on Iran warning on Strait of Hormuz
Body: NEW YORK Oil rose for a sixth straight session on Tuesday as Iran's threat to stop oil moving through the Strait of Hormuz added to concerns about potential threats to supplies from the region. |Â

Title: Oil falls on dollar's rise, Wall Street pullback
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices fell on Wednesday, snapping a string of six straight sessions of gains as part of a broad sell-off across commodities and equities. |Â

Title: Exxon Mobil sees global CO2 emission peak in 2030,Big Oil says to clean up shale gas business,Exxon sees gas replacing coal as top U.S. power generator - WSJ
Body: Carbon dioxide emissions from energy sources will rise until 2030, when they will level off as fuels such as natural gas replace dirtier supplies of coal, Exxon Mobil said on Thursday.,DOHA, Dec 8 Big oil and gas companies saytheir increasing dominance of shale gas exploration will bringimproved drilling practices and should end the safety lapsesthat have led to environmental opposition to the fast-growing,multi-billion dollar industry.,Dec 8 Natural gas will replace coal as theleading fuel for generating electricity in the United States by2025 due to its easy availability and a drive forcleaner-burning energy, the Wall Street Journal said, citing thelatest long-term outlook from Exxon Mobil Corp.

Title: Oil ends 2011 up 13 percent, third year of gains,UPDATE 1-Russia cuts Sakhalin-1 2012 funds to $2.89 bln-source
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices ended 2011 up 13 percent as a fresh wave of supply concerns capped a year of unrest and disruptions in North Africa and the Middle East that overwhelmed concerns about the economic health of large consuming nations. |Â ,MOSCOW, Dec 30 Russia has approved a 2012budget of $2.89 billion for the ExxonMobil-led Sakhalin-1 oil project, down from $3.26 billion for this year,an industry source told Reuters on Friday.

Title: Venezuela shrinks nationalization payment to Exxon
Body: CARACAS Venezuela's PDVSA said on Monday it will pay Exxon Mobil Corp $255 million in compensation for nationalized assets - less than a third of what the U.S. oil giant said it was awarded by an arbitration panel.

Title: Oil gains a second day after EU reaches Iran sanctions,Exxon to sell most of Japan refining stake: sources,UPDATE 4-Exxon to sell most of Japan refining stake -sources
Body: NEW YORK Brent crude rose for the second straight session Wednesday, closing at a seven-week high after the European Union reached a preliminary agreement to ban imports of Iranian crude, escalating tensions in the West's standoff with Tehran that has gripped oil markets for weeks. |Â ,TOKYO U.S. oil group ExxonMobil  is in talks to sell most of its 50 percent stake in Japanese refiner TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK , in a deal that could be worth as much as $5 billion, four sources with knowledge of the matter said.,* Move part of Exxon's global strategy to focus on upstreamassets

Title: Government, Exxon reach deal on disputed Gulf leases
Body: WASHINGTON Exxon Mobil Corp and the government struck a deal on Friday that would allow the company to move ahead with development of a field in the Gulf of Mexico estimated to yield tens of billions of dollars of oil.

Title: Oil jumps 4 percent on Iran anxiety
Body: NEW YORK Oil prices surged on Tuesday, with U.S. crude hitting the highest settlement since May, fueled by strong economic data from the United States and China and mounting concern about supply disruption from Iran. |Â

Title: Venezuela will not recognize World Bank ruling in Exxon case,Venezuela will not recognize World Bank ruling in Exxon case
Body: CARACAS Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez said on Sunday that his country would not recognize any ruling by a World Bank tribunal in a multibillion-dollar arbitration case with Exxon Mobil Corp.,CARACAS Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez said on Sunday that his country would not recognize a ruling by a World Bank tribunal in a multibillion-dollar arbitration case with Exxon Mobil Corp .

Title: Exxon Mobil, Petrom start drilling Romania well,Maersk oil services unit wins 1.5 bln DKK contracts,Venezuela will not recognize World Bank ruling in Exxon case
Body: VIENNA, Jan 9 Exxon Mobil andPetrom have started exploratory drilling on Romania'sfirst deepwater well in the Black Sea, the Romanian group ownedby Austria's OMV said on Monday.,COPENHAGEN, Jan 9 Maersk Supply Service, aunit of Danish shipping and oil group A.P. Moller-Maersk, has won four contracts worth a combined 1.5billion crowns ($256.51 million) from Petrobras andExxonMobil, Maersk said on Monday.,CARACAS Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez said on Sunday that his country would not recognize any ruling by a World Bank tribunal in a multibillion-dollar arbitration case with Exxon Mobil Corp.

Title: Oil rises on shortcovering, market eyes Iran
Body: NEW YORK Oil rose on Thursday as gains in the stock market and shortcovering helped shake off early losses caused by a rise in U.S. crude stockpiles. |Â

Title: Exxon plans Rotterdam refinery work in Jan -trade
Body: LONDON, Jan 12 Exxon Mobil plansto halt middle distillate loadings at its Rotterdam refinery forfour days on Jan. 17 to allow for maintenance work, tradesources said on Thursday.

Title: ExxonMobil to press on with German shale gas
Body: FRANKFURT, Jan 27 U.S. ExxonMobil will continue to push for unconventional gas exploration inGermany alongside conventional gas production, despitescepticism over new drilling methods, its Europe chief said onFriday.

Title: Exxon to sell part of Tonen stake for $3.9 billion: sources
Body: TOKYO Exxon Mobil  plans to sell a large part of its 50 percent stake in TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK  back to its Japanese refining partner in a deal that could be worth about 300 billion yen ($3.9 billion), and will make an announcement as early as Monday, four sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

Title: Exxon wins less than expected from Venezuela dispute,Exxon  awarded $908 million in Venezuela dispute
Body: CARACAS An arbitration panel has awarded U.S. oil giant Exxon Mobil Corp $908 million in compensation for Venezuela's 2007 nationalization of its assets, less than 10 percent of what the company sought in a long legal battle with the OPEC nation.,CARACAS An international arbitration panel has awarded U.S. oil giant Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) $908 million in compensation for Venezuela's 2007 nationalization of assets, less than 10 percent of what it sought in a dispute that pitted a top global oil company against one of the world's largest oil exporters.

Title: INSIGHT Oil industry sees no threat from electric car
Body: LONDON, Jan 29 The biggest oil companiesin the world have calculated that few, if any, of today'sdrivers will see electric cars outnumber gasoline and dieselmodels in their lifetimes.

Title: UPDATE 2-TonenGeneral says Exxon deal to speed decisions,PRESS DIGEST - New York Times - Jan 30,Tonen: Buyout of Exxon stake not due to government re-alignment,CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Tonen: $4 bln buyout of Exxon stake not due to govt,Tonen: considering how to cut oil refining capacity
Body: * TonenGeneral needs to meet govt rules to improvecompetitiveness,Jan 30 The New York Times reported thefollowing stories on its business pages on Monday. Reuters hasnot verified these stories and does not vouch for theiraccuracy.,TOKYO Japanese refiner TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK  said on Monday its decision to buy out a controlling stake in it held by U.S. oil major ExxonMobil  for nearly $4 billion was not triggered by Tokyo's moves to force industry re-alignment.,TOKYO, Jan 30 Japanese refinerTonenGeneral Sekiyu KK said on Monday its decision tobuy out a controlling stake in it held by U.S. oil majorExxonMobil for nearly $4 billion was not triggered byTokyo's moves to force industry re-alignment.,TOKYO, Jan 30 Japan's second-largestrefiner TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK said on Monday it isconsidering how to reduce its oil refining capacity, taking intoaccount how fast domestic demand is projected to fall.

Title: Total close to securing Kurdistan oil rights - report,Tonen buys 99 percent of refinery stake from ExxonMobil,TonenGeneral to buy most of its shares owned by Exxon Mobil,UPDATE 1-Tonen buys 99 pct of refinery stake from ExxonMobil for $3.94 bln
Body: LONDON, Jan 29 French oil firm Total is close to securing exploration rights over severaloil and gas blocks in Iraqi Kurdistan, the Sunday Timesreported.,TOKYO Japan's second largest refiner TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK  said on Sunday it will buy 99 percent of the shares in ExxonMobil's  Japanese unit, ExxonMobil Yugen Kaisha, for 302 billion yen ($3.94 billion) to improve efficiency.,TOKYO, Jan 29 Japan's second largestrefiner TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK said on Sunday it willbuy 99 percent of the shares in ExxonMobil's (XOM.N) Japanesesubsidiary, ExxonMobil Yugen Kaisha, for 302 billion yen ($3.94billion).,* ExxonMobil to retain 22 pct of voting shares inTonenGeneral

Title: Exxon narrowly beats, but production falls short,UPDATE 1-Baghdad no legal ground to cancel Exxon deal-lawmaker,Baghdad no legal ground to cancel Exxon deal-lawmaker
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp reported quarterly earnings that narrowly beat expectations, on higher oil prices and asset sales of about $1 billion, but the company's shares dropped nearly 2 percent as its oil and gas production fell short of estimates.,LONDON, Jan 31 Baghdad has no legal rightto cancel a major oil contract with Exxon Mobil inretaliation for its involvement in semi-autonomous Kurdistan,the head of Iraq's parliamentary oil and energy committee saidon Tuesday.,LONDON, Jan 31 Baghdad has no legal rightto cancel a major oil contract with Exxon Mobil inretaliation for its involvement in semi-autonomous Kurdistan,the head of Iraq's parliamentary oil and energy committee saidon Tuesday.

Title: India panel to consider ONGC share sale this month-source
Body: NEW DELHI, Feb 6 A panel of Indian federalministers will meet this month to decide on a share sale instate-run oil producer Oil and Natural Gas Corp, andcould consider the share auction route, a source in the oilministry said.

Title: ExxonMobil, Petrom find gas in Black Sea well
Body: VIENNA, Feb 3 ExxonMobil and OMV unit Petrom have detected natural gas in the Domino-1well they are drilling in the Romanian sector of the Black Sea,Petrom said on Friday.

Title: UPDATE 2-INTERVIEW-Iraq warns Total over Kurdistan deals
Body: * Iraq says Exxon out of 4th bidding round for now (Adds interview tag)

Title: UPDATE 1-Statoil find adds to East Africa gas hopes
Body: OSLO, Feb 17 Norwegian oil and gas firmStatoil has found natural gas offshore Tanzania,marking the latest discovery which is rapidly making east Africaa key gas hub on the doorstep of Asia's fast growing markets.

Title: Venezuela's PDVSA says paid $250 mln compensation to Exxon,Exxon says FCC shut at Beaumont refinery for repairs
Body: Feb 15 Venezuela's state oil company PDVSAsaid on Wednesday it had paid Exxon Mobil Corp about$250 million in compensation for nationalized assets to complywith an arbitration panel.,HOUSTON, Feb 15 Exxon Mobil Corp's 344,500 barrel per day (bpd) Beaumont, Texas, refinery said onWednesday a gasoline-producing fluidic catalytic cracking unithad been taken out of production for "minor equipment repairs."

Title: UPDATE 1-TonenGeneral to detail refinery plan by late 2012,TonenGeneral: refinery plan late 2012 at earliest
Body: * Hopes refinery shutdown won't be necessary- exec (Adds details),TOKYO, Feb 14 Exxon Mobil's grouprefiner in Japan, TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK, is unlikelyto give details on how it will meet the Japanese tradeministry's requirements to improve the efficiency of itsrefining units until at least late 2012, an executive said onTuesday.

Title: UPDATE 2-India to auction stakes in state-run companies,India panel decides to auction ONGC shares-oil min,Exxon reports flaring at Channahon, IL, refinery
Body: * Ministers' panel clear sale of shares through auction inONGC,NEW DELHI, Feb 15 A panel of Indianministers has approved a plan to sell shares in state-runrefiner Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) throughan auction, Oil Minister S. Jaipal Reddy said on Wednesday.,Feb 15 Exxon Mobil reported therelease of an unknown amount of nitrogen dioxide due to flaringat its 238,600 barrel-per-day refinery in Channahon, Illinois,according to a filing with regulators.

Title: UPDATE 2-Exxon expects annual investment of $37 bln a year,UPDATE 1-Exxon expects annual investment of $37 bln a year
Body: Feb 24 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's largest publicly traded oil company, now expects toinvest $37 billion annually over the next several years, comingin at the top of a previous range and in line with an industrytrend toward robust spending.,Feb 24 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's largest publicly traded oil company, expects to investabout $37 billion annually for the next several years, accordingto its annual report.

Title: Poland may tax shale gas in 2015, official says,UPDATE 1-Exxon signs Nigeria oil renewals, dispute ends,Petrom/Exxon Black Sea well finds huge gas field-OMV,Exxon signs Nigerian license renewals, dispute over
Body: WARSAW, Feb 22 Poland may tax shale gasproduction as of 2015, an official said on Wednesday, as thecountry hopes future extraction of the commodity would generatefresh state budget revenues on top of boosting its energysecurity.,* Oil bill has been stuck in assembly, holding backinvestment,VIENNA, Feb 22 An offshore Black Sea welljointly owned by ExxonMobil and OMV's Petromunit has discovered what could be the biggest gas find in OMV'shistory, OMV Chief Executive Gerhard Roiss told reporters onWednesday.,ABUJA, Feb 22 U.S. energy giant ExxonMobil signed 20-year oil license renewals on Nigerianassets producing around 550,000 barrels per day on Wednesday,the country manager said, ending months of disputes over them.

Title: Exxon tempers European shale gas enthusiasm,Exxon prevents Baytown HCU shutdown after false alarm,Exxon says Baton Rouge refinery ops normal after upset,Exxon Baton Rouge refinery reports malfunction -filing,Exxon Beaumont refinery returns coker to normal ops -filing
Body: LONDON, Feb 20 U.S. oil group Exxon Mobil sought to cool predictions of a European shale gasrevolution, saying commercial production was at least five yearsaway and dismissed forecasts offered by other industry playersas "highly speculative".,HOUSTON, Feb 20 Exxon Mobil Corp's 560,640 barrel per day (bpd) Baytown, Texas, refinery preventedthe shutdown of a hydrocracking unit on Sunday after an alarmincorrectly indicated a problem on the unit, a companyspokeswoman said.	    Operators on the unit were able to identify the false alarmand prevent the shutdown from beginning, said Exxon spokeswomanNeely Nelson.	    The Baytown refinery is the largest in the United States.,HOUSTON, Feb 20 Exxon Mobil Corp's 502,000barrel per day (bpd) Baton Rouge, Louisiana, refinery wasoperating normally on Monday after an equipment failure onSaturday, said a company spokeswoman.	    A compressor failed at the refinery on Saturday and wasfixed the same day, said Exxon spokeswoman Jennifer Hughes. Shedid not identify on which unit the compressor was located. Thecompressor failure triggered flaring at the refinery.	    The Baton Rouge refinery is the second larg,HOUSTON, Feb 19 Exxon Mobil Corp's 502,000 barrel per day (bpd) refinery at Baton Rouge, Louisiana,reported an equipment failure that triggered flaring onSaturday, according to a notice filed by the refinery withfederal and state pollution regulators.,HOUSTON, Feb 19 Exxon Mobil Corp's 344,500 barrel per day (bpd) Beaumont, Texas, refinery returneda coking unit to normal operations on Sunday following acompressor malfunction, according to a notice the refinery filedwith Texas pollution regulators.

Title: India rekindles selloff plan with $2.5 billion ONGC sale
Body: MUMBAI India is set to raise at least $2.5 billion selling a 5 percent stake in Oil and Natural Gas Corp (ONGC) , aiming to patch up its widening fiscal deficit and revive its stalled privatization agenda.

Title: Exxon CEO says more fracking rules hinder development,UPDATE 1-Exxon CEO says more fracking rules hinder development,PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - March 9
Body: HOUSTON State and local regulations in shale oil- and natural gas-rich plays across the United States provide sufficient oversight, compared to the "dysfunctional" federal layers that could hinder development as well as the economic recovery, Exxon Mobil Corp  Chief Executive Rex Tillerson said on Friday.,HOUSTON, March 9 State and localregulations in shale oil- and natural gas-rich plays across theUnited States provides sufficient oversight while adding federallayers hinders development, Exxon Mobil Corp ChiefExecutive Rex Tillerson said on Friday.,ExxonMobil, the world's largest private sector oilcompany by production, has scaled back its projections foroutput growth during the next few years, as contracts with thecountries where it operates constrain its expansion.

Title: Lawmakers urge crackdown on oil speculators,Romania gas field could start output by 2017-president

Body: NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp  said its 2012 oil and natural gas output would drop 3 percent from last year even as it increases spending to bring several large new projects on line, and its shares fell 1.2 percent.,NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp  said its 2012 oil and natural gas output would drop 3 percent from last year even as it increases spending to bring several large new projects on line, and its shares fell 1 percent.,(Adds dropped word to clarify ExxonMobil tender was notawarded)	    LONDON, March 8 Spot differentials forApril loading Nigerian light crude were supported on Thursday assome demand started emerging from the United States, having beendented earlier this week by the limited arbitrage opportunitiesand India's shift to seek for May loading barrels.	    "Bits and pieces of demand is coming from the U.S., slowlybut surely," a trader said. "The volume is no more than usual.But Ang,NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp  said its 2012 oil and natural gas output would drop 3 percent from last year even as it increases spending to bring several large new projects on line, and its shares fell 1 percent.,HOUSTON, March 8 Exxon Mobil Corp completed the restart of the 117,700-barrels-per-daygasoline-producing fluidic catalytic cracking unit at its344,500-bpd Beaumont, Texas refinery by Thursday, a companyspokeswoman said.,HOUSTON, March 8 Exxon Mobil Corp completed the restart of the 117,700-barrels-per-daygasoline-producing fluidic catalytic cracking unit at its344,500-bpd Beaumont, Texas refinery by Thursday, a companyspokeswoman said.,NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp  said on Thursday its 2012 oil and natural gas output would drop 3 percent from last year even as it increases spending to bring several large new projects on line, pushing its shares lower.,NEW YORK, March 8 Exxon Mobil Corp expects its 2012 oil and natural gas output to drop 3 percentfrom 2011 levels, although production volumes should grow by anaverage of 1 to 2 percent annually through 2016.,March 8 Exxon Mobil Corp expectsits 2012 oil and natural gas output to drop 3 percent from 2011levels, although production volumes should grow by an average of1 to 2 percent annually through 2016.

Title: CLP in talks to buy Exxon stake in HK power firm
Body: HONG KONG, March 15 Hong Kong-basedregional power utility CLP Holdings and ChinaSouthern Power Grid Co Ltd are in talks to acquire a 60 percentstake in a local power joint venture held by ExxonMobil EnergyLtd, a subsidiary of Exxon Mobil Corp, CLP said in astatement on Thursday.

Title: Exxon shuts gas compressor at Channahon refinery
Body: March 13 Exxon Mobil Corp onTuesday announced the shutdown of a gas compressor unit at its238,600-barrel-per-day refinery in Channahon, Illinois,according to a filing with the U.S. National Response Center.

Title: Iraq sets deadline for Exxon on Kurdistan oil deals,Insight: Papua New Guinea mountain disaster questions Exxon,INSIGHT-Papua New Guinea mountain disaster asks questions of Exxon
Body: ,A deadly landslide in the mountains of Papua New Guinea, near where U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil is building a $15.7 billion gas project, is raising fresh questions about the global energy industry's scramble for ever harder-to-reach resources.,March 6 A deadly landslide in themountains of Papua New Guinea, near where U.S. oil major ExxonMobil is building a $15.7 billion gas project, israising fresh questions about the global energy industry'sscramble for ever harder-to-reach resources.

Title: Exxon Joliet, Illinois, refinery reports flaring
Body: HOUSTON, March 18 Exxon Mobil Corp's 238,600 barrel per day Joliet, Illinois, refinery reportedflaring on Saturday, according to a notice the refinery filedwith Illinois pollution regulators.

Title: Kurds say Exxon still working in North Iraq,UPDATE 1-Kurds say Exxon still working in N. Iraq,Kurds say Exxon still working in N. Iraq,Iraq says Exxon Mobil freezes Kurdistan deal

Body: March 23 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media on Friday:,PARIS Exxon Mobil Corp  has put 78 French gas stations on the block, part of a wider effort to sell out of such activities in Europe following similar moves in the United States, financial daily Les Echos reported on Friday.,PARIS, March 23 Exxon Mobil Corp has put78 French gas stations on the block, part of a wider effort tosell out of such activities in Europe following similar moves inthe United States, financial daily Les Echos reported on Friday.,NEW DELHI, March 23 A consortium of Indianpublic-sector energy companies, Oil and Natural Gas Corp and GAIL India, have not yet submitted a bidfor Africa-focused gas explorer Cove Energy, a companysource said on Friday.

Body: CALGARY, Alberta, March 30 TransCanada Corp said on Friday it will concentrate its planning effortsfor an Alaska natural gas pipeline on a $26 billion route thatwould take the fuel to an Alaska liquefied natural gas facility,leaving a more expensive route to Alberta as only an alternativeoption for the project.,MUMBAI India's Oil and Natural Gas Corp  and U.S. oil company ConocoPhillips  will sign a pact on Friday to explore and develop shale gas and look for opportunities in deepwater exploration, the Indian state-run explorer said in a statement.,MUMBAI, March 30 India's Oil and Natural GasCorp and U.S. oil company ConocoPhillips willsign a pact on Friday to explore and develop shale gas and lookfor opportunities in deepwater exploration, the Indian state-runexplorer said in a statement.

Title: Exxon Beaumont: pump fails at gas plant -filing
Body: April 2 Exxon Mobil Corp reported a pumpin the gas compressor plant failed late Monday at its 344,500barrel-per-day refinery in Beaumont, Texas.

Body: HOUSTON, April 9 Chesapeake Energy Corp said on Monday it has struck three deals that will raise a totalof $2.6 billion, a cash infusion needed by the U.S. oil and gascompany as it faces a funding shortfall this year.,BAGHDAD, April 9 OPEC is seeking a balance inworld oil prices, but political instability rather thanproduction issues are affecting the market price, Iraqi OilMinister Abdul Kareem Luaibi said on Monday.

Title: Exxon Beaumont Refinery gasoline unit resumes ops -filing
Body: HOUSTON, April 15 Exxon Mobil Corp's 344,500 barrel per day (bpd) Beaumont, Texas, refinery returneda gasoline-producing fluidic catalytic cracking unit toproduction on Saturday after a compressor malfunction, accordingto a notice the refinery filed with state pollution regulators.
