Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon arm owes Nigeria $95 mln in subsidy payments-parliament
Body: ABUJA, April 20 Nigeria's anti-corruption agencyshould recover 14.93 billion naira ($95.04 million) in fuelsubsidy payments received by Exxon Mobil's Nigeriandownstream subsidiary, a parliamentary investigation this weeksaid.

Title: UPDATE 2-Exxon boosts dividend 21 pct, Chevron's up 11 pct,Exxon Mobil boosts quarterly dividend 21 percent,Exxon Mobil boosts quarterly dividend 21 percent,SABIC, Exxon to take Saudi rubber plant FID in July,UPDATE 1-Nimin Energy to dissolve, sells Wyoming assets,Exclusive: Eni and Rosneft to team up in Russian Arctic,Eni and Rosneft to agree on Russian oil and gas - sources,Kvaerner gets Canadian contract worth up to $150 mln
Body: April 25 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, raised its quarterlydividend by 21 percent on We dnesday, bowing to sustainedpressure from investors and Wall Street analysts.,Exxon Mobil Corp  raised its quarterly dividend 21 percent on Wednesday, bowing to sustained pressure from investors and Wall Street analysts.,April 25 Exxon Mobil Corp raised itsquarterly dividend 21 percent on Wednesday to 57 cents pershare, a day before it is set to post quarterly results.,JUBAIL, Saudi Arabia, April 25 Saudi BasicIndustries Corp (SABIC) and Exxon Mobil planto make a final investment decision on their multi-billiondollar synthetic rubber project in Saudi Arabia in July, SABIC'schief executive said on Wednesday.,* Sells Wyoming asset to BreitBurn Partners for about $98mln,MOSCOW Italy's Eni  and Rosneft  are expected to agree on Wednesday to search for oil and gas in the Russian Arctic, in Russia's second major offshore deal in two weeks after U.S. ExxonMobil  joined forces with the state oil firm.,MOSCOW, April 25 Italy's Eni andRosneft are expected on Wednesday to sign an agreementto jointly tap Russian offshore oil and gas deposits in theArctic and Black Sea, industry sources told Reuters.,OSLO, April 25 Norwegian oil services firmKvaerner said one of its subsidiaries secured acontract with ExxonMobil in Canada worth between $125million and $150 million to the parent firm.

Title: US STOCKS-Wall St gains but Exxon and Aetna drop,WRAPUP 2-Production growth lifts Shell; Exxon falls short,US STOCKS-S&P steady after data; Exxon, Aetna drop,Exxon: Argentina operations going as planned,Production growth lifts Shell; Exxon falls short,Exxon Mobil quarterly profit falls,Exxon Mobil reports problem at Illinois refinery
Body: NEW YORK, April 26 U.S. stocks advanced inchoppy trade on Thursday as another batch of positive earningsand a strong housing report put equities on track for a thirdstraight day of gains.,April 26 First-quarter earnings from the top twopublicly traded oil companies showed clearly both the challengesand potential gains of growing output even a little, with ExxonMobil Corp's production declining and Royal Dutch ShellPlc easily beating estimates.,NEW YORK, April 26 U.S. stocks edged higher inchoppy trade on Thursday as another batch of positive earningsand a strong housing report put equities on track for a thirdstraight day of gains.,NEW YORK, April 26 Exxon Mobil said itsoperations in Argentina were not affected in the first quarter,despite the government move to seize control of the Spanish oilcompany YPF.,Quarterly earnings from the top two publicly traded oil companies on Thursday showed clearly both the challenge and potential gains of growing output, with Exxon Mobil Corp falling short and Royal Dutch Shell Plc easily beating estimates.,April 26 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, posted a lowerfirst-quarter profit on Thursday.,April 26 Exxon Mobil reported theshutdown of unspecified equipment following a malfunction at its238,600-barrel-per-day refinery in Joliet, Illinois, a noticefiled with pollution regulators showed on Thursday.

Title: Iraqi Kurdistan says Exxon committed to oil deal,Iraqi Kurdistan says Exxon committed to oil deal
Body: ARBIL, Iraq The chief executive of U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil  on Thursday reaffirmed the company's commitment to its oil deal with Iraq's autonomous northern Kurdish region, a statement from the Kurdish presidency website said.,ARBIL, Iraq, April 6 The chief executive of U.S.oil major Exxon Mobil on Thursday reaffirmed thecompany's commitment to its oil deal with Iraq's autonomousnorthern Kurdish region, a statement from the Kurdish presidencywebsite said.

Title: Exxon Joliet refinery starts up unit -filing
Body: HOUSTON, April 29 Exxon Mobil Corp's 238,600 barrel per day (bpd) Joliet, Illinois, refinerycompleted the startup of an unidentified unit on Friday,according to a notice the refinery filed with Illinois pollutionregulators.

Title: US Cash Crude-Differentials mixed after pipeline closure,Exxon Mobil shuts Louisiana oil pipeline after leak,U.S. pipeline regulator probing Exxon pipeline leak,Exxon: Shut pipe no impact on Baton Rouge refinery,UPDATE 5-Exxon Mobil shuts Louisiana oil pipeline after leak,Exxon: Shut pipe no impact on Baton Rouge refinery,US pipeline regulator probing Exxon pipeline leak,CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Exxon Mobil pipeline spills oil in Louisiana,Exxon Mobil pipeline spills oil in Louisiana
Body: * Bonito trades up 25 cents at WTI plus $13.65    * LLS trades down 50 cents at WTI plus $15.85    * Exxon closes Louisiana crude pipeline after leak    NEW YORK, April 30 U.S. cash crude differentialswere mixed on Monday after a pipeline leak closed Exxon Mobil'sNorth pipeline which carries crude from the St. James terminalin Louisiana up to its Baton Rouge refinery.   Exxon Mobil Corp shut the 160,000 barrel-per-day(bpd) North Line crude oil pipeline after a leak spilled 1,Exxon Mobil Corp has shut the 160,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) North Line crude oil pipeline in Louisiana after a leak spilled 1,900 barrels of crude oil in a rural area over the weekend, affecting a conduit that supplies the nation's third-largest refinery.,WASHINGTON The U.S. pipeline regulator is closely monitoring the shutdown of an Exxon Mobil pipeline after a leak in Louisiana over the weekend, an agency spokeswoman said on Monday.,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp said the shut North Line Pipeline was not immediately affecting the company's 502,000 barrel per day (bpd) Baton Rouge refinery on Monday.,* 22-inch line delivers crude to Exxon Baton Rouge Refinery,4 others,HOUSTON, April 30 Exxon Mobil Corp saidthe shut North Line Pipeline was not immediately affecting thecompany's 502,000 barrel per day (bpd) Baton Rouge refinery onMonday.,WASHINGTON, April 30 The U.S. pipeline regulatoris closely monitoring the shutdown of an Exxon Mobil pipeline after a leak in Louisiana over the weekend, an agencyspokeswoman said on Monday.,April 30 Exxon Mobil scrambled on Mondayto clean up 1,900 barrels of crude oil that leaked from apipeline in a rural area near Torbert, Louisiana over theweekend.,April 30 Exxon Mobil said it wascleaning up 1,900 barrels of crude oil that leaked from apipeline in a rural area near Tolbert, Louisiana over theweekend.

Title: Exxon: Shut pipe not affecting Baton Rouge refinery production,UPDATE 1-Exxon: Shut pipe not affecting Baton Rouge refinery production,US Cash Crude-Differentials weaker as WTI gains on Brent,Exxon expects restart of South Line pipeline this week
Body: Production at Exxon Mobil Corp's  502,000 barrel per day (bpd) Baton Rouge, Louisiana, refinery continued to be unaffected on Tuesday by a shut key pipeline.,May 1 Production at Exxon Mobil Corp's 502,000 barrel per day (bpd) Baton Rouge, Louisiana, refinerycontinued to be unaffected on Tuesday by a shut key pipeline.	    The Baton Rouge refinery, the nation's third largest, is oneof five refineries supplied by the 160,000 bpd North Linepipeline, which was shut late Saturday by a 1,900-barrel leaknear Torbert, Louisiana.	    "Exxon Mobil Pipeline Co's focus is on cleanup operations,"said Exxon spokeswoman Rachael Moore on Tuesday.,* LLS sells for $15.40 over WTI, off $1 from Monday    * Mars sour trades at $9.70, down 65 cents    * Exxon North Line pipeline still shut after weekend leak    * Transatlantic spread narrows about $1    HOUSTON, May 1 U.S. cash crude differentialsweakened on Tuesday as the transatlantic spread narrowed $1 andExxon's North Line pipeline remained shut.	    Light Louisiana Sweet sold for $15.40 a barrel overWest Texas Intermediate, $1 weaker than on Monday. Marssour traded a,May 1 Exxon Mobil Corp on Tuesday saidthere was no change in the status of the North Line pipeline butexpects the South Line portion of the HLS (Heavy LouisianaSweet) pipeline to restart operations this week.

Title: US Cash Crude-Lower as trans-Atlantic arb moves in,Nigerian naira ends flat as oil firms sell dollars
Body: * LLS sells for $14.75 over WTI, off 65 cents from Tuesday    * Transatlantic narrows to 3 month lows    By Janet McGurty	    NEW YORK, May 2 U.S. cash crude differentialsweakened on Wednesday as the trans-Atlantic spread narrowed themost since February 1. 	    Light Louisiana Sweet sold for $14.75 a barrel overWest Texas Intermediate, 65 cents weaker than on Tuesday.	    Exxon Mobil said its North Line remained shut withno target date for restart. It was shut after a leak ,LAGOS, May 2 The Nigerian naira wasstable on both the interbank market and at the official windowon Wednesday as sales of about $194 million by two multinationaloil companies to some lenders helped counter surging demand fordollars among importers.

Title: US Cash Crude-Grades rise on widening arbitrage,Steve Coll on Exxon Mobil's oil empire,BOOK TALK: Steve Coll on Exxon Mobil's oil empire
Body: * WTI at Midland rises $2 to WTI minus $3.75    * LLS sells for 80 cents higher at WTI plus $15.55    * Mars sells for WTI plus $9.55, up $1.55    * Transatlantic arbitrage gains 56 cents    By Janet McGurty	    NEW YORK, May 3 U.S. cash crude differentialsrose on Thursday as the transatlantic spread began to move backout, with MidContinent  grades getting a lot of play due to theoutage of Exxon's North Line which carries Gulf of Mexicocrudes.    The 22-inch line originate,Exxon Mobil's vast size and massive profits have often put the oil giant in the crosshairs of critics, and its strict adherence to company protocols and philosophy has created an image of the company as impervious to outside pressure.,May 3 Exxon Mobil's vast size and massiveprofits have often put the oil giant in the crosshairs ofcritics, and its strict adherence to company protocols andphilosophy has created an image of the company as impervious tooutside pressure.

Title: UPDATE 2-US court rules for ExxonMobil over pipeline rates,Exxon Baytown crude unit malfunctions -filing,Analysis: Exxon seen primed for big dividend hike,Greenpeace protests Arctic drilling in Russia, 23 detained,Court rules for ExxonMobil over pipeline rates,Greenpeace protests Arctic drilling in Russia, 23 detained,US court rules for ExxonMobil over pipeline rates
Body: WASHINGTON, April 17 A U.S. appeals court onTuesday reversed a decision by the Federal Energy RegulatoryCommission that had ruled a crude oil pipeline in the centralUnited States owned by Exxon Mobil Corp had marketpower, and thus the rates it charged had to be capped.,April 17 Exxon Mobil Corp on Tuesdayreported a crude distillation unit upset at its Baytown, Texas,facility, according to a filing with state pollution regulators.,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp  may announce an unusually large dividend increase as the world's largest publicly traded oil company faces pressure from Wall Street and shareholders to match the payout of smaller peer Chevron Corp , analysts said.,MOSCOW Russian police detained two dozen Greenpeace activists on Tuesday for protesting against Arctic drilling after Russia's largest oil producer signed a landmark deal with Exxon Mobil Corp to jointly prospect for oil in the far north.,WASHINGTON Appeals court on Tuesday reversed a decision by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission that had ruled a crude oil pipeline owned by Exxon Mobil Corp  had market power, and thus the rates it charged had to be capped.,MOSCOW, April 17 Russian police detained twodozen Greenpeace activists on Tuesday for protesting againstArctic drilling after Russia's largest oil producer signed alandmark deal with Exxon Mobil Corp to jointly prospectfor oil in the far north.,WASHINGTON, April 17 A U.S. appeals court onTuesday reversed a decision by the Federal Energy RegulatoryCommission that had ruled a crude oil pipeline owned by ExxonMobil Corp had market power, and thus the rates itcharged had to be capped.

Title: ExxonMobil says restarted North, South lines in Louisiana
Body: HOUSTON, May 7 Exxon Mobil has restarted boththe North and South Line oil pipelines in Louisiana after aspill and integrity questions, a source in the control roomsaid.

Title: REFILE-INSIGHT-When the Exxon way stops working,Insight: When the Exxon way stops working
Body: London, May 8 When Exxon boss Rex Tillersonwalked into a meeting with the President of Ghana on thesidelines of the United Nations General Assembly, he thought hewas set to strike a deal with an important new oil producingnation.,London When Exxon boss Rex Tillerson walked into a meeting with the President of Ghana on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly, he thought he was set to strike a deal with an important new oil producing nation.

Title: Exxon needs U.S. approval to restart North Line pipeline,UPDATE 2-Exxon needs US approval to restart North Line pipeline,BRIEF-PHMSA prevents Exxon from restarting Louisiana line,ExxonMobil restarts French refinery after maintenance
Body: NEW YORK ExxonMobil Corp will need federal approval before it can restart its damaged North Line pipeline in Louisiana, where a leak in late April resulted in a spill of more than 1,800 barrels of crude, the U.S. Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) said on Wednesday.,* Exxon is required to submit start-up plans for North Line,May 9 Pipeline and Hazardous Materials SafetyAdministration:		    * Says it issued a corrective action order to Exxon lastnight as a result of the April 28, 2012 failure in Louisiana 	        * Says the order prevents Exxon from restarting operationson the failed segment until the agency is satisfied with repairs,PARIS, May 9 ExxonMobil's 240,000barrels per day Port-Jerome refinery in France has restartedafter the largest ever maintenance operation on the site, thecompany said on Wednesday.

Title: Exxon says repairs scheduled on North Line this week
Body: May 10 ExxonMobil Corp on Thursday saidrepairs are scheduled this week on the damaged North Linepipeline in Louisiana where a leak in late April resulted in aspill of more than 1,800 barrels of crude.

Title: Exxon begins repairs on North Line
Body: May 11 Exxon Mobil Corp on Friday saidthe repairs have begun on the damaged North Line pipeline inLouisiana where a leak in late April resulted in a spill of morethan 1,800 barrels of crude.	    Exxon shut the 198-mile line on April 28 after a leak wasdiscovered in an environmentally sensitive area along the coast.

Title: Exxon Beaumont refinery coker malfunctions -filing
Body: HOUSTON, May 13 A coking unit malfunctioned onSaturday at Exxon Mobil Corp's 344,500 barrel per day(bpd) Beaumont, Texas, refinery, according to a notice therefinery filed with the U.S. National Response Center.

Title: BRIEF - Moody's disclosures on credit ratings of Exxon Mobil
Body: May 17 Moody's disclosures on credit ratings of Exxon Mobil

Title: Analysis: In Iraq, oil majors play north versus south
Body: In the weeks before Iraqi Kurdistan revealed that Exxon Mobil had signed up to explore for oil there, executives at rival Shell faced a dilemma over whether or not to join the U.S. oil major in its foray north and risk angering Baghdad.

Title: Chesapeake plans to sell wells in Wyoming, Colorado,Norway refinery plans for strike impact: ExxonMobil
Body: HOUSTON/NEW YORK Chesapeake Energy Corp has put a half-million acres in Wyoming and Colorado up for sale, as the second-largest U.S. natural gas producer scrambles to raise cash to close a $9 billion to $10 billion funding shortfall.,OSLO, May 24 Norway's Slagen oil refinery nearOslo is working on a contingency plan in case a public sectorstrike, which could also involve shipping pilots, affectsoperations, the ExxonMobil-owned company said onThursday.

Title: Exxon says Beaumont coker back to normal ops
Body: HOUSTON, May 21 The coking unit at Exxon MobilCorp's 344,500 barrel-per-day Beaumont, Texas, refinery hadreturned to normal operation by Monday, a company spokeswomansaid on Monday.

Title: Exxon returning Beaumont HCU to normal ops,UPDATE 1-Statoil to use Seadrill rig offshore Canada,Exxon Beaumont refinery reports ongoing emissions
Body: HOUSTON, May 14 Exxon Mobil Corp's 344,500 barrel-per-day (bpd) Beaumont, Texas, refinery hasrestarted a hydrocracking unit and was working to return it tonormal operation on Monday, a company spokeswoman said.,OSLO, May 14 Statoil is to useSeadrill's semi-submersible West Aquarius deepwaterdrilling rig for 2012-2013 exploration activities offshoreNewfoundland, Canada, leasing the rig from Exxon Mobil.,May 14 Exxon Mobil Corp's 344,500-barrel-per-day (bpd) Beaumont, Texas refinery, reportedongoing emissions after two compressors tripped offline onSunday, a notice the refinery filed with the U.S. NationalResponse Center showed.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon's Hebron project approved by regulators,Exxon's Hebron project approved by regulators,Fracking at top of Chevron, Exxon meetings,WRAPUP 2-Fracking at top of Chevron, Exxon meetings
Body: CALGARY, Alberta, May 31 The Canada-Newfoundlandand Labrador Offshore Petroleum Board said on Thursday itapproved plans by an Exxon Mobil Corp-led group to develop theHebron oil field offshore Newfoundland.,CALGARY, Alberta, May 31 The Canada-Newfoundlandand Labrador Offshore Petroleum Board said on Thursday itapproved plans by an Exxon Mobil Corp-led group to develop theHebron oil field offshore Newfoundland.,SAN RAMON, Calif./DALLAS Investor concerns about hydraulic fracturing at Chevron have eased, in contrast to a slight rise at rival Exxon, as the two largest U.S. oil companies faced growing pressure at shareholder meetings to name independent chairmen to improve governance.,SAN RAMON, Calif./DALLAS, May 30 Investorconcerns about hydraulic fracturing at Chevron have eased, incontrast to a slight rise at rival Exxon, as the two largestU.S. oil companies faced growing pressure at shareholdermeetings to name independent chairmen to improve governance.

Title: Fracking at top of Chevron, Exxon meetings,WRAPUP 1-Fracking at top of Chevron, Exxon meetings,Shareholder support for Exxon executive pay grows,Shareholder support for Exxon executive pay grows
Body: SAN RAMON, Calif./DALLAS Concerns about hydraulic fracturing among investors have eased at Chevron, even as they have increased at Exxon, and pressure to name independent chairmen at the two largest U.S. oil companies has also grown.,SAN RAMON, Calif./DALLAS, May 30 Concerns abouthydraulic fracturing among investors have eased at Chevron, evenas they have increased at Exxon, and pressure to nameindependent chairmen at the two largest U.S. oil companies hasalso grown.,DALLAS Shareholders threw more support behind Exxon Mobil Corp's  executive compensation package following the world's largest publicly traded oil company's effort to seek more input on the matter.,DALLAS, May 30 Shareholders threw more supportbehind Exxon Mobil Corp's executive compensation packagefollowing the world's largest publicly traded oil company'seffort to seek more input on the matter.

Title: Exclusive: Exxon Mobil plans major new chemical plant
Body: NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded energy company, plans to build a multi-billion dollar chemical plant in Texas to take advantage of cheap North American shale gas, according to an environmental filing seen by Reuters.

Title: Exxon Mobil warns red tape risks snuffing out gas boom,UPDATE 2-Exxon Mobil warns red tape risks snuffing out gas boom,Exxon Mobil says may export LNG from the U.S,Exxon Mobil says may export LNG from the U.S.,US WCoast Products - L.A. gasoline gains on Exxon work
Body: KUALA LUMPUR Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly listed energy company, warned on Tuesday that too much government regulation could undermine a rapid global expansion of gas output from a range of unconventional sources.,* Exxon Mobil CEO says governments must avoid tangle ofrules,KUALA LUMPUR Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded energy company, is considering exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG) from the United States, CEO Rex Tillerson said on Tuesday.,KUALA LUMPUR, June 5 Exxon Mobil Corp,the world's largest publicly traded energy company, isconsidering exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG) from theUnited States, CEO Rex Tillerson said on Tuesday.,HOUSTON, June 4 June-delivery CARBOB gasolinerose in the Los Angeles market as Exxon Mobil Corp's 149,500 barrel-per-day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery inTorrance, California, began a planned overhaul scheduled to lastfor several weeks, traders said.

Title: Exxon says Torrance refinery begins planned overhaul
Body: HOUSTON, June 4 Exxon Mobil Corp.'s 149,500-barrel-per-day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery inTorrance, California, began a planned overhaul on Monday that isexpected to last for several weeks.

Title: Nigeria says Shell, Chevron oil licenses renewed by June,UPDATE 1-Nigeria says Shell, Chevron oil licenses renewed by June,Nigeria says Shell, Chevron oil licenses renewed by June
Body: ABUJA Nigeria expects to renew onshore oil licenses with U.S. firm Chevron  and Royal Dutch Shell  by June, its oil minister said on Tuesday, following Exxon Mobil's  renewal in February worth trillions of dollars.,ABUJA, May 22 Nigeria expects to renew onshoreoil licenses with U.S. firm Chevron and Royal DutchShell by June, its oil minister said on Tuesday,following Exxon Mobil's renewal in February worthtrillions of dollars.,ABUJA, May 22 Nigeria expects to renew hugeonshore oil licenses with U.S. firm Chevron and RoyalDutch Shell by June, the oil minister said on Tuesday,following Exxon Mobil's renewal in February worthtrillions of dollars.

Title: Global power of ExxonMobil spotlighted in new Coll book,Union, Exxon scrap over refinery contract, safety,UPDATE 1-Union, Exxon scrap over refinery contract, safety,Union says Exxon stalling Baton Rouge contract talks
Body: NEW YORK, April 27 In early 2006, ExxonMobil wascaught in the middle of a standoff between the authoritarianleader of Chad, Idriss Deby, and Paul Wolfowitz, the head of theWorld Bank, journalist Steve Coll says in his new book on theworld's biggest oil company.,HOUSTON Negotiations for a new contract covering hourly workers at Exxon Mobil Corp's refinery in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, has become a scrap over a proposal on worker safety, The United Steelworkers union (USW) said on Friday.,HOUSTON, April 27 Negotiations for a newcontract covering hourly workers at Exxon Mobil Corp's refinery in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, has become a scrap over aproposal on worker safety, The United Steelworkers union (USW)said on F rid ay.,HOUSTON, April 27 Negotiations for a newcontract covering hourly workers at Exxon Mobil Corp's refinery in Baton Rouge, Louisiana have stalled over adisagreement on worker safety, The United Steelwokers union(USW) said on F rid ay.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon's says Torrance production unimpaired by fire,Small fire quickly put out at Exxon Torrance refinery -official
Body: HOUSTON, June 12 Exxon Mobil Corp. saidon Tuesday that production was unimpaired at its 149,500 barrelper day (bpd) Torrance, California, refinery after a briefMonday afternoon fire that was quickly extinguished by theplant's in-house firefighting department.,HOUSTON, June 12 A small blaze on Mondayafternoon at Exxon Mobil Corp.'s 149,500 barrel per day(bpd) Torrance, California, refinery was quickly extinguished bythe plant's in-house firefighting department, said a spokesmanfor the Torrance Fire Department on Tuesday.

Title: Exxon drops shale exploration plans in Poland: paper,Exxon drops shale exploration plans in Poland-paper
Body: Warsaw Exxon Mobil Corp  has decided not to go ahead with its shale gas exploration projects in Poland because its test wells failed to produce commercial quantities of gas, daily Gazeta Wyborcza reported in its weekend edition.,Warsaw, June 17 Exxon Mobil Corp hasdecided not to go ahead with its shale gas exploration projectsin Poland because its test wells failed to produce commercialquantities of gas, daily Gazeta Wyborcza reported in its weekendedition.

Title: Exxon reports leak at Louisiana plant,CORRECTED (OFFICIAL)-UPDATE 2-Exxon reports leak at Louisiana plant,UPDATE 1-Exxon reports leak from Baton Rouge line,Statoil, ExxonMobil make big gas find off Tanzania
Body: NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp reported a naphtha leak at its Baton Rouge, Louisiana, chemical plant on Thursday, a day after it reported a butane leak from internal piping at its neighboring 502,000 barrel-per-day refinery.,(Official correction to show Butane leak was at the refinery)	    NEW YORK, June 14 Exxon Mobil Corp reported a naphtha leak at its Baton Rouge, Louisiana, chemicalplant on Thursday, a day after it reported a butane leak frominternal piping at its neighboring 502,000 barrel-per-dayrefinery. 	    The company detected and stopped the naphtha leak, whichcontained benzene, within the refinery's wastewater treatmentfacility onsite, said Stephanie Cargile, an ExxonMobilspokeswoman,NEW YORK, June 14 Exxon Mobil Corp reported a leak in a pipeline at its Baton Rouge, Louisiana,chemical plant on Wednesday which released unspecified amountsof benzene, the Louisiana Department of Environmental Qualitysaid on Thursday.,OSLO Norwegian oil firm Statoil  and ExxonMobil  have discovered a large natural gas deposit off the coast of Tanzania and added further resources to another nearby find, Statoil said in a statement on Thursday.

Title: Europe shale push shaken by Exxon's Poland pullout,Europe shale push shaken by Exxon's Poland pullout
Body: WARSAW Europe's most ambitious shale gas plans were in disarray on Monday after U.S. major ExxonMobil  announced it would pull out of exploration projects in Poland.,* Comes days after govt shelved draft shale law publication

Title: Exxon to reconfigure UK plant, close a crude unit,UPDATE 3-Exxon to reconfigure UK plant, close a crude unit,Exxon to reconfigure UK plant, close a crude unit
Body: LONDON U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil  said on Thursday it will reconfigure its Fawley refinery, Britain's largest, permanently decommissioning one crude distillation unit.,* Traders say decommission to cut its capacity by a quarter,LONDON, June 21 U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil said on Thursday it has been looking to reconfigure itsFawley refinery in Britain, permanently decommissioning onecrude distillation unit.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon moving Virginia, Ohio workers to Texas
Body: June 6 Exxon Mobil Corp said onWednesday it will move its trading operation and other officesin Virginia and Ohio to a new campus under construction in Texasas part of an overall consolidation of workers.

Title: Imperial drops Montana mountain pass megaload plan,Imperial drops Montana mountain pass megaload plan,Rosneft ups dividend with an eye on Exxon,Iraq warns France against unsanctioned oil deals,Iraq warns France against unsanctioned oil deals
Body: Imperial Oil Ltd formally withdrew a highly contested plan to truck huge loads of equipment over a mountain pass on the Idaho/Montana border, having already moved them to its Alberta oil sands project via alternative routes.,June 20 Imperial Oil Ltd formallywithdrew a highly contested plan to truck huge loads ofequipment over a mountain pass on the Idaho/Montana border,having already moved them to its Alberta oil sands project viaalternative routes.,ST PETERSBURG, Russia Russian Rosneft's politically powerful chief executive said the state oil company would double its dividend payout for last year, saying he wanted shareholder returns to be competitive with U.S. majors.,BAGHDAD Iraq gave a veiled warning to France's Total  on Wednesday not to make deals with the autonomous Kurdish region without the approval of central government in Baghdad.,BAGHDAD, June 20 Iraq gave a veiled warning toFrance's Total on Wednesday not to make deals with theautonomous Kurdish region without the approval of centralgovernment in Baghdad.

Title: Rosneft in talks to join Exxon in Iraq,UPDATE 1-Rosneft in talks to join Exxon in Iraq,Rosneft in talks to join Exxon in Iraq -paper
Body: MOSCOW Russia's top crude oil producer, Rosneft , has been in talks with ExxonMobil  about teaming up with the U.S. group to tap Iraq's huge West Qurna-1 oilfield, Kommersant daily reported on Friday.,MOSCOW, June 22 Russia's top crude oil producer,Rosneft, has been in talks with ExxonMobil about teaming up with the U.S. group to tap Iraq's huge WestQurna-1 oilfield, Kommersant daily reported on Friday.,MOSCOW, June 22 Russia's top crude oil producer,Rosneft, has been in talks with ExxonMobil over the possibility of teaming up with the American major totap Iraq's huge West Qurna-1 oilfield, Kommersant daily reportedon Friday.

Title: Exxon to restart production, restaff Gulf of Mexico ops,UPDATE 1-Korean, EU firms win SABIC, Exxon project,Exxon to reconfigure UK plant, close a crude unit,CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Exxon to reconfigure UK plant, close a crude unit,Exxon to reconfigure UK plant, close a crude unit,Exxon shuts natural gas output in Gulf due to storm
Body: HOUSTON, June 25 Exxon Mobil Corp saidon Monday that its Gulf of Mexico operations were resumingnormal operations as Tropical Storm Debby headed for Florida'swestern coast, away from most energy installations in the basin.,KHOBAR, Saudi Arabia, June 25 South Korea'sDaelim Industrial, France's Technip andSpain's Tecnicas Reunidas won deals to build a majorsynthetic rubber project in Saudi Arabia for a joint venturebetween Saudi Basic Industries Corp and U.S. Exxon MobilChemical.,LONDON Oil major Exxon Mobil  said on Thursday it will reconfigure its Fawley refinery, Britain's largest, decommissioning one crude distillation unit.,(Corrects to remove word "permanently" in the first paragraph),Corrects to remove word "permanently" in the first paragraph,HOUSTON, June 24 Exxon Mobil Corp. saidon Sunday that it had shut 1,000 barrels per day in oilproduction and 7 million cubic feet in daily natural gas outputdue to the threat of Tropical Storm Debby, according to astatement issued by the company.

Title: US WCoast Products - Gasoline gains on Exxon work
Body: HOUSTON, June 22 Gasoline rose in the LosAngeles spot market on Friday due to continuing work at ExxonMobil Corp's 149,500 barrel per day (bpd) LosAngeles-area refinery in Torrance, California, traders said.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon: refinery leak had no impact on production,Exxon says Torrance refinery breakdown impacts output,Exxon says Torrance refinery breakdown impacts output,Exxon US Gulf ops disrupted by Debby returning to normal,Exxon reports flaring, breakdown at Torrance refinery,Exxon reports leak in line at Baton Rouge, LA, refinery
Body: June 26 Exxon Mobil Corp said on Tuesdaya minor leak on chemical plant equipment at its 502,000barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery in Baton Rouge, Louisiana did notimpact production.,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp.'s  149,500 barrel per day (bpd) Torrance, California, refinery expected minimal impact from the breakdown overnight of an unidentified unit, a company spokeswoman said.,HOUSTON, June 26 Exxon Mobil Corp.'s 149,500 barrel per day (bpd) Torrance, California, refineryexpected minimal impact from the breakdown overnight of anunidentified unit, a company spokeswoman said.,HOUSTON, June 26 Exxon Mobil Corp saidthat all of its Gulf of Mexico and coastal operations disruptedby Tropical Storm Debby were expected to resume normaloperations on Tuesday.,June 26 Exxon Mobil on Tuesday reportedunplanned flaring and  breakdown at its 149,500 barrel-per-dayTorrance, California, refinery, according to a filing with theSouth Coast Air Quality Management District.,Exxon Mobil Corp reported a leak in a supply line on the T1 tower at its 502,000 barrel per day (bpd) refinery in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, that led to a release of benzene, according to a filing with the National Response Center.

Title: Exxon L.A. refinery back to planned ops after breakdown,Exxon CEO says hopes Mexico extends oil reforms,Exxon CEO calls climate change engineering problem,Exxon CEO says hopes Mexico extends oil reforms,Exxon CEO says low U.S. natgas prices not sustainable,UPDATE 1-Exxon CEO says low US natgas prices not sustainable,Exxon CEO says low US natgas prices not sustainable,Tradesmen protest at Exxon's UK Fawley refinery
Body: HOUSTON, June 27 Exxon Mobil Corp's 149,500 barrel per day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery inTorrance, California, resumed planned operations on Wednesday,one day after a breakdown triggered flaring at the refinery andlifted Los Angeles spot market gasoline prices.,NEW YORK Exxon Mobil  would be interested in investing in Mexico's oil and gas sector, but only if the Mexican government allows the company to own some energy reserves, its chief executive said on Wednesday.,NEW YORK, June 27 Exxon Mobil CEO RexTillerson said on Wednesday that efforts to address climatechange should focus on engineering methods to adapt to shiftingweather patterns and rising sea levels rather than trying toeliminate use of fossil fuels.,NEW YORK, June 27 Exxon Mobil would beinterested in investing in Mexico's oil and gas sector, b ut onlyif the Mexican government allows the company to own some energyreserves, its chief executive said on Wednesday.,U.S. natural gas prices are too low to allow the energy industry to cover the cost of finding and producing new supplies, the head of top producer Exxon Mobil  said on Wednesday.,June 27 U.S natural gas prices are too low toallow the energy industry to cover the cost of finding andproducing new supplies, the head of top producer Exxon Mobil said on Wednesday.,June 27 Current prices for U.S. natural gas arenot sustainable for the energy industry to continue to cover thecost of finding and producing new supplies, the head of ExxonMobil said Wednesday.,LONDON, June 27 Local UK tradesmen demonstratedoutside the entrance to Exxon Mobil's Fawley refinery onWednesday to demand that contractors working on a plant overhaulin the months ahead employ workers under the terms of anindustry agreement widely used in Britain.

Title: STOCKS NEWS THAILAND-Kasikorn upgrades Esso to 'outperform',Exxon reports leak in pipe at Texas refinery
Body: Kasikorn Securities upgraded Esso (Thailand) Pcl,a unit of Exxon Mobil Corp, to 'outperform' from'neutral' with a maintained target price of 13.60 baht ($0.43),citing an improving outlook of the refiner.,June 29 Exxon Mobil Corp reported arelease of hydrogen sulfide after a leak in a pipe at its560,640 barrels per day (bpd) refinery in Baytown, Texas,according to a filing with the U.S. National Response Center.

Title: Iraq asks Obama to halt Exxon's Kurdish deal,No Obama response yet to Iraq plea on Exxon-Kurd deal, U.S. says,No Obama response yet to Iraq plea on Exxon-Kurd deal, US says,WRAPUP 1-Iraq asks Obama to halt Exxon's Kurdish deal,UPDATE 1-Iraq PM asks Obama to stop Exxon-Kurdistan oil deal,Iraq asked Obama to intervene in Exxon-Kurd deal- govt,Iraq Kurdistan sees more oil deals with majors soon
Body: BAGHDAD/LONDON Iraq has asked U.S. President Barack Obama to stop Exxon Mobil  exploring for oil in its autonomous Kurdistan region, saying the U.S. company's actions could have dire consequences for the country's stability.,LOS CABOS, Mexico The White House confirmed on Tuesday that President Barack Obama received a request from Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki to intervene to stop Exxon Mobil  from proceeding with a deal with the Kurdistan region, but said Obama has not yet responded.,LOS CABOS, Mexico, June 19 The White Houseconfirmed on Tuesday that President Barack Obama received arequest from Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki to  interveneto stop Exxon Mobil from proceeding with a deal with theKurdistan region, but said Obama has not yet responded.,BAGHDAD/LONDON, June 19 Iraq has asked U.S.President Barack Obama to stop Exxon Mobil exploring foroil in its autonomous Kurdistan region, saying the U.S.company's actions could have dire consequences for the country'sstability.,* Central govt, Kurdish region locked in spat over oil, land,BAGHDAD, June 19 Iraqi Prime Minister Nurial-Maliki has sent a letter to U.S. President Barack Obamaasking him to intervene to stop oil major Exxon Mobil from moving ahead with a deal with the country's autonomousKurdistan region, an aide to Maliki said on Tuesday.,LONDON, June 19 Iraq's autonomous Kurdistanexpects more oil majors to follow Exxon Mobil Corp inthe next few months in striking deals in the region, where oilshipments will resume, its natural resources minister said,despite a dispute with Baghdad.

Title: Exxon L.A. refinery reports flaring - filing
Body: HOUSTON, June 10 Exxon Mobil Corp.'s 149,500 barrel per day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery inTorrance, California, reported flaring on Saturday as therefinery performs planned overhauls on three units, according toa notice filed with California pollution regulators.

Title: Exxon to back Rosneft's Siberian search for 'tight' oil,UPDATE 2-Exxon to back Rosneft's Siberian search for 'tight' oil,Rosneft, Exxon sign unconventional oil deal,Rosneft, Exxon sign unconventional oil deal
Body: TUAPSE, Russia Rosneft  advanced an alliance with U.S. major ExxonMobil  on Friday that will help finance a push by Russia's top oil producer to drill in Siberia for tight oil - - oil held in non-porous rock which cannot be extracted by conventional drilling.,* Rosneft sees unconventional output potential at 300,000bpd,TUAPSE, Russia Rosneft  and ExxonMobil  signed a deal on Friday on joint development of Western Siberia's substantial tight oil resources, a Reuters correspondent reported from the ceremony.,TUAPSE, Russia, June 15 Rosneft andExxonMobil signed a deal on Friday on joint developmentof Western Siberia's substantial tight oil resources, a Reuterscorrespondent reported from the ceremony.

Title: RPT-Exxon Torrance refinery reports planned flaring
Body: July 5 Exxon Mobil  reported a plannedflaring at its 149,500 barrel-per-day refinery in Torrance,Calif., according to a filing with state regulators onThursday.

Title: Exxon L.A. refinery reports flaring -filing
Body: HOUSTON, July 8 Exxon Mobil Corp's 149,500 barrel per day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery inTorrance, California reported flaring on Sunday as it continuedto perform a planned overhaul on three units, according to anotice the refinery filed with California pollution regulators.

Title: Eight firms to bid for Afghan oil, gas exploration,UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil begins production from Angola oil block

Title: Exxon considers oil/gas exploration in Afghanistan,UPDATE 2-Exxon considers oil/gas exploration in Afghanistan,Exxon considers oil/gas exploration in Afghanistan
Body: HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp  is contemplating participation in an oil and gas tender of six blocks in northern Afghanistan, a company spokesman said on Monday.,By Anna Driver    HOUSTON, July 2 Exxon Mobil Corp iscontemplating participation in an oil and gas tender of sixblocks in northern Afghanistan, a company spokesman said onMonday.    Access to the world's oil reserves for companies like Exxonhas gotten tougher in recent years as governments assert tightercontrol of their resources. Opportunity exists, however, incountries like Afghanistan or Iraq where foreign oil companies'budgets and expertise are needed.     "Esso Explora,HOUSTON, July 2 Exxon Mobil Corp isconsidering oil and gas exploration in northern Afghanistan, acompany spokesman said on Monday.

Title: Algeria's Sonatrach in talks with Shell, ExxonMobil on shale gas
Body: ALGIERS, July 11 Algeria has started talks withRoyal Dutch Shell and ExxonMobil on shale gasexploration in the North African country, the head of stateenergy firm Sonatrach said on Wednesday.

Title: INSIGHT-Oil's big players raise the stakes in Iraqi Kurdistan
Body: LONDON, Aug 5 Iraqi Kurdistan's crude oil isplentiful and easy to get at, rare among undeveloped energyresources. The man managing it, a former North Sea engineer andconsultant turned politician, knows how to attract investment.

Title: Exxon unit investigates oil spill near Nigeria facility,UPDATE 3-Exxon, Shell-led group win $10 bln Ukraine gas project,Ukraine picks ExxonMobil, Shell-led group for Black Sea project,Exxon and Shell win Ukraine oil bid: FT,Exxon and Shell win Ukraine oil bid - FT
Body: LAGOS/PORT HARCOURT, Nigeria, Aug 15 (Reuters) -E xxonMobil's Nigeria unit said it was investigating anoil spill near its facility off the country's southeast coast,which local fishermen said had covered the waters where theyfish with a toxic film.,KIEV, Aug 15 Ukraine has picked a consortium ledby ExxonMobil and Royal Dutch Shell to developits Skifska gas field in the Black Sea, it said on Wednesday, asit seeks to wean itself off increasingly expensive Russian gasimports.,KIEV, Aug 15 Ukraine has selected a consortiumled by ExxonMobil and Royal Dutch Shell toexplore the Skifska oil and gas field on its Black Sea shelf,Environment and Natural Resources Minister Eduard Stavitsky saidon Wednesday.,LONDON Ukraine has approved a joint offshore exploration bid led by ExxonMobil  and Royal Dutch Shell  to unlock oil and gas reserves deep under the Black Sea, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.,LONDON, Aug 15 Ukraine has approved a jointoffshore exploration bid led by ExxonMobil and RoyalDutch Shell to unlock oil and gas reserves deep underthe Black Sea, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Title: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - Aug 15,Japan's TonenGeneral not considering stock offering
Body: Standard Chartered has agreed to pay $340 millionto settle accusations it potentially violated U.S. regulations.,TOKYO, Aug 14 Japanese refiner TonenGeneralSekiyu KK, in which U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil has a stake, has dropped plans to sell into the market stockheld by its 99-percent-owned unit in a bid to raise funds, itspresident said on Tuesday.

Title: Lukoil, Exxon-led group bid for Ukraine offshore exploration
Body: KIEV, Aug 3 Russia's Lukoil Overseas and a group led by Exxon Mobil have put in bids for oil and gasexploration in Ukraine's Black Sea Skifska field, but no bidshave been forthcoming for a second field at Foroska, Ukrainianofficials said on Friday.

Title: Exxon, Qatar Petroleum JV looks to export U.S. natural gas-WSJ
Body: Aug 17 Golden Pass Products LLC, a joint ventureof Exxon Mobil Corp and Qatar Petroleum, is seeking U.S.authorities' permission to export liquefied natural gas from aterminal near the Texas-Louisiana border, the Wall StreetJournal said, quoting an executive.

Title: Exxon Nigeria unit says begins oil spill clean-up
Body: ABUJA, Aug 21 ExxonMobil's Nigeria unitsaid on Tuesday it was helping clean up an oil spill near itsfacility off the West African country's southeast coast,although the company wasn't yet sure what caused the leak.

Title: UPDATE 2-Former Exxon CEO Raymond to head JPMorgan 'whale' probe,JPMorgan picks panel for "whale" inquiry-WSJ
Body: * J&J Chairman Weldon, real estate developer Jackson also oninquiry panel,Aug 20 JPMorgan Chase & Co has pickedLee Raymond, ex-chief executive of oil major Exxon Mobil Corp, to head an inquiry into losses in a credit derivativeportfolio run by its London-based Chief Investment Office (CIO),the Wall Street Journal reported.

Title: Exxon: 247 million cubic feet/day natgas output shut due to Isaac,Exxon - 247 mln cubic feet/day natgas output shut due to Isaac
Body: HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp said it had shut 247 million cubic feet per day in natural gas production and 11,000 barrels per day in crude oil output in the Gulf of Mexico due to Hurricane Isaac, according to a statement the company issued on Tuesday.,HOUSTON, Aug 28 Exxon Mobil Corp said ithad shut 247 million cubic feet per day in natural gasproduction and 11,000 barrels per day in crude oil output in theGulf of Mexico due to Hurricane Isaac, according to a statementthe company issued on Tuesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon says Rotterdam refinery had unplanned flaring
Body: AMSTERDAM/LONDON, Aug 16 Exxon Mobil said unplanned flaring occurred in its Rotterdam refinery onThursday morning and was put out with no risk to public healthand the environment, while a trader said it had a negligibleeffect on the market.

Title: Oil spill stretches for miles by Exxon Nigeria field
Body: IWUOKPOM, Nigeria, Aug 31 An oil spill near anExxonMobil oilfield off the southeast coast of Nigeriahas spread along the shore for about 15 miles, and locals saidit was killing fish they depend on to live.

Title: Exxon JV Chalmette, La. refinery restarting after Isaac: filing
Body: HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp's joint-venture 192,500 barrel per day (bpd) Chalmette, Louisiana, refinery began restarting on Friday after being shut due to the threat of Hurricane Isaac, according to a notice the refinery filed with federal pollution regulators.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon CEO says Russia deal a model for the rest,Analysis: Kurdish oil deals have Baghdad in a bind,REFILE-Exxon sees Kara Sea exploration drilling in 2014-15
Body: * ExxonMobil, Rosneft working in "challenging circumstances",BAGHDAD When Iraq's Deputy Prime Minister Hussain al-Shahristani met Exxon Mobil executives in Baghdad two months ago, he could hardly control his emotions. His anger boiling over, the Iraqi oil chief threatened to kick the Americans out of the country.,VLADIVOSTOK, Russia , Sept 6 Exxon Mobil CEO Rex Tillerson said on Thursday seismic studies at the ArcticKara Sea oil exploration project with Russian oil major Rosneftwere ahead of schedule and he expected  drilling to commence in2014-15.

Title: Regulators allow Mobil to raise Pegasus pipeline rates
Body: NEW YORK, Sept 27 The Federal Energy RegulatoryCommission (FERC) on Thursday approved the increased tariffrequested by Mobil Pipeline for its Illinois-to-Texas crude oilline, saying it lacked significant "market power" to controlrates.

Title: Exxon yet to inspect Afghanistan's biggest oil project: minister,Exxon yet to inspect Afghanistan's biggest oil project -minister
Body: KABUL Exxon Mobil Corp, the world's biggest non-state oil company, has not yet accepted an offer to look over a new Afghan oil concession in the country's north, possibly indicating a fading appetite to invest in the conflict-wracked country.,KABUL, Sept 30 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's biggest non-state oil company, has not yet accepted anoffer to look over a new Afghan oil concession in the country'snorth, possibly indicating a fading appetite to invest in theconflict-wracked country.

Title: Total, Exxon Mobil swap North Sea assets off Norway
Body: PARIS, Oct 8 France's Total and ExxonMobil Corp have agreed to exchange interests in a rangeof assets on the Norwegian Continental Shelf, Total said in astatement on Monday.

Title: Iraq wants Russians to replace Exxon at West Qurna: report,Iraq wants Russians to replace Exxon at West Qurna-report,Exxon Mobil sees Scarborough LNG decision in 2013
Body: MOSCOW Iraq is considering replacing ExxonMobil with Russian companies at the supergiant West Qurna-1 oilfield, after the U.S. major angered Baghdad by venturing into Kurdistan, according to a media report citing industry sources.,* Iraqi overture to be made to LUKOIL, Gazprom Neft - NefteCompass,MELBOURNE, Oct 11 Exxon Mobil Corp expects to make a decision on how to develop the Scarborough gasfield, considered one of the toughest projects in WesternAustralia, around the second half of 2013, its Australianchairman said on Thursday.

Title: Russia Arctic, tight oil tax work slips into Oct-Deputy PM
Body: MOSCOW, Sept 24 A Russian government debate ontax breaks for frontier oil projects, required to proceed withRosneft's exploration deal with ExxonMobil,has slipped into October, Deputy Prime Minister ArkadyDvorkovich said on Monday.

Title: LUKOIL says no approach from Iraq on West Qurna-1
Body: LONDON, Oct 16 LUKOIL said on Tuesday that Iraqhas not asked the Russian company to replace Exxon Mobil at itssupergiant West Qurna-1 oilfield after the U.S. major angeredBaghdad by entering into autonomous Kurdistan.

Title: Exxon seeks to quit flagship Iraq oil project,UPDATE 4-Exxon seeks to quit flagship Iraq oil project,Iraq not informed about Exxon move on West Qurna: sources,Iraq not informed about Exxon move on West Qurna-sources,U.S. official confirms Exxon seeking to leave Iraq's West Qurna,US official confirms Exxon seeking to leave Iraq's West Qurna,Exxon's Celtic buy signals shift for Canada oil: Campbell,COLUMN-Exxon's Celtic buy signals shift for Canada oil-Campbell,Exxon seeks to quit Iraq's W.Qurna oilfield project -diplomats,CORRECTED-Exxon executive takes over Rosneft offshore projects
Body: LONDON/WASHINGTON Exxon Mobil wants to leave its giant oilfield project in southern Iraq, diplomatic sources said, in a move likely to aggravate the country's internal tensions and hamper Baghdad's ambitious energy expansion plans.,LONDON/WASHINGTON, Oct 18 Exxon Mobil wants to leave its giant oilfield project in southern Iraq,diplomatic sources said, in a move likely to aggravate thecountry's internal tensions and hamper Baghdad's ambitiousenergy expansion plans.,BAGHDAD Exxon Mobil has not informed Iraq of its interest in quitting the country's West Qurna oilfield project, and no meetings have been held between the two sides to discuss any such decision, two senior Iraqi government oil sources said on Thursday.,BAGHDAD, Oct 18 Exxon Mobil has not informedIraq of its interest in quitting the country's West Qurnaoilfield project, and no meetings have been held between the twosides to discuss any such decision, two senior Iraqi governmentoil sources said on Thursday.,WASHINGTON A U.S. official confirmed on Thursday that Exxon Mobil told the State Department it is seeking to leave Iraq's West Qurna oilfield project.,WASHINGTON, Oct 18 A U.S. official confirmed onThursday that Exxon Mobil told the State Department itis seeking to leave Iraq's West Qurna oilfield project.,(Robert Campbell is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own),NEW YORK, Oct 18 For years the energy story outof Canada has been exclusively about the emergence of Alberta'soil sands as a massive, if costly new source of crude.,LONDON, Oct 18 Exxon Mobil wants to pullout of its contract to develop the supergiant West Qurna-1oilfield in southern Iraq, diplomatic sources said on Thursday,because of concerns over the profitability of the project.,(Corrects to withdraw erroneous reference in the 2nd para thatthe executive was born in the U.S.)

Title: Exxon to buy Canada's Celtic Exploration for C$2.6 billion,UPDATE 4-Exxon to buy Canada's Celtic Exploration for C$2.6 bln,Exxon executive takes over Rosneft offshore projects,Exxon executive takes over Rosneft offshore projects,Exxon Mobil to buy Canada's Celtic Exploration
Body: CALGARY, Alberta Exxon Mobil Corp agreed to buy Celtic Exploration Ltd for C$2.6 billion ($2.64 billion), in a deal to raise its presence in some of Western Canada's most promising shale oil and gas regions.,* Exxon to pay C$24.50 for each share of Celtic    * Deal gives Exxon vast tracts of shale assets in Canada    * Offer is a 35 pct premium to Celtic's close on Tuesday    * Celtic shares up 45 pct, Exxon's at highest since 2008    By Scott Haggett    CALGARY, Alberta, Oct 17 Exxon Mobil Corp agreed to buy Celtic Exploration Ltd for C$2.6billion ($2.64 billion), in a deal to raise its presence in someof Western Canada's most promising shale oil and gas regions.      The tra,MOSCOW An ExxonMobile  executive has taken up the newly created position of offshore projects chief at Rosneft , which is gearing up for exploration in Arctic seas, Russia's biggest oil producer said on Wednesday.,MOSCOW, Oct 17 An ExxonMobile executivehas taken up the newly created position of offshore projectschief at Rosneft, which is gearing up for explorationin Arctic seas, Russia's biggest oil producer said on Wednesday.,Oct 17 Exxon Mobil Corp said onWednesday that it would acquire Canadian oil and gas companyCeltic Exploration Ltd  in a deal valued at about C$3.1billion ($3.1 billion) to expand its footprint within Canada.

Title: Exxon fixing crude line after oil sheen in Louisiana,UPDATE 2-Exxon fixing crude line after oil sheen in Louisiana,Exxon fixing crude line after oil sheen in Louisiana,Exxon repairing HLS crude line following oil sheen in Louisiana
Body: ExxonMobil Pipeline Company said on Friday it had shut down a 12-inch pipeline carrying crude after finding an oil sheen in the water near Barataria Bay, Louisiana.,* 12-inch pipeline seen resuming activity on Friday-Exxon    * Company says cleanup underway of "very small" sheen    Oct 19 ExxonMobil Pipeline Company said onF riday it had shut down a 12-inch pipeline carrying crude afterfinding an oil sheen in the water near Barataria Bay, Louisiana.    Exxon said it planned to resume its operations latero n F riday after repairs. The pipeline carries Heavy LouisianaSweet crude from Empire in the state's southernmost PlaqueminesParish t,ExxonMobil Pipeline Company said on Friday that it had shut down a 12-inch pipeline carrying crude after finding an oil sheen in the water near Barataria Bay, Louisiana.,Oct 19 ExxonMobil Pipeline Company said onFriday it shut down a 12-inch pipeline carrying crude after itfound an oil sheen in the water near Barataria Bay, Louisiana.     Exxon said it shut down the pipeline for repair butplans to resume its operations later on Friday.     Exxon is working with regulators at the site of a "verylight sheen which was limited to the immediate area," companyspokeswoman Amber Gardner said in an email.     The Empire-to-Raceland pipeline carries He

Title: Light Louisiana Sweet rises after Exxon Baytown fire,Light Louisiana Sweet rises after Exxon Baytown fire,Fire hits diesel hydrotreater at Exxon Baytown refinery
Body: NEW YORK Light Louisiana Sweet, the U.S. Gulf Coast cash crude benchmark, rose $1.20 a barrel on Thursday to trade at $19.95 over the futures benchmark West Texas Intermediate after a fire at Exxon's  Baytown, Texas refinery, trade sources said.,NEW YORK, Oct 4 Light Louisiana Sweet, the U.S.Gulf Coast cash crude benchmark, rose $1.20 a barrel on Thursdayto trade at $19.95 over the futures benchmark West TexasIntermediate after a fire at Exxon's Baytown,Texas refinery, trade sources said.,BAYTOWN, Texas A fire broke out late Wednesday at Exxon Mobil Corp's  refining and chemical complex in Baytown, Texas, the largest operating U.S. refinery, Exxon Mobil said.

Body: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Oct 26 Exxon Mobil Corp on Friday received a major federal permit it needed tostart construction on the Point Thomson oil and gas field on theeastern North Slope of Alaska, officials said, after an extendeddelay that threatened some leases there.,ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Oct 26 Exxon Mobil Corp on Friday received a major federal permit it needed tostart construction on the Point Thomson oil and gas field on theeastern North Slope of Alaska, officials said, after an extendeddelay that threatened some leases there.,BRUSSELS Belgian prosecutors are investigating the murder of a British oil executive who was shot and killed in unexplained circumstances in front of his wife as they walked to their car after dinner at an Italian restaurant in Brussels.,BRUSSELS Belgian prosecutors are investigating the murder of a British oil executive who was shot and killed in unexplained circumstances in front of his wife as they walked to their car after dinner at an Italian restaurant in Brussels.,BRUSSELS, Oct 26 Belgian prosecutors areinvestigating the murder of a British oil executive shot andkilled in front of his wife as they walked to their car afterdinner at an Italian restaurant in Brussels.

Title: Exclusive: Venezuela sees Exxon, Conoco arbitration rulings in late 2013,UPDATE 1-New Turkish company in talks over Kurdistan oil-sources
Body: CARACAS Venezuela expects international arbitration rulings by late 2013 in multi-billion-dollar claims by Exxon Mobil and ConocoPhillips over nationalizations by President Hugo Chavez's government, the oil minister said.,ARBIL, Iraq, Nov 8 A new Turkish oil company isin negotiations to acquire several blocks in Iraqi Kurdistan ina joint venture with at least one foreign oil major and theKurdistan Regional Government, industry sources said onThursday.

Title: Iraq says Exxon to quit oilfield, ends Turkey TPAO deal,UPDATE 3-Iraq says Exxon to quit oilfield, ends Turkey TPAO deal,Exxon started talks over sale of Iraq's West Qurna-1 stake: official,Exxon started talks over sale of Iraq's West Qurna-1 stake-official,Exxon tells Iraq wants to quit West Qurna oilfield-officials
Body: BAGHDAD Exxon Mobil  has informed the Iraqi government it wants to pull out of a $50 billion oil project, and Baghdad expelled Turkey's state oil operator from another contract on Wednesday, both signals of trouble in Iraq's petroleum policy.,* Exxon officially informs Baghdad to sell West Qurna stake,BAGHDAD Exxon Mobil has started talks with other international oil operators to sell its stake in Iraq's West Qurna-1 oilfield, a senior Iraqi oil official said on Wednesday, citing a letter the U.S. company sent to the government.,BAGHDAD, Nov 7 Exxon Mobil has started talkswith other international oil operators to sell its stake inIraq's West Qurna-1 oilfield, a senior Iraqi oil official saidon Wednesday, citing a letter the U.S. company sent to thegovernment.,BAGHDAD, Nov 7 Exxon Mobil has informed Iraq ofits intention to sell its share in the West Qurna 1 oilfield,and Baghdad will respond to the decision by next Sunday, Iraqioil officials said on Wednesday.

Title: Iraq ambassador wants U.S. to pressure Exxon on Kurdistan,Iraq ambassador wants U.S. to pressure Exxon on Kurdistan,UPDATE 1-UK's Fram field to provide 5 pct of nation's gas
Body: WASHINGTON The Obama administration should pressure Exxon Mobil  to slow down dealings with Iraqi Kurdistan as they could worsen disputes between Baghdad and the northern province, Iraq's ambassador to the United States said.,* Exxon signed exploration deal with Kurdistan last October,LONDON, Oct 22 The UK North Sea's Fram fieldwill be on stream within three years and will be one of the mostsignificant UK developments of the past decade providing 5percent of Britain's gas at peak production, operator RoyalDutch/Shell said on Monday.

Title: Oil companies struggle to increase output,WRAPUP 2-Oil companies struggle to increase output,Exxon quarterly profit falls, output tumbles,Exxon adding to Gulf of Mexico position,Exxon adding to Gulf of Mexico position,REFILE-UPDATE 3-Exxon quarterly profit falls, output tumbles,Oil companies struggle to increase output,Exxon quarterly profit falls 7 percent,BRIEF-Exxon Mobil Q3 net income $9.57 billion
Body: LONDON/HOUSTON The world's top oil and gas companies are struggling to deliver the output growth they need to outpace the burgeoning cost of exploration and development.,* Shell's output dips less than one percent    * Exxon's production slides 7.5 percent    By Andrew Callus and Anna Driver    LONDON/HOUSTON, Nov 1 The world's top oil andgas companies are struggling to deliver the output growth theyneed to outpace the burgeoning cost of exploration anddevelopment.    Third-quarter results from Exxon Mobil, Royal DutchShell and other top international players released overthe past few days mostly beat expectations thanks to a shortageof t,Exxon Mobil Corp, the world's largest publicly traded oil company, reported a quarterly profit on Thursday that topped expectations, as higher margins from its refining arm countered a 7.5 percent decline in oil and gas output.,Exxon Mobil Corp on Thursday said it has acquired interest in several blocks in the Gulf of Mexico, where it already has an active drilling program.,Nov 1 Exxon Mobil Corp on Thursday saidit has acquired interest in several blocks in the Gulf ofMexico, where it already has an active drilling program.,Nov 1 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, reported a quarterly profiton Thursday that topped expectations, as higher margins from itsrefining arm countered a 7.5 percent decline in oil and gasoutput.,LONDON/HOUSTON The world's top oil and gas companies are struggling to improve output and failing to capture the full value of a resilient price for crude oil while weak gas prices in the United States take their toll.,Nov 1 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, on Thursday reported a 7percent decrease in quarterly profit as lower commodity pricestook a toll and output fell.,Nov 1 Exxon Mobil Corp : * Q3 net income $9.57 billion * Q3 EPS $2.09 * Q3 capital and exploration expenditures totaled $9.18 billion * Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S Q3 earnings per share view $1.95 * Says Q3 oil equivalent production decreased 7.5 percent * Says Q3 share purchases to reduce shares outstanding were $5billion * Says Q3 upstream earnings were $5.97 billion * Says Q3 earnings from u.s. upstream operations $633 million * Says Q3 downstream earnings were $3.19 billion

Title: Nigeria Exxon spill spreads for miles along coast
Body: IBENO, Nigeria An oil spill at an ExxonMobil facility offshore from the Niger Delta has spread at least 20 miles from its source, coating waters used by fishermen in a film of sludge.

Title: Nigeria Exxon spill spreads for miles along coast,UPDATE 1-Nigeria Exxon spill spreads for miles along coast,Nigeria Exxon spill spreads for miles along coast
Body: IBENO, Nigeria An oil spill at an ExxonMobil facility offshore from the Niger Delta has spread at least 20 miles from its source, coating waters used by fishermen in a film of sludge.,* Second major oil spill near Exxon facility in three months,IBENO, Nigeria, Nov 17 An oil spill at anExxonMobil facility offshore from the  oil-rich NigerDelta has spread at least 20 miles from its source, coatingwaters used by fishermen in a film of sludge.

Title: Exxon warning adds to Nigeria oil output problems,UPDATE 2-Exxon warning adds to Nigeria oil output problems,Exxon declares force majeure on Nigeria Qua Iboe oil exports
Body: ABUJA/GENEVA ExxonMobil on Wednesday became the fourth oil major in a month to warn customers over delays to Nigerian oil and gas exports, adding to a raft of problems for Africa's biggest energy producer caused by oil spills, theft and flooding.,* Exxon calls force majeure on Nigeria's biggest oil grade,ABUJA, Nov 21 Exxon Mobil's Nigerianunit declared force majeure on Qua Iboe crude oil exports onWednesday due to outages caused by a pipeline oil spill on Nov.9, the company said.

Title: UPDATE 2-Shell lifts its last force majeure on Nigeria oil
Body: LAGOS, Nov 29 Shell lifted the last ofthree force majeures on its Nigerian oil and gas exports onThursday, declaring production restored for Forcados crudegrades, after output was hit by flooding and theft.

Title: Iraq would favor CNPC, Lukoil bids for Exxon oil stake,UPDATE 2-Iraq would favour CNPC, Lukoil bids for Exxon oil stake,Iraq has received "positive signals" from Lukoil, CNPC-ministry,Iraq would favour CNPC and Lukoil bids for W. Qurna 1 -ministry
Body: BAGHDAD Iraq would favor bids by Russia's Lukoil  and China's CNPC if they decided to buy Exxon Mobil's  stake in the super-giant West Qurna-1 oilfield, a senior oil ministry official said on Friday.,* Exxon opens virtual data room for West Qurna 1 oilfield,BAGHDAD, Nov 16 Iraq has received "positivesignals" from China's CNPC and Russia's Lukoil theywill consider purchasing Exxon Mobil's stake in the WestQurna-1 oilfield, a senior Iraqi oil ministry official toldReuters.,BAGHDAD, Nov 16 Iraq has informed Russia'sLUKOIL and China's CNPC it would favour their bids ifthey decided to buy Exxon Mobil's stake in the WestQurna-1 oilfield, oil ministry sources said .

Title: Lukoil says no commitments made on Iraqi W.Qurna-1 project
Body: MOSCOW, Dec 5 Russia's Lukoil,identified by Baghdad as a favoured investor in West Qurna-1, amajor oil project abandoned by Exxon, has made no commitment sofar, a company official said on Wednesday, the tentativedeadline date for bids.

Title: Exxon sells shale gas licences to Polish refiner PKN,ExxonMobil to spend $300 million on Rosneft venture,RPT-UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil to spend $300 mln on Rosneft venture
Body: WARSAW, Dec 7 U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil agreed to sell two shale gas exploration concessions in Polandto the country's top refiner PKN Orlen for anundisclosed price, the groups said on Friday.,MOSCOW ExxonMobil  agreed to spend $300 million on advanced horizontal drilling and fracking at Russian state oil company Rosneft's  Siberian fields in a project designed to help Russia realize its vast tight oil potential.,MOSCOW, Dec 7 ExxonMobil agreed to spend$300 million on advanced horizontal drilling and fracking atRussian state oil company Rosneft's Siberian fields ina project designed to help Russia realise its vast tight oilpotential.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon sees North America as energy exporter by 2025,Exxon sees North America as energy exporter by 2025
Body: Dec 11 Soaring oil and gas production willpropel North America into becoming a net energy exporter by2025, Exxon Mobil Corp said in its annual energyoutlook.,Dec 11 Soaring oil and gas production willpropel North America into becoming a net energy exporter by2025, Exxon Mobil Corp said in its annual energyoutlook.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon lifts Nigerian Qua Iboe force majeure - traders,Exxon lifts Nigerian Qua Iboe force majeure - traders
Body: LONDON/ABUJA, Dec 10 Exxon Mobil liftedits force majeure on its Nigerian Qua Iboe crude oil grade, theoil major said on Monday, slightly easing concerns about supplyfrom Africa's biggest oil exporter.,LONDON, Dec 10 Exxon Mobil lifted its forcemajeure on its Nigerian Qua Iboe crude oil grade, traders saidon Monday.

Title: China the frontrunner to buy Exxon out of Iraq oil,UPDATE 1-China the frontrunner to buy Exxon out of Iraq oil,China the frontrunner to buy Exxon out of Iraq oil
Body: BEIJING/LONDON China National Petroleum Corp (CNPC) has emerged as the frontrunner to take over Iraq's West Qurna-1 oilfield from Exxon Mobil, a move that would diminish Western oil influence in Iraq a decade after the U.S.-led invasion.,* Exxon expected to decide soon, some say may not pull out,* Exxon expected to decide soon, some say may not pull out

Title: Exxon commences start-up ops at Singapore cracker
Body: SINGAPORE, Dec 28 ExxonMobil Corp hasstarted up its 1 million tonnes per year steam cracker inSingapore, and ethylene and other hydrocarbon production isexpected within a few months, a company executive said onFriday.

Title: Exxon's PNG LNG project cost balloon to $19 billion,UPDATE 1-Exxon's PNG LNG project cost balloon to $19 bln,Exxon's PNG LNG project cost balloon to $19 bln
Body: SYDNEY The cost of Exxon Mobil's  massive gas export project in Papua New Guinea will soar more than 20 percent to $19 billion due to foreign exchange impacts and delays from work stoppages and land access issues, but it is still expected to start in 2014.,SYDNEY, Nov 12 The cost of Exxon Mobil's massive gas export project in Papua New Guinea will soar morethan 20 percent to $19 billion due to foreign exchange impactsand delays from work stoppages and land access issues, but it isstill expected to start in 2014.,SYDNEY, Nov 12 Exxon Mobil said the costof its gas export project in Papua New Guinea will soar to $19billion from $15.7 billion due to foreign exchange impacts anddelays from work stoppages and land access issues.

Title: Exxon Yellowstone oil spill made worse by delay-report,Exxon Yellowstone oil spill made worse by delay-report

Body: NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp has reclaimed its place as the largest U.S. publicly traded company by market value one year after losing it to Apple Inc, as shares of the technology giant extended their recent fall on Friday.,* Apple's losses since peak equal market value of Google    * Heavy Apple volume at the end of Friday's session    * Apple shares trade as low as $435 (Updates prices, adds financial details)    By Rodrigo Campos    NEW YORK, Jan 25 Exxon Mobil Corp hasreclaimed its place as the largest U.S. publicly traded companyby market value one year after losing it to Apple Inc,as shares of the technology giant extended their recent fall onFriday.    Apple's market capitalization has

Title: UPDATE 1-Indonesia calls for Exxon to replace local chief,CORRECTED-Indonesia regulator says Cepu oilfield faces setback,ExxonMobil Indonesia's Cepu faces setbacks, CEO to be replaced
Body: JAKARTA, Jan 28 A senior Indonesian official hascalled for U.S. energy group Exxon Mobil to replace itscountry manager after delays at one of its major oilfields,fuelling concerns about state meddling in the sector.,(Corrects headline to include sourcing, clarifies thatregulator wants Exxon to replace local CEO, not Exxon plans toreplace him),JAKARTA ExxonMobil  Indonesia's Cepu block will likely not reach full production until August or September 2014, behind the initial schedule for May 2014, an official from the oil and gas regulator told Reuters on Monday.

Title: With or without Exxon, Iraq Kurds strive for energy autonomy,With or without Exxon, Iraq Kurds strive for energy autonomy

Title: UPDATE 2-Iraq, Exxon hold talks over disputed oil deals,Iraq's Maliki meets with Exxon over oil operations
Body: * U.S. major seeking to sell stake in West Qurna oilfield,BAGHDAD, Jan 21 Iraq's Prime Minister Nurial-Maliki met with the chairman of Exxon Mobil on Monday fortalks on its oil operations that are at the heart of a disputebetween Baghdad and the autonomous Kurdistan region, agovernment statement said.

Title: UPDATE 2-Iraq tells Exxon to choose: Southern Iraq or Kurdistan,Iraq oilmin says Exxon must choose: Southern Iraq or Kurdistan
Body: * Iraq tells Exxon must chose Kurdistan or southernoilfields,BAGHDAD, Jan 27 Iraq has told Exxon Mobil thatit must choose between working in the country's southernoilfields or in autonomous Kurdistan, and expects the U.S. oilmajor to make a final decision in a few days, the oil ministersaid on Sunday.

Title: Afren ponders sales of Kurdistan, east Africa oilfields-report
Body: LONDON, Feb 3 London-listed oil explorer Afren has hired a corporate finance firm to look into sellingits oil fields in Kurdistan  and east Africa, leaving the groupfocused on its main assets in Nigeria, The Sunday Timesreported.

Title: UPDATE 1-Baghdad sees Exxon shift in Kurdistan oil feud,Exxon moves in right way, Kurdish deals pending - Iraq official,Exxon mulls Baghdad offer, CEO meets Kurdish leader -sources
Body: LONDON/ARBIL, Iraq, Jan 23 Exxon Mobil may bemoving closer to Baghdad's side in its bitter feud withautonomous Kurdistan, industry sources said, with a sweeter dealto keep it operating in southern Iraq on the table.,BAGHDAD, Jan 23 Exxon Mobil is moving "along theright path" after meeting with Iraq's Prime Minister Nurial-Maliki, but must deal with its disputed Kurdistan dealsbefore any final agreement on it staying in southern oilfields,an Iraqi oil official said.,LONDON/ARBIL, Iraq, Jan 23 Exxon Mobil's top executive has met with the president of Iraqi Kurdistanafter Baghdad made the U.S. major an offer in an apparent bid tokeep it operating in the south of the country, industry sourcessaid.

Title: Exxon, Chevron earnings boosted by refining margins,RPT-WRAPUP 2-Exxon, Chevron earnings boosted by refining margins,Exxon's quarterly profit rises, tops Street estimates,UPDATE 2-Exxon's quarterly profit rises, tops Street estimates,BRIEF-Exxon Mobil Q4 net income $9.9 billion,Exxon's quarterly profit rises 6 percent,BRIEF-Exxon Mobil up in premarket trading after results,Exxon, Kurdistan visit disputed Iraqi oil block
Body: HOUSTON/SAN FRANCISCO Renewed strength in refining and chemicals led to higher-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings for Exxon Mobil Corp  and Chevron Corp , the two largest U.S. oil companies.,HOUSTON/SAN FRANCISCO, Feb 1 Renewed strength inrefining and chemicals led to higher-than-expectedfourth-quarter earnings for Exxon Mobil Corp and ChevronCorp, the two largest U.S. oil companies.,Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded oil company, on Friday reported a higher-than-expected 6 percent increase in quarterly profit on stronger results at its chemical and refining businesses.,Feb 1 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, on Friday reported ahigher-than-expected 6 percent increase in quarterly profit onstronger results at its chemical and refining businesses.,Feb 1 Exxon Mobil Corp : * Q4 net income $9.9 billion * Q4 EPS $2.20; no special items * Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S Q4 earnings per share view $2.00 * Q4 capital and exploration expenditures totaled $12.44billion * Says Q4 oil equivalent production decreased 5 percent * Says Q4 share purchases to reduce shares outstanding were $5billion * Says Q4 upstream earnings were $7.76 billion * Says Q4 earnings from u.s. upstream operations $1.6 billion * Says Q4 downstream earnings we,Feb 1 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, on Friday reported a 6percent increase in  quarterly profit, partly due to higherrefining margins.,NEW YORK, Feb 1 Exxon Mobil Corp : * Shares up 0.9 percent in premarket trading after results,BAGHDAD, Feb 1 Exxon Mobil and IraqiKurdistan officials visited an oil exploration block caught in adispute between Baghdad's central government and the autonomousKurdish region, and discussed building a camp there, a localofficial and sources say.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon declares force majeure on Nigeria Qua Iboe oil,Exxon declares force majeure on Nigeria Qua Iboe oil
Body: ABUJA, Feb 7 Exxon Mobil on Thursdaydeclared force majeure on Nigeria's benchmark Qua Iboe crude oilexports due to pipeline repair work, the company's local unitsaid, cutting output from Africa's top producer.    Nigeria is among the world's top 10 crude exporters andusually ships around 2 million barrels per day, supplying theUnited States, China and India with its light oil.    Qua Iboe is Nigeria's largest crude oil stream with exports,before this announcement, expected to,ABUJA, Feb 7 Exxon Mobil's localNigerian unit on Thursday declared force majeure on exports ofQua Iboe crude oil due to pipeline repair work, the companysaid.

Body: BEIJING China is willing to join Exxon Mobil in a giant Iraqi oilfield project, a top executive said on Tuesday, which could see Beijing come to dominate Iraq's oilfields and help the U.S. major mend fences with Baghdad.,* Exxon options include selling part of its stake toPetroChina,MOSCOW, March 4 BP, which lost its firstdeal to drill for oil in Russia's Arctic to ExxonMobil,tried to negotiate a new deal with Russian state oil companyRosneft and was again beaten to the punch by its U.S.rival.,BEIJING, March 5 PetroChina , China's largest oil and gas producer, is willing tojointly develop the West Qurna oilfield in Iraq with U.S. oilmajor Exxon Mobil, its chairman Jiang Jiemin said onTuesday.

Body: Exxon Mobil on Sunday continued cleanup of a pipeline spill that spewed thousands of barrels of heavy Canadian crude in Arkansas as opponents of oil sands development latched on to the incident to attack plans to build the Keystone XL line.,* Homes remain evacuated; 12,000 barrels of oil and waterrecovered,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp said on Sunday that crews at the scene of its crude oil pipeline spill in Arkansas had yet to excavate the area of the breach to determine the cause.,HOUSTON, March 31 Exxon Mobil Corp saidon Sunday that crews at the scene of its crude oil pipelinespill in Arkansas had yet to excavate the area of the breach todetermine the cause.,March 31 Exxon Mobil on Sunday continuedcleanup of a pipeline oil spill in Arkansas that loosedthousands of barrels of heavy Canadian crude and forced theevacuation of 22 homes.,* U.S. environmental agency categorizes pipe rupture as"major spill",NEW YORK, March 30 Exxon Mobil has shuta crude oil pipeline after it ruptured near Mayflower, Arkansas,spilling "thousands" of barrels of oil, the company said.

Title: Exxon oil spill cleanup ongoing in Arkansas, pipeline shut,UPDATE 1-Exxon cleanup of Arkansas oil spill continues, pipeline still shut,Exxon cleanup of Arkansas oil spill continues, pipeline still shut
Body: MAYFLOWER, Ark./HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp continued efforts on Monday to clean up thousands of barrels of heavy Canadian crude oil spilled from a near 65-year-old pipeline in Arkansas, as a debate raged about the safety of transporting rising volumes of the fuel into the United States.,HOUSTON, April 1 An Exxon Mobil Corp crude oil pipeline that ruptured  and spewed thousands ofbarrels of oil into an Arkansas subdivision remained shut onMonday as cleanup efforts continued with no word on when itwould be fixed and restarted.,HOUSTON, April 1 Exxon Mobil Corp onMonday had yet to excavate the area around an Arkansas crude oilpipeline rupture that sent thousands of barrels of crude into ahousing subdivision last week, a company spokesman said.

Body: LITTLETON, New Hampshire A New Hampshire jury on Tuesday found Exxon Mobil Corp liable for $236.4 million in a civil lawsuit that charged the oil company had polluted groundwater in the state with a gasoline additive used to reduce smog in the 1970s and 1980s.,LITTLETON, N.H., April 9 A New Hampshire jury onTuesday found Exxon Mobil Corp liable for $236.4 millionin a civil lawsuit that charged the oil company had pollutedgroundwater in the state with a gasoline additive used to reducesmog in the 1970s and 1980s.,LITTLETON, N.H., April 9 A New Hampshire jury onTuesday found Exxon Mobil Corp liable for $236.4 millionin a civil lawsuit that charged the oil company had pollutedgroundwater in the state with a gasoline additive, a lawyer forthe state said.
