Body: * Sechin says market capitalisation of Rosneft to reach $120bln in two-year time,LONDON, April 23 Rosneft isconsidering the possibility of teaming up with its long-standingpartner, ExxonMobil, in tapping oil and gas in Iraq,Rosneft's head Igor Sechin told reporters on Tuesday.

Title: Oil production rises for Exxon, Conoco in first-quarter,WRAPUP 1-U.S. oil production rises for Exxon, Conoco in Q1,Exxon quarterly profit up slightly,UPDATE 2-Exxon quarterly profit up slightly,Exxon quarterly profit up slightly,BRIEF-Exxon Mobil shares rise 1.1 percent in premarket trade following results
Body: HOUSTON Quarterly results from Exxon Mobil Corp  and ConocoPhillips  on Thursday showed that while overall growth remained elusive, output rose in key basins in the United States where the oil and gas companies are spending heavily to grow crude production.,HOUSTON, April 25 Quarterly results from ExxonMobil Corp and ConocoPhillips on Thursday showedthat while overall growth remained elusive, output rose in keybasins in the United States where the oil and gas companies arespending heavily to grow crude production.,Exxon Mobil Corp said on Thursday its quarterly profit edged up, helped by higher earnings in its chemicals business but oil and gas production fell.,April 25 Exxon Mobil Corp said onThursday its quarterly profit edged up, helped by higherearnings in its chemicals business but oil and gas productionfell.,April 25Exxon Mobil Corp's quarterlyprofit edged up, as the world's largest publicly traded oilcompany's results were helped by higher earnings in itschemicals business.,NEW YORK, April 25 Exxon Mobil Corp : * Shares rise 1.1 percent in premarket trade following results

Title: UPDATE 2-Norway fund mulls selling oil firms working in E.Guinea,Norway wealth fund mulls selling oil firms that work in E.Guinea
Body: OSLO, April 24 Norway's sovereign wealth fund islooking into selling off shares in oil firms that work inEquatorial Guinea, where oil revenue does nothing to relieveabject poverty, the fund's ethics council said, a list thatincludes Exxon Mobil.,OSLO, April 24 Norway's sovereign wealth fund islooking into selling off shares in oil firms that work inEquatorial Guinea, where oil revenue does nothing to relieveabject poverty, the fund's ethics council said, a list thatincludes Exxon Mobil.

Title: Exxon's Pegasus oil pipe spills crude into Missouri yard,UPDATE 2-Exxon's Pegasus oil pipe spills crude into Missouri yard,Exxon's Pegasus oil pipe spills crude into Missouri yard,Exxon oil pipe spills small amount of crude into Missouri yard
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp's near 70-year-old Pegasus oil pipeline leaked a small amount of crude into a residential yard in Ripley County, Missouri on Tuesday, a month after the same pipe spewed thousands of barrels of crude in Arkansas.,May 1 Exxon Mobil Corp's near70-year-old Pegasus oil pipeline leaked a small amount of crudeinto a residential yard in Ripley County, Missouri on Tuesday, amonth after the same pipe spewed thousands of barrels of crudein Arkansas.,Exxon Mobil Corp's near 70-year-old Pegasus oil pipeline spilled a small amount of crude on Tuesday into a residential yard in Ripley County, Missouri, a month after the same pipe spewed thousands of barrels of crude in Arkansas.,May 1 An Exxon Mobil Corp oil pipelinespilled about one barrel of crude into a residential yard inRipley County, Missouri, on Tuesday, a state official confirmedon Wednesday.

Title: Exxon's Pegasus oil pipe spills crude into Missouri yard,UPDATE 2-Exxon's Pegasus oil pipe spills crude into Missouri yard,Exxon's Pegasus oil pipe spills crude into Missouri yard,Exxon oil pipe spills small amount of crude into Missouri yard
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp's near 70-year-old Pegasus oil pipeline leaked a small amount of crude into a residential yard in Ripley County, Missouri on Tuesday, a month after the same pipe spewed thousands of barrels of crude in Arkansas.,May 1 Exxon Mobil Corp's near70-year-old Pegasus oil pipeline leaked a small amount of crudeinto a residential yard in Ripley County, Missouri on Tuesday, amonth after the same pipe spewed thousands of barrels of crudein Arkansas.,Exxon Mobil Corp's near 70-year-old Pegasus oil pipeline spilled a small amount of crude on Tuesday into a residential yard in Ripley County, Missouri, a month after the same pipe spewed thousands of barrels of crude in Arkansas.,May 1 An Exxon Mobil Corp oil pipelinespilled about one barrel of crude into a residential yard inRipley County, Missouri, on Tuesday, a state official confirmedon Wednesday.

Title: Sable Island Nova Scotia natgas project work complete
Body: NEW YORK, May 6 The Sable Offshore EnergyProject off the coast of Nova Scotia completed plannedmaintenance on schedule on Sunday, with natural gas productionexpected to increase over the next several days, according towebsite postings from Spectra Energy's Maritimes U.S. andMaritimes Canada units.

Title: Indonesia ramps up crude drilling in Cepu block
Body: JAKARTA, April 29 Development drilling willofficially kick off on Tuesday in Indonesia's Banyu Uripoilfield in the Cepu block operated by ExxonMobil, thecountry's oil and gas regulator said, potentially quadruplingthe area's crude production by July 2014.

Title: Exxon and Qatar plan to ship US natural gas to Britain
Body: NEW YORK, May 10 Exxon Mobil and QatarPetroleum announced an agreement on Thursday to ship liquefiednatural gas to Britain from their proposed export plant in theUnited States, offering another supply stream to the islandnation as domestic output dwindles.

Title: OGX, Exxon Mobil win Potiguar offshore Brazil blocks,Turkey says agreed with ExxonMobil, Iraqi Kurdistan on oil exploration
Body: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 14 Oil companies OGX and Exxon Mobil Corp won Brazilian deepwateroil and natural gas exploration blocks in a frontier region ofBrazil's Potiguar Basin at an auction on Tuesday.,ANKARA, May 14 Turkey has agreed with theKurdistan Regional Government (KRG) and U.S. oil giant ExxonMobil on oil exploration in northern Iraq, Turkish PrimeMinister Tayyip Erdogan said on Tuesday.

Title: Supreme Court declines to hear Alaska climate change case,U.S. Supreme Court declines to hear Alaska climate change case
Body: WASHINGTON The Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear an Alaskan village's claim that it should be able to sue oil companies and utilities for damages attributed to climate change.,WASHINGTON, May 20 The U.S. Supreme Court onMonday declined to hear an Alaskan village's claim that itshould be able to sue oil companies and utilities for damagesattributed to climate change.

Title: InterOil in talks with Exxon to develop Papua New Guinea assets,REFILE-BRIEF-InterOil, Pacific LNG enter into negotiations with ExxonMobil on Elk, Antelope fields
Body: May 24 Liquefied natural gas producer InterOilCorp and its joint venture partner have entered intoexclusive negotiations with Exxon Mobil Corp to developgas fields in Papua New Guinea.,May 24 InterOil Corp : * Interoil and Pacific LNG group enter into exclusivenegotiations with ExxonMobil on development of the elk andantelope resource * Says there will be staged payments before and afterproduction commences * Says transaction discussed with government of papua newguinea* Source text for Eikon * Further company coverage

Title: UPDATE 1-Nigeria's NNPC and Exxon unit to tap bond market by 2016,Nigeria's NNPC and Exxon unit to tap bond market by 2016
Body: * Exxon and NNPC joint venture has 550,000 bpd oil capacity,ABUJA/GENEVA, May 23 Nigeria's state oil companyand a subsidiary of Exxon Mobil plan to tap the bondmarket by 2016 to fill a funding shortfall in their oilexploration joint venture, the companies said.

Title: UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil completes Singapore chemical plant expansion
Body: SINGAPORE, May 30 ExxonMobil said onThursday it started ethylene production at a new chemical unitin Singapore, marking the completion of a multi-billion dollarexpansion project at its Singapore petrochemical complex.

Title: CORRECTED-(OFFICIAL)-Exxon eyes Interoil assets for PNG LNG expansion
Body: (Corrects to show that 4 to 5 tcf is the gas required for onetrain, not the amount being considered in Interoil deal)

Title: Exxon to run more tests on ruptured Arkansas oil pipeline,Former ExxonMobil executive to head MOL's upstream operations
Body: NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp  was granted time by regulators to carry out a second round of testing on the ruptured Pegasus oil pipeline, after the firm said an initial investigation into the reason the nearly 70-year-old line failed was not conclusive.,BUDAPEST, June 12 Hungarian oil and gas groupMOL has appointed former ExxonMobil and TNK-BP executive Alexander Dodds as vice presidentresponsible for its upstream business.

Title: UPDATE 2-Exxon in talks for stake in Turkey's Black Sea block,Exxon in talks for stake in Turkey's Black Sea block,Exxon in talks for stake in Turkey's Black Sea block
Body: NEW DELHI, June 11 Exxon Mobil Corp isin talks with Turkey's TPAO to buy a stake in a block in theBlack Sea, and the country is on the hunt for shale gas in itsown territory, the acting head of the state-owned energy companysaid on Tuesday.,NEW DELHI ExxonMobil  is in talks with Turkey's TPAO to buy a stake in a block in the Black Sea, and the country is on the hunt for shale gas in its own territory, the acting head of the state-owned energy company said on Tuesday.,NEW DELHI, June 11 ExxonMobil is intalks with TPAO to buy a stake in a block in the Black Sea, theacting head of the Turkish state-owned energy company toldReuters on Tuesday.

Title: Exxon seeking LNG export license in Canada,UPDATE 1-BP looks at tough onshore Russian projects with Rosneft
Body: HOUSTON, June 20 Exxon Mobil Corp isseeking a license to export 30 million tonnes of liquefiednatural gas (LNG) per year to Asian markets from the coast ofBritish Columbia, according to a regulatory filing in Canada.,* British major to offer skills and technology to Rosneft

Title: Chevron, Exxon investors sustain calls for fracking disclosure,Chevron, Exxon investors sustain calls for fracking disclosure,Shareholder support for Exxon executive pay erodes
Body: SAN RAMON, Calif./DALLAS About 30 percent of shareholders of both Exxon Mobil Corp  and Chevron Corp  on Wednesday backed calls for more disclosure surrounding their use of hydraulic fracturing, the top two U.S. oil companies said.,SAN RAMON, Calif./DALLAS, May 29 About 30percent of shareholders of both Exxon Mobil Corp andChevron Corp on Wednesday backed calls for moredisclosure surrounding their use of hydraulic fracturing,  thetop two U.S. oil companies said.,DALLAS, May 29 Fewer shareholders of Exxon MobilCorp on Wednesday cast votes in favor of the oilcompany's executive compensation following a year when ChiefExecutive Officer Rex Tillerson's total pay climbed 15 percentto about $40 million.

Title: Exxon CEO says delays in gas export permits hurt U.S.,U.S., Arkansas sue Exxon over Pegasus pipeline spill,U.S., Arkansas sue Exxon over Pegasus pipeline spill,Marathon Oil taps Exxon Mobil executive as next CEO,UPDATE 2-Marathon Oil taps Exxon Mobil executive as next CEO,Marathon Oil taps Exxon Mobil executive as next CEO,Ukraine seeks green light for Chevron shale deal,Marathon Oil CEO to retire December 31, be replaced by Exxon executive
Body: WASHINGTON Delays in approval of more natural gas export projects are costing U.S. companies millions of dollars a day and giving a leg up to rival countries also looking to boost exports, the chief of Exxon Mobil Corp  said on Thursday.,WASHINGTON The Justice Department filed a joint lawsuit with Arkansas on Thursday against oil producer Exxon Mobil Corp  over the pipeline spill in March of thousands of barrels of heavy Canadian crude oil in a suburban neighborhood.,WASHINGTON, June 13 The U.S. Justice Departmentfiled a joint lawsuit with Arkansas on Thursday against oilproducer Exxon Mobil Corp over the pipeline spill inMarch of thousands of barrels of heavy Canadian crude oil in asuburban neighborhood.,Marathon Oil Corp  has tapped an Exxon Mobil Corp  executive to become its next CEO when Clarence Cazalot retires at the end of the year.,June 13 Marathon Oil Corp has tapped anExxon Mobil Corp executive to become its next CEO whenClarence Cazalot retires at the end of the year.,Marathon Oil Corp  tapped an Exxon Mobil Corp  executive to become its next CEO when Clarence Cazalot retires at the end of the year.,* If approved, Olesska shale deal would be second forUkraine,Marathon Oil Corp  said on Thursday that Chairman and Chief Executive Clarence Cazalot will retire December 31 and be replaced by a senior Exxon Mobil Corp  executive.

Title: Exxon books US-flagged American Phoenix tanker at near record $100,000/day
Body: NEW YORK, June 27 ExxonMobil has taken along-term charter on the U.S.-flagged American Phoenix oiltanker at a near record rate of around $100,000 per day, tradesources said, highlighting the scarcity of vessels available toship oil and refined products between United States ports.

Title: XTO Energy agrees to pay $100,000 fine for fracking spill,XTO Energy agrees to pay $100,000 fine for fracking spill
Body: NEW YORK An Exxon Mobil Corp  subsidiary agreed to pay a $100,000 fine for spilling wastewater from a natural gas drilling site in Pennsylvania that polluted a local river, U.S. regulators said on Thursday.,NEW YORK, July 18 An Exxon Mobil Corp subsidiary agreed to pay a $100,000 fine for spilling wastewaterfrom a natural gas drilling site in Pennsylvania that polluted alocal river, U.S. regulators said on Thursday.

Title: Louisiana agency sues big oil firms for hurting wetlands,UPDATE 1-Louisiana agency sues big oil firms for hurting wetlands,Louisiana agency sues big oil firms for hurting wetlands
Body: NEW ORLEANS A Louisiana agency sued 97 oil companies - including BP Plc, Exxon Mobil Corp, Chevron Corp and Royal Dutch Shell Plc - in state court on Wednesday for allegedly damaging hundreds of miles of sensitive wetlands by cutting through them with pipelines and transportation canals.,NEW ORLEANS, July 24 A Louisiana agency sued 97oil companies - including BP Plc, Exxon Mobil Corp, Chevron Corp and Royal Dutch Shell Plc - in state court on Wednesday for allegedly damaging hundreds ofmiles of sensitive wetlands by cutting through them withpipelines and transportation canals.,NEW ORLEANS, July 24 A Louisiana agency sued 97oil companies - including BP Plc, Exxon Mobil Corp, Chevron Corp and Royal Dutch Shell Plc - in state court on Wednesday for allegedly damaging hundreds ofmiles of sensitive wetlands by cutting through them withpipelines and transportation canals.

Title: U.S. appeals court upholds $105 million Exxon payout in NYC case,UPDATE 1-U.S. appeals court upholds $105 mln Exxon payout in NYC case,U.S. appeals court upholds $105 mln Exxon payout in NYC case
Body: NEW YORK A U.S. appeals court on Friday upheld a ruling against Exxon Mobil Corp ordering the company to pay $105 million in damages for polluting New York City's groundwater with a toxic gasoline additive.,NEW YORK, July 26 A U.S. appeals court on Fridayupheld a ruling against Exxon Mobil Corp ordering thecompany to pay $105 million in damages for polluting New YorkCity's groundwater with a toxic gasoline additive.,NEW YORK, July 26 A U.S. appeals court on Fridayupheld a ruling against Exxon Mobil Corp ordering thecompany to pay $105 million in damages for polluting New YorkCity's groundwater with a toxic gasoline additive.

Title: Frank's Int. raises IPO size by nearly half to up to $724.5 mln
Body: July 29 Frank's International N.V., whichprovides drilling equipment to Chevron Corp, Exxon MobilCorp and ConocoPhillips, increased the size ofits initial public offering by about 45 percent to up to $724.5million.

Title: UPDATE 3-Decades-old defect caused Exxon's Arkansas oil spill -regulator,Exxon pipeline leak caused by manufacturing defect -U.S. report,Exxon's quarterly profit falls short of Street view,UPDATE 2-Exxon's quarterly profit falls short of Street view,Exxon's quarterly profit lower, output off 1.9 pct
Body: WASHINGTON, Aug 1 A leak in Exxon Mobil Corp's nearly 70-year-old Pegasus pipeline, which spilledthousands of barrels of crude oil in a small Arkansas town inMarch, appears to have been caused by an original  manufacturingdefect, U.S. regulators said on Thursday.,WASHINGTON, Aug 1 A leak in Exxon Mobil's Pegasus pipeline, which spilled thousands of barrels ofcrude oil in a small Arkansas town in March, was caused by amanufacturing defect, and the line will remain shut until it canbe restarted safely, U.S. regulators said on Thursday.,Exxon Mobil Corp  on Thursday reported a sharp fall in quarterly profit on lower oil and gas output production and weaker earnings from its refining business.,Aug 1 Exxon Mobil Corp on Thursdayreported a sharp fall in quarterly profit on lower oil and gasoutput production and weaker earnings from its refiningbusiness.    "I think the (earnings) shortfall was across the board,"Brian Youngberg, oil analyst at Edward Jones in St Louis. "Thebiggest miss was on the downstream, the refining margins werewell below expectations."    The world's largest publicly traded oil company reportedprofit at $6.9 billion, or $1.55 per share, down 57,Aug 1 Exxon Mobil Corp on Thursdayreported a 57 percent decline in second-quarter profit as oiland gas output dropped  and earnings for its refining businessfell.

Title: Conoco in $720 million oil sands deal with Exxon, Imperial,UPDATE 2-Conoco in $720 mln oil sands deal with Exxon, Imperial
Body: ConocoPhillips  is selling its stake in a Canadian oil sands project to Exxon Mobil Corp  and Imperial Oil Ltd  for about $720 million as it focuses on its U.S. shale oil and natural gas operations.,Aug 8 ConocoPhillips is selling itsstake in a Canadian oil sands project to Exxon Mobil Corp and Imperial Oil Ltd for about $720 million asit focuses on its U.S. shale oil and natural gas operations.

Title: UPDATE 1-Oilfield services provider Frank's shares jump in debut,Exclusive: PetroChina to join Exxon at giant Iraqi oilfield,Frank's International shares rise 27 percent in market debut
Body: Aug 9 Shares of Frank's International NV,a provider of drilling equipment and services to Chevron Corp and Exxon Mobil Corp among others, soared 30percent in the company's debut as investors bet on internationalgrowth.,BEIJING/MOSCOW China's biggest energy firm PetroChina  will join Exxon Mobil  in developing Iraq's giant West Qurna oilfield and is in talks with Russia's Lukoil  to buy into a second project at the field, industry sources said.,Shares of Frank's International NV , a provider of drilling equipment and services to Chevron Corp , Exxon Mobil Corp  and ConocoPhillips  among others, jumped as much as 27 percent in the company's market debut.

Title: Turkey plays big in Kurdistan's energy game,Turkey plays big in Kurdistan's energy game,Exxon, Shell advance in Newfield's Asia auction: sources,UPDATE 1-Exxon, Shell advance in Newfield's Asia auction-sources,Exxon, Shell advance in Newfield's Asia auction-sources
Body: ANKARA Turkey has quietly built up a large presence in Kurdistan's oil and gas industry, teaming up with U.S. major Exxon Mobil, as Ankara bets on Iraq's semi-autonomous republic to help wean it off costly Russian and Iranian energy imports.,ANKARA, Aug 15 Turkey has quietly built up alarge presence in Kurdistan's oil and gas industry, teaming upwith U.S. major Exxon Mobil, as Ankara bets on Iraq'ssemi-autonomous republic to help wean it off costly Russian andIranian energy imports.,HONG KONG/KUALA LUMPUR Energy majors Exxon Mobil Corp  and Royal Dutch Shell  are among the suitors advancing to the next round of bidding for Newfield Exploration Co's  Malaysian and Chinese oil and gas fields valued at about $1.2 billion, people familiar with the matter said.,* Newfield unloading older assets to invest closer to home,HONG KONG/KUALA LUMPUR, Aug 15 Energy majorsExxon Mobil Corp and Royal Dutch Shell areamong the suitors advancing to the next round of bidding forNewfield Exploration Co's Malaysian and Chinese oil and gasfields valued at about $1.2 billion, people familiar with thematter said.

Title: UPDATE 1-InterOil says talks with Exxon ongoing over PNG gas fields,RPT-Turkey plays big in Kurdistan's energy game
Body: Aug 16 InterOil Corp and ExxonMobil Corp remain in talks to jointly develop InterOil's Elk andAntelope natural gas fields in Papua New Guinea, InterOil saidon Friday after a website reported negotiations had endedwithout an agreement.,ANKARA, Aug 15 Turkey has quietly built up alarge presence in Kurdistan's oil and gas industry, teaming upwith U.S. major Exxon Mobil, as Ankara bets on Iraq'ssemi-autonomous republic to help wean it off costly Russian andIranian energy imports.

Title: Freepoint Commodities invests in U.S. offshore oil and gas production
Body: NEW YORK, Aug 19 Freepoint Commodities LLC saidon Monday that, together with two other partners, it bought twooffshore oil and gas producing blocks from an Exxon Mobil Corp affiliate and W&T Offshore Inc for $110 million.

Title: UPDATE 1-China, Indonesia to join Exxon at giant Iraqi oilfield,Pertamina to buy part of Exxon stake in huge Iraqi oilfield-sources
Body: * PetroChina could take 25 percent stake in West Qurna-sources,LONDON, Aug 22 Indonesia's state oil firmPertamina is set to buy a stake in Iraq's giant WestQurna oilfield from Exxon Mobil, joining PetroChina inthe $50 billion project, industry and Iraqi oil sources said onThursday.

Title: OGX struggles as Petronas holds up deal, fields returned
Body: RIO DE JANEIRO/KUALA LUMPUR Shares in OGX PetrÃ_leo e Gas ParticipaÃ§Ãµes SA  fell for the first day in eight on Tuesday as the troubled oil producer abandoned the purchase of several oil exploration licenses and a venture with Malaysia's Petroliam Nasional Bhd seemed at serious risk.

Title: Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions,Exxon selling Iraqi oilfield stakes to Petro China, Pertamina: Iraq minister,Exxon selling Iraqi oilfield stakes to Petro China, Pertamina-Iraq minister
Body: Aug 23 The following bids, mergers, acquisitionsand disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Friday:,NEW DELHI Exxon Mobil  is selling stakes it controls in Iraq's West Qurna-1 oilfield to China's Petro China  and Indonesia's Pertamina , the country's oil minister confirmed on Friday.,NEW DELHI, Aug 23 Exxon Mobil is sellingstakes it controls in Iraq's West Qurna-1 oilfield to China'sPetro China and Indonesia's Pertamina, thecountry's oil minister confirmed on Friday.

Title: US STOCKS-Wall St rebounds as energy stocks rise over Syria
Body: * Chevron, Exxon boost Dow as oil prices rise on supplyconcerns

Title: TABLE-Indonesia expects 5 pct rise in oil output in 2014,Asia Naphtha-Exxon seen advancing shutdown of petchem unit to Sept
Body: Sept 4 Indonesia is expected to produce 870,000barrels of oil per day next year, up 5 percent from currentoutput, driven by increases from Exxon Mobil, state oil firmPertamina and China's CNOOC.    The following is the expected oil outputs by companies for2014 compared with this year, in barrels per day, according tothe energy ministry.    Company              2014 budget    2013 actual*     2013 budget                       estimate                        estimate    Chev,SINGAPORE, Sept 4 Exxon Mobil Corp is expectedto advance maintenance at its 900,000 tonnes per year (tpy)steam cracker in Singapore that feeds on naphtha and heavyresidue to around mid-September from October, trade and industrysources said on Wednesday.

Title: ConocoPhillips to pay BP, Exxon for Alaska pipeline costs,ConocoPhillips to pay BP, Exxon for Alaska pipeline costs
Body: ANCHORAGE, Alaska ConocoPhillips, Alaska's top-volume oil producer, will pay about $264 million to BP Plc to help cover the cost of transporting crude through the Trans Alaska Pipeline (TAPS), under a settlement approved on Tuesday by federal officials.,ANCHORAGE, Alaska, July 16 ConocoPhillips, Alaska's top-volume oil producer, will pay about $264million to BP Plc to help cover the cost of transportingcrude through the Trans Alaska Pipeline (TAPS), under asettlement approved on Tuesday by federal officials.

Title: Exxon to export first Kashagan oil cargo via CPC in Oct
Body: LONDON, Sept 12 U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil will export the first ever crude cargo from the giantKashagan field in Kazakhstan at the end of October, traders saidand a loading plan showed on Thursday.

Title: Exxon Mobil unit charged for Pennsylvania fracking waste spill,Western oilmen in Iraq brace for Syria backlash
Body: NEW YORK An Exxon Mobil Corp subsidiary is being charged by the Pennsylvania attorney general for spilling more than 50,000 gallons of wastewater at a natural gas well site in 2010.,* Exxon moves staff to Dubai until tension eases - Iraqisecurity source

Title: Exxon to cut back Libya presence as security crumbles
Body: LONDON, Sept 17 ExxonMobil, the world'slargest publicly-traded energy company, said on Tuesday it wouldcut back its staff and operations in Libya as growinginstability no longer justified a major presence.

Title: Tate drags as FTSE 100 loses steam post Fed
Body: LONDON, Sept 20 Britain's top shares fell onFriday, with Tate & Lyle falling on short-term earnings worriesand the broader index flagging after the previous session's bigrise.

Title: Brazil oil sale draws weak interest; Exxon, BP, BG pass,UPDATE 3-Brazil oil sale draws weak interest; Exxon, BP, BG pass,Exxon, BP, BG to pass on bids for Brazil offshore Libra prospect
Body: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's planned auction of its biggest-ever oil discovery attracted only a quarter of the interest expected by the government after many of the large, wealthy oil companies with experience in the region declined to sign up for the sale.,RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept 19 Brazil's planned auctionof its biggest-ever oil discovery attracted only a quarter ofthe interest expected by the government after many of the large,wealthy oil companies with experience in the region declined tosign up for the sale.,Exxon Mobil Corp, BP Plc and BG Group Plc decided not to make bids for the giant offshore Libra oilprospect that Brazil plans to auction on Oct. 21, MagdaChambriard, head of Brazil's oil regulator ANP, said onThursday.

Title: Rosneft says Exxon's Russia LNG project intact,Gazprom opposes Rosneft and Exxon's Russia LNG plans
Body: MOSCOW, Sept 25 Rosneft on Wednesdaydismissed Gazprom's opposition to its liquefied natural gasproject with Exxon in Russia, saying the plans areintact for building the plant, increasing the stakes incompetition for the lucrative market.,YUZHNO-SAKHALINSK, Russia, Sept 25 Gazprom, faced with rising competition on the liquefiednatural gas (LNG) market, voiced strong opposition on Wednesdayto plans by Rosneft and Exxon to build theirown LNG plant in Russia.

Title: Gazprom says no talks on gas from Exxon's Sakhalin,REUTERS SUMMIT-Gazprom says no talks on gas from Exxon's Sakhalin-1
Body: YUZHNO-SAKHALINSK, Russia Gazprom  has halted talks on buying gas from the Exxon Mobil-led  Sakhalin-1 project after years of fruitless attempts to secure a deal, Deputy Chief Executive Alexander Medvedev told Reuters.,* Gazprom may link China gas deal to Asian products basket

Title: In big shift, Exxon to provide same-sex marriage benefits,Exxon to start maintenance at Singapore petchem plant on Sep 28
Body: HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp said on Friday it will extend benefits to spouses of its U.S. workers in same-sex marriages, a sweeping reversal by one of the world's top companies following a landmark Supreme Court ruling in June.,SINGAPORE, Sept 27 Exxon Mobil Corp will shutsome of its operating units at its Singapore Chemical Plant(SCP) for a planned maintenance on Sept. 28, the company said ina statement on Friday.

Title: Exxon, Shell may bid in Sri Lanka oil, gas block auction - govt
Body: NEW DELHI, Sept 26 Oil majors Exxon Mobil Corp, Royal Dutch Shell Plc and France's Total have shown interest in bidding for blocks offered inSri Lanka's current licensing round, the island nation'supstream regulator said on Thursday.

Title: UPDATE 4-Rare bomb attack in Iraqi Kurdish capital kills six
Body: * ExxonMobil, Chevron Corp among oil firms in region (Adds details, U.N. statement, analyst, security forcescomment)

Title: Exxon secures extra $1.5 billion financing for PNG LNG,Exxon secures extra $1.5 bln financing for PNG LNG
Body: PERTH Exxon Mobil  has secured an additional $1.5 billion in debt financing for its $19 billion Papua New Guinea liquefied natural gas (LNG) project, its project partner Oil Search  said on Friday.,PERTH, Oct 4 Exxon Mobil has secured anadditional $1.5 billion in debt financing for its $19 billionPapua New Guinea liquefied natural gas (LNG) project, itsproject partner Oil Search said on Friday.

Title: US STOCKS-Wall St ends session lower but posts gains for October,REFILE-US STOCKS-Wall St edges up in wake of Fed; Exxon a boost,Exxon's output rises but refining weakness hits profit,Exxon says considering Edmonton rail terminal to move Kearl crude,Imperial Oil Q3 profit falls 38 pct as oil prices squeeze refining,UPDATE 3-Exxon's output rises but refining weakness hits profit,CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Exxon's quarterly profit down but output rises,Exxon's quarterly profit down 18 percent, refining hurts
Body: * Exxon Mobil shares rise after results beat Wall Stforecast,* Exxon Mobil shares rise after results beat Wall Streetforecast,Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded oil company, reported higher-than-expected quarterly results on Thursday as output rose for the first time in more than two years, but refining weakness hurt earnings.,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp  is looking into building a rail terminal in Edmonton, Canada to move crude from its Kearl tar sands field to refineries in the United States, the company said on Thursday.,CALGARY, Alberta, Oct 31 Imperial Oil Ltd, Canada's No. 2 oil producer and refiner, said onThursday that third-quarter profit fell 38 percent as higher oilprices squeezed earnings from its refineries.,Oct 31 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, reportedhigher-than-expected quarterly results on Thursday as outputrose for the first time in more than two years, but refiningweakness hurt earnings.,(Correct second paragraph to read first nine months, not firstthree),Oct 31 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, on Thursday reported an 18percent decrease in quarterly profit on weak refining margins.

Title: Exxon faces $2.7 million fine for Arkansas pipeline spill,Exxon faces $2.7 mln fine for Arkansas pipeline spill
Body: WASHINGTON Exxon Mobil Pipeline Co  faces a fine of nearly $2.7 million for a pipeline spill of thousands of barrels of Canadian crude oil in an Arkansas suburb last spring, the U.S. pipeline safety office said on Wednesday.,WASHINGTON, Nov 6 Exxon Mobil Pipeline Co faces a fine of nearly $2.7 million for a pipeline spillof thousands of barrels of Canadian crude oil in an Arkansassuburb last spring, the U.S. pipeline safety office said onWednesday.

Title: Exxon Mobil granted extension to work on shut Pegasus oil pipe
Body: NEW YORK, Nov 12 Exxon Mobil has beengranted a 90-day extension to submit a plan to repair its70-year-old Pegasus oil pipeline that ruptured in Arkansas inMarch this year, guaranteeing the line will be closed until atleast January, according to a filing from the Pipeline andHazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA).

Title: Buffett's Berkshire buys sizable new Exxon Mobil stake,UPDATE 2-Buffett's Berkshire buys sizable new Exxon Mobil stake,Buffett's Berkshire buys big Exxon Mobil stake
Body: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc   on Thursday disclosed a new $3.45 billion stake in Exxon Mobil Corp , after buying 40.1 million shares in the world's largest publicly traded oil company.,* Exxon shares have lagged market, rise after-hours (Adds analyst comments, other holdings),Nov 14 Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  on Thursday disclosed a new $3.45 billionstake in Exxon Mobil Corp, after buying 40.1 millionshares in the world's largest publicly traded oil company.

Title: BRIEF-CLP Holdings says unit entered into acquisition agreements with units of Exxon Mobil Corp

Body: NEW YORK, Nov 19 A fire caused Exxon Mobil toshut its gas processing plant in Kingsville, Texas, the companysaid on Tuesday, but no injuries were reported.,NEW YORK Short-seller Jim Chanos said he was bearish on oil companies like Exxon Mobil Corp. and said the U.S. stock market was becoming riskier, while Aaron Cowen, of hedge fund Suvretta Capital Management, said the market has yet to reach a peak.,NEW YORK Short-seller Jim Chanos said on Tuesday that shares of international oil majors like Exxon Mobil Corp increasingly look like a value trap for investors as cash flows decline and return on capital slides.,(For other news from Reuters Global Investment Outlook Summit,click on http://www.reuters.com/summit/Investment13) (Adds bellwether Sotheby's, Exxon Mobil background),(For other news from Reuters Global Investment Outlook Summit,click on http://www.reuters.com/summit/Investment13) (Adds background on Exxon, quotes on equities and Europe),NEW YORK, Nov 19 Short-seller Jim Chanos said onTuesday that shares of the international oil majors like ExxonMobil Corp increasingly look like a value trap forinvestors as cash flows decline and returns slide.,(Adds Adcock Ingram, Blackstone Group, Rolls-Royce, Pemex,Loewe, JSW, Teva Pharmaceutical; updates Deutsche Boerse),* Deal marks state-ownded CSG's first overseas investment,(Corrects company name in lead paragraph to China SouthernPower Grid),HONG KONG Exxon Mobil Corp  has agreed to sell its majority stakes in a Hong Kong utility and a power storage firm for a combined $3.4 billion, helping the U.S. oil major raise funds to plough back into its core operations.

Title: INDONESIA PRESS-Pertamina buys 10 pct stakes in Exxon Mobil Iraq - Investor Daily
Body: PT Pertamina Irak Eksplorasi Produksi, a unit of state oil andgas firm PT Pertamina, has finalized a deal to buy 10percent shares in Exxon Mobil Iraq Limited in WestQurna-1 block, Iraq, which currently produces 500,000 barrels ofoil per day, Investor Daily reports. The block is estimated tohave oil reserves of about 9 billion barrels.

Title: Major companies plan for U.S. carbon emissions fee, report says
Body: WASHINGTON, Dec 5 Major U.S. companies, fromWal-Mart and Google Inc. to Shell andExxonMobil, are including future charges for carbonemissions in their strategic plans, according to a reportreleased on Thursday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Petrochina buys 25 pct of Exxon's interests in major Iraq field,BRIEF-Petrochina acquires Exxon Mobil's 25 pct interest in Iraq oilfield,Exxon to sign over part of Iraq oilfield stake to Petrochina,Exxon to sign over part of Iraq oilfield stake to Petrochina
Body: BAGHDAD, Nov 28 PetroChina  has bought a 25 percent stake in the West Qurna-1 oilfieldproject from Exxon Mobil, strengthening China's hold onIraq's energy resources.,* Says acquires Exxon Mobil's 25 percent interest inWest Qurna-1 oilfield in IraqFurther company coverage:,BAGHDAD U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil  will hand over a 25 percent stake in Iraq's West Qurna-1 oilfield project to China's biggest energy company PetroChina   on Thursday, Iraq's deputy prime minister for energy said.,BAGHDAD, Nov 28 U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil will hand over a 25 percent stake in Iraq's West Qurna-1oilfield project to China's biggest energy company PetroChina  on Thursday, Iraq's deputy prime ministerfor energy said.

Title: UPDATE 2-Statoil, ExxonMobil plan aggressive Tanzania exploration,Statoil, ExxonMobil make big gas find off Tanzania
Body: * Hopes to hear from government on LNG plant plan byChristmas,OSLO, Dec 6 Energy firms Statoil andExxonMobil have made yet another big gas discovery offTanzania, Statoil said in a statement on Friday.

Title: Exxon stock zeroes in on $100 per share as rally stretches,Exxon stock zeroes in on $100 per share as rally stretches,UPDATE 1-Exxon further cuts share in Japan refining amid sector rejig
Body: HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp  stock on Wednesday neared $100 per share, the continuation of a rally fueled by investor expectations that the world's largest publicly traded oil company would return more cash to shareholders in coming months.,HOUSTON, Dec 18 Exxon Mobil Corp stockon Wednesday neared $100 per share, the continuation of a rallyfueled by investor expectations that the world's largestpublicly traded oil company would return more cash toshareholders in coming months.,* ExxonMobil pulls back further from declining Japan market

Title: US STOCKS-Upbeat data, deals lift Wall St; traders keep eye on Fed
Body: * Avago to buy LSI for $6.6 bln; AIG to sell unit for $5.4bln

Title: COLUMN-Hot 2014 investing tip: Don't chase 2013,RPT-Qatar says can help Iran get more from world's biggest gas field
Body: CHICAGO, Dec 23 This year, the stock market hasbeen glowing as brightly as the seasonal lights that now bedeckholiday streetscapes.,DOHA, Dec 23 Qatar wants to help Iran to developits share of the world's biggest gas field so both countries canreap the maximum long-term rewards, sources at state-run QatarPetroleum (QP) say.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon upbeat on Mexico oil reform, BHP sees potential,UPDATE 2-Exxon expects N. American liquids output to rise 40 pct by 2040,CORRECTED-Exxon pushes for U.S. oil exports - WSJ,UPDATE 2-Chevron sees cost jump at Australia Gorgon LNG project
Body: HOUSTON, Dec 12 Opening Mexico's oil sector toforeign investors would be a "win-win" for all involved, anExxon Mobil Corp executive said on Thursday.,Dec 12 North American liquids production isexpected to rise by more than 40 percent between 2010 and 2040,driven by technological advancements that enable increasedoutput from sources such as oil sands, Exxon Mobil Corp said on Thursday.,(Corrects paragraph 1 to show that the comment on U.S. oilexports was based on an interview with an Exxon executive, notthe company's energy outlook report),LOS ANGELES, Dec 12 Chevron Corp raisedthe cost of its giant Gorgon liquefied natural gas (LNG) projectin Australia by $2 billion on Wednesday, the second increase injust over a year to take the total cost to $54 billion.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon offers rare gasoil term contract from S.Arabia,Exxonmobil offers rare gasoil term for 2014 from S.Arabia refinery
Body: * Sign of Saudi Arabia becoming self-sufficient in meetinggasoil needs,SINGAPORE, Dec 11 Exxonmobil has offeredgasoil cargoes through a rare term tender from its joint-venturerefinery in Saudi Arabia, trade sources said on Wednesday.

Title: UPDATE 2-Frigid temperatures snarl some U.S. refinery operations
Body: HOUSTON, Jan 7 Frigid weather rattled severalU.S. refiners on Tuesday, temporarily affecting production fromCanada to Tennessee, and boosting wholesale gasoline prices inthe Midwest more than 7 cents a gallon.

Title: US STOCKS-Wall Street loses steam as retailers, Exxon weigh,US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Indexes at session lows; Exxon Mobil, retailers weigh
Body: * Intercept Pharma drug meets goal in trial, shares triple,NEW YORK, Jan 9 U.S. stocks fell to session lowsby late morning trade on Thursday, weighed down by Exxon Mobiland retailers as an earlier boost from upbeat labor market datalost steam.

Title: ExxonMobil to boost Mobil-branded fuel in Australia
Body: MELBOURNE, Jan 9 ExxonMobil has signed adeal to sell Mobil-branded fuel at 7-Eleven service stations,reviving the Mobil brand in Australia's biggest markets on theeast coast since it sold its retail assets to 7-Eleven in 2010.

Title: ExxonMobil starts producing ultra-low sulphur diesel in Singapore
Body: SINGAPORE, Jan 21 Exxon Mobil Corp saidon Tuesday its new hydrotreater has started operations and isproducing ultra-low sulphur diesel at its 592,000 barrels perday (bpd) Singapore refinery.

Title: Santos set for revenue boost as Exxon Mobil gas project nears
Body: SYDNEY, Jan 23 Australia's Santos Ltd expects a sharp boost in production and cash flow in the secondhalf of 2014 as liquefied natural gas begins flowing from thePapua New Guinea gas project it has a stake in.

Title: Worker injured during Exxon Baytown gofiner overhaul: sources,Worker injured during overhaul on Exxon Baytown gofiner: sources
Body: HOUSTON A worker was injured on Wednesday after falling into a reactor while performing an overhaul on a shut gofiner unit at Exxon Mobil Corp's 560,500 barrel per day (bpd) refinery in Baytown, Texas, according to sources familiar with operations at the refinery.,HOUSTON A worker was injured on Wednesday after falling into a reactor while performing an overhaul on a shut gofiner unit at Exxon Mobil Corp's  560,500 barrel per day (bpd) refinery in Baytown, Texas, according to sources familiar with operations at the refinery.

Title: Ukraine postpones signing gas production sharing deal with Exxon
Body: KIEV, Jan 27 The signing of a gasproduction-sharing agreement between Ukraine and aninternational consortium led by U.S. major Exxon Mobil has been postponed for the second time in a row, Ukraine's fueland energy minister said on Monday.

Title: Conoco beats expectations as bigger oil rivals struggle,WRAPUP 1-Conoco beats expectations as bigger oil rivals struggle,Exxon Mobil profit tumbles as energy production tapers,UPDATE 5-Exxon Mobil profit tumbles as energy production tapers,Exxon Mobil 4th-quarter profit drops 16 percent
Body: HOUSTON Oil producer ConocoPhillips  outshone larger competitors on Thursday with a quarterly profit that beat expectations as it moved to overcome the problems of high costs and lack of fresh reserves that have nagged at Exxon Mobil Corp  and Royal Dutch Shell .,HOUSTON, Jan 30 Oil producer ConocoPhillips outshone larger competitors on Thursday with a quarterlyprofit that beat expectations as it moved to overcome theproblems of high costs and lack of fresh reserves that havenagged at Exxon Mobil Corp and Royal Dutch Shell.,Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded oil company by market value, posted lower-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday as it failed to offset declining production but spent heavily to find fresh reserves.,Jan 30 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company by market value, postedlower-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday as it failed tooffset declining production but spent heavily to find freshreserves.,Jan 30 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'smost valuable publicly traded oil company, said on Thursday itsquarterly profit dropped 16 percent as production fell.

Title: Investor group demands fossil fuel companies disclose carbon asset risk,EU mergers and takeovers (Feb 12)
Body: WASHINGTON, Feb 12 A group of investors withcombined assets of over $200 billion filed shareholderresolutions on Wednesday with ten energy companies, includingExxon Mobil and Southern Co, demanding theydisclose their strategies for competing in a lower-carbonfuture.,BRUSSELS, Feb 12 The following are mergers underreview by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EUmerger process:

Title: Exxon says its oil and gas reserves rose slightly in 2013,Vitol pays $2.6 billion for Shell's Australian refinery, petrol stations
Body: Feb 21 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, said on Friday its crudeoil and natural gas reserves rose slightly in 2013, lifted byprojects in U.S. shale fields and Abu Dhabi.,SYDNEY/SINGAPORE Top global oil trader Vitol SA  is buying Royal Dutch Shell's  Australian refinery and petrol stations for about $2.6 billion in its biggest acquisition, looking to grab a share of a growing oil product market.

Title: Turkey's TPAO says in talks with Exxon, OMV, MOL for joint oil exploration
Body: ISTANBUL, Feb 19 Turkey is holding talks withinternational oil companies for joint oil exploration in BlackSea, the head of state-owned exploration firm TPAO said onWednesday.

Title: RPT-UPDATE 2-Oil Search positions for LNG expansion with $900 mln PNG buy,UPDATE 2-Oil Search positions for LNG expansion with $900 mln PNG buy,Oil Search buys 23 pct stake in PNG gas fields for $900 mln
Body: * Oil Search plans talks with Total, InterOil, ExxonMobil,* Oil Search plans talks with Total, InterOil, ExxonMobil,MELBOURNE, Feb 27 Oil Search Ltd agreedon Thursday to acquire a 23 percent stake for $900 million intwo Papua New Guinea gas fields that could feed a proposedliquefied natural gas (LNG) project in the country or supply gasto ExxonMobil's PNG LNG project.

Title: Sea otters back to pre-Exxon Valdez oil spill numbers in Alaska
Body: OLYMPIA, Wash., Feb 28 Nearly 25 years after theExxon Valdez oil spill off the southern coast of Alaska, seaotters in the most affected parts of Prince William Sound haverecovered to their pre-spill numbers, a federal report releasedon Friday showed.

Title: UPDATE 6-Chevron opts to keep massive budget in bid to boost output
Body: By Ernest Scheyder    Jan 31 Chevron Corp plans to keepspending roughly $40 billion per year for the next several yearson new oil and natural gas projects in a bid to lift productionthat is on track to be flat for the third straight year.    That stay-the-course approach, announced on Friday after thesecond-largest U.S. oil company said its quarterly profitdropped 32 percent, spooked investors and prompted the stock tofall 3.5 percent, the most of any large energy producer th

Title: Exxon seeks regulatory OK to restart part of Pegasus oil line,ExxonMobil seeks settlement in $800 million Chad tax dispute: sources,UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil seeks settlement in $800 mln Chad tax dispute -sources,ExxonMobil seeks settlement in $800 mln Chad tax dispute -sources
Body: NEW YORK, March 11 Exxon Mobil hassought permission from regulators to restart a Texas stretch ofthe Pegasus oil pipeline that it says was not affected by a linerupture in Arkansas in March 2013.,N'DJAMENA An ExxonMobil led consortium in Chad is seeking an out-of-court settlement after the government filed a legal claim for more than $800 million in unpaid taxes, finance ministry sources said on Tuesday.,N'DJAMENA, March 11 An ExxonMobil led consortium in Chad is seeking an out-of-court settlement afterthe government filed a legal claim for more than $800 million inunpaid taxes, finance ministry sources said on Tuesday.,N'DJAMENA, March 11 An ExxonMobil-led consortium in Chad is seeking an out-of-court settlement afterthe government filed a legal claim for more than $800 million inunpaid taxes, finance ministry sources said on Tuesday.

Title: Exxon Mobil announces five-part benchmark bond
Body: NEW YORK, March 17 (IFR) - Oil giant Exxon Mobil, one ofjust a handful of triple A rated US corporate borrowers, onMonday announced a new five-part US dollar benchmark bond toprice later in the day.

Title: Exxon agrees to detail carbon asset risks - activists
Body: BOSTON, March 20 ExxonMobil Corp willreport on how it views the risks climate change could pose tothe value of its assets, shareholder activists said on Thursday.

Title: UPDATE 4-Oil spill cleanup efforts continue off Texas Gulf shore
Body: * Coast Guard says no timeline for reopening Houston Channel

Title: Exxon expects flat output in 2014, spending to drop 6 percent,UPDATE 3-Exxon expects flat output in 2014, spending to drop 6 pct,EU mergers and takeovers (March 5),Exxon CEO says Russian oil and gas activity normal so far,Exxon sees 2014 spending lower at $39.8 billion,BRIEF-Exxon Mobil sees 2014 capex of $39.8 billion
Body: NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded energy company, said on Wednesday it expects oil and natural gas production to be flat this year as overall spending falls 6 percent to about $39.8 billion.,NEW YORK, March 5 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's largest publicly traded energy company, said onWednesday it expects oil and natural gas production to be flatthis year as overall spending falls 6 percent to about $39.8billion.,BRUSSELS, March 5 The following are mergersunder review by the European Commission and a brief guide to theEU merger process:,March 5 The chief executive officer of ExxonMobil Corp on Wednesday said that tensions betweenUkraine and Russia have so far not disrupted its oil and gasactivity in Russia.,NEW YORK, March 5 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's largest publicly traded oil company, expects to spendless this year while oil and natural gas production is forecastto be flat.,HOUSTON, March 5 Exxon Mobil Corp : * Sees 2014 capex of $39.8 billion * Expects oil and gas output to be flat in 2014 * Expects to spend under $37 billion per year from 2015 to 2017 * Expects production to grow 2 percent to 3 percent from2015-2017 * Expects to start production on 10 major projects in 2014

Title: Houston ship lane to have 'tapered' reopening; Exxon cuts output,UPDATE 5-Houston ship lane to have 'tapered' reopening; Exxon cuts output,Sinopec aims to complete mega marketing asset sale in third quarter,UPDATE 6-Vital Houston oil tanker routes shut amid spill cleanup
Body: TEXAS CITY, Texas U.S. authorities expected a "tapered" re-opening of the Houston Ship Channel, but gave no timeline on Monday of when vessels could start moving again after an oil barge spill shut the waterway for a third day, forcing the nation's second-largest refinery to curb production. |Â ,* Coast Guard says will re-open channel 'as soon as we can',HONG KONG State-run oil giant China Petroleum and Chemical Corp (Sinopec Corp)  aims to complete the sale of up to 30 percent of its sprawling marketing business in the third quarter of this year, a restructuring analysts say could raise $10-$20 billion.,* Coast Guard says no timeline for reopening Houston Channel

Title: VIETNAM PRESS-Exxon Mobil plans $20 bln power project in Vietnam - Thanh Nien
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp is preparing to invest around $20billion in a gas-fired power complex with Vietnam's state oiland gas group Petrovietnam, according to the Trade Ministry, theThanh Nien (Young People) newspaper reports.

Title: UPDATE 1-Russia's Rosneft, with US partner Exxon, on track with LNG plant
Body: * Rosneft to launch plant by 2018-19, sees gas output up (Adds details, background)

Title: Exxon sees little climate change risk to assets,U.S. allows partial restart of Exxon pipeline a year after spill,UPDATE 2-U.S. allows partial restart of Exxon pipeline a year after spill,U.S. allows Exxon to restart section of Pegasus oil pipeline
Body: HOUSTON, March 31 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's largest publicly traded oil company, said on Monday thatrisks related to climate change pose little risk to its oil andgas reserves because the resources will be needed to meetexpected growth in energy demand.,WASHINGTON A U.S. regulator on Monday allowed Exxon Mobil Corp to restart operations on the Texas leg of its Pegasus pipeline, which spilled thousands of barrels of oil into a residential area in Arkansas last year.,WASHINGTON, March 31 A U.S. regulator on Mondayallowed Exxon Mobil Corp to restart operations on theTexas leg of its Pegasus pipeline, which spilled thousands ofbarrels of oil into a residential area in Arkansas last year.,WASHINGTON, March 31 The U.S. pipeline safetyoffice said on Monday it has allowed Exxon Mobil to restart thesouthern section of the Pegasus crude oil pipeline that rupturedlast year in Arkansas.

Title: UPDATE 1-PNG to nearly double crude exports this year
Body: SINGAPORE, April 1 Oil liquids from ExxonMobil's gas export project in Papua New Guinea will be blendedinto the country's only crude blend, the company said Wednesday,almost doubling crude exports by the middle of the year.

Title: Exxon Mobil agrees to share more data on fracking risks,UPDATE 1-Exxon Mobil agrees to share more data on fracking risks,Exxon Mobil agrees to share more data on fracking's risks
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp, the world's largest publicly traded oil company, has agreed to disclose more information about the environmental risks of hydraulic fracturing, the process known as fracking.,April 3 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, has agreed to disclose moreinformation about the environmental risks of hydraulicfracturing, the process known as fracking.,April 3 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, has agreed to disclose moreinformation about the environmental risks of hydraulicfracturing, the process known as fracking.

Title: Russia's Rosneft says starts surveys in Arctic JV with Exxon
Body: MOSCOW, April 4 Russia's top oil producerRosneft said on Friday it had started geophysical surveys in theeastern Arctic, advancing work with ExxonMobil despiteWestern sanctions over Ukraine.

Title: UPDATE 4-Japan drugmaker Takeda to fight $6 bln damages awarded by U.S. jury,Japan drugmaker Takeda to fight $6 billion damages imposed by U.S. jury
Body: * Louisiana jury orders $6 bln damages from Takeda, $3 blnfrom Eli Lilly,SAN FRANCISCO/TOKYO Takeda Pharmaceutical Co Ltd said it would contest $6 billion in punitive damages imposed by a U.S. federal jury in a case alleging that Japan's largest drugmaker had concealed cancer risks associated with its Actos diabetes drug.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon works to reopen UK pipeline after tapping device found,Exxon finds tapping device on UK oil pipeline
Body: LONDON, April 22 Exxon Mobil is workingto reopen one of Britain's main underground fuel pipelines afterthe discovery of a tapping device and a stash of diesel thatpolice believe was siphoned off by thieves.,LONDON, April 22 Exxon Mobil said itfound a tapping device on a UK oil products pipeline followingreports that a stash of diesel had been discovered that policesaid had been siphoned off by thieves.

Title: Imperial Oil says decision on Canadian LNG project still distant,Exxon re-opens UK oil pipeline has after closure due to theft,Pakistan's Engro Corp plans two-tranche listed sukuk
Body: CALGARY, Alberta, April 24 Imperial Oil Ltd said on Thursday it is not yet close to deciding onwhether it will go ahead with a Canadian liquefied natural gasexport plant it is exploring with its majority owner Exxon MobilCorp.,LONDON, April 24 ExxonMobil said onThursday that its Midline UK pipeline had resumed operationsafter its closure following the discovery of fuel theft and atapping device.,April 24 Pakistani conglomerate Engro Corp, a former unit of Exxon Mobil Corp, plans toraise as much as 4 billion rupees ($40.9 million) through listedsukuk (Islamic bonds), Pakistan Credit Rating Agency Limitedsaid.

Title: UPDATE 3-Exxon shuts UK pipeline as police investigate fuel theft,Esso shuts UK fuel pipeline after theft report,Top court declines Exxon's appeal in water pollution case,U.S. top court declines Exxon's appeal in water pollution case
Body: LONDON, April 21 Exxon Mobil shut one ofBritain's main underground fuel pipelines, it said on Monday,after police found a stash of diesel they believe was siphonedoff by thieves.,LONDON, April 21 Exxon's UK arm Esso hasshut a pipeline running from its Fawley oil refinery nearSouthampton for checks, the company said on Monday, after areport that thieves tapped into the line and took thousands oflitres of fuel.,WASHINGTON The Supreme Court on Monday declined to review a ruling against Exxon Mobil Corp that ordered the company to pay $105 million in damages for polluting New York City's groundwater with a toxic gasoline additive.,WASHINGTON, April 21 The U.S. Supreme Court onMonday declined to review a ruling against Exxon Mobil Corp that ordered the company to pay $105 million in damagesfor polluting New York City's groundwater with a toxic gasolineadditive.

Title: Argentine province expects Big Oil to bid in shale block auction,Exxon Mobil boosts dividend by 10 percent
Body: HOUSTON, April 30 Argentina's Neuquen provinceexpects major global energy companies, including Royal DutchShell, Chevron Corp and Exxon Mobil Corp, to bid in a May auction of 11 oil blocks, its energyminister said on Wednesday.,April 30 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, said on Thursday it wouldraise its quarterly dividend by 10 percent.

Title: UPDATE 2-Putin sees no need to sanction West, may review energy ties
Body: MINSK, April 29 Russian President Vladimir Putinsaid on Tuesday that Moscow saw no need for counter sanctionsagainst the West, but could reconsider the participation ofWestern companies in its economy, including energy projects.

Title: RPT-Wall St Week Ahead-A burst of energy with Exxon, Chevron on tap
Body: NEW YORK, April 27 Since late February, wheninvestors fell out of love with biotechnology and otherhigh-flying stocks, the market's fuel has been oil.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon's Papua New Guinea LNG project ahead of schedule,Exxon's Papua New Guinea project starts LNG production before schedule
Body: April 28 Exxon Mobil Corp said a $19billion project in Papua New Guinea had started production ofliquefied natural gas (LNG) ahead of schedule.,April 28 Exxon Mobil Corp said itsproject in Papua New Guinea had started production of liquefiednatural gas (LNG) ahead of schedule.

Title: Exxon, Conoco see a quarterly payoff from natural gas,WRAPUP 2-Exxon, Conoco see a quarterly payoff from natural gas,Exxon says all activities in Russia proceeding as planned,UPDATE 1-Exxon says all activities in Russia proceeding as planned,Exxon says all activities in Russia proceeding as planned,WRAPUP 1-Exxon, Conoco see a quarterly payoff from natural gas,ExxonMobil profits pumped higher on natural gas price boost,UPDATE 2-ExxonMobil profits pumped higher on natural gas price boost,CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Exxon Mobil profit easily beats Wall Street's expectations,Exxon Mobil quarterly profit slips 4 percent
Body: HOUSTON/NEW YORK U.S. oil companies Exxon Mobil Corp and ConocoPhillips both reported first-quarter earnings that exceeded Wall Street expectations on Thursday, helped partly by higher natural gas prices.,HOUSTON/NEW YORK, May 1 U.S. oil companies ExxonMobil Corp and ConocoPhillips both reportedfirst-quarter earnings that exceeded Wall Street expectations onThursday, helped partly by higher  natural gas prices.,NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp. said on Thursday that expansion projects planned in Russia for this year are proceeding normally, even amidst recent sanctions imposed against the country for its involvement in Ukraine.,NEW YORK, May 1 Exxon Mobil Corp. saidon Thursday that expansion projects planned in Russia for thisyear are proceeding normally, even amidst recent sanctionsimposed against the country for its involvement in Ukraine.,NEW YORK, May 1 All work Exxon Mobil Corp. planned for this year in Russia is proceeding asscheduled, the world's largest publicly-traded energy companysaid on Thursday.,HOUSTON/NEW YORK, May 1 U.S. oil companies ExxonMobil Corp and ConocoPhillips both reportedfirst-quarter earnings that exceeded Wall Street expectations onThursday, helped partly by higher  natural gas prices.,Exxon Mobil Corp, the world's largest publicly traded oil company, posted a quarterly profit on Thursday that hands down beat Wall Street's expectations as a bitterly cold winter throughout much of the United States boosted natural gas prices.,* Weaker refining margins (Adds financial data, stock, background),May 1 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, posted a quarterly profiton Thursday that easily beat Wall Street's expectations ashigher natural gas prices offset a dip in oil production.,May 1 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, said on Thursday itsquarterly profit dropped 4 percent due in part to weakerrefining margins.

Title: UPDATE 1-EnQuest buys into Malaysian oil field to grow outside of core UK market,EnQuest agrees to buy ExxonMobil share in Malaysian oil field,Pakistan's Engro Corp issues two-tranche retail sukuk
Body: LONDON, June 13 North-Sea focused oil producerEnQuest has agreed to take over ExxonMobil's share in the Malaysian Seligi oil field, expanding itsproduction portfolio outside of its core UK market.,LONDON, June 13 British independent oil producerEnQuest has agreed to take over ExxonMobil's share in the Malaysian Seligi oil field and the associatedproduction sharing contract.,June 13 Pakistani conglomerate Engro Corp, a former unit of Exxon Mobil Corp, has raised1 billion rupees ($10 million) from an issue of Islamic bonds inthe retail market, the company said in a regulatory filing.

Title: Exxon starts construction on Texas chemical plant
Body: June 19 Exxon Mobil Corp said onThursday it has started construction on a new chemical plant inBaytown, Texas, and begun expanding a nearby plant, part of aplan to use shale-derived natural gas to make plastics and othermaterial.

Title: Norway unions, industry in talks to avert oil strike,Esso (Thailand) shuts naphtha hydrofiner, aromatic plant for 21 days
Body: OSLO, June 17 Mediation between Norwegianoffshore oil workers and the industry began on Tuesday in anattempt to avert a strike at GDF Suez and ExxonMobil platforms, the Norwegian Oil and Gas Association said.,BANGKOK, June 17 Esso (Thailand), aunit of Exxon Mobil Corp, said on Tuesday it has shutdown its naphtha hydrofiner and aromatic plant for 21 days fromJune 14 to improve refinery efficiency and reliability.

Title: UPDATE 1-Exxon boss affirms commitment to Russia at Moscow conference
Body: MOSCOW, June 16 Exxon Mobil's ChiefExecutive Rex Tillerson affirmed his commitment to doingbusiness with Russia on Monday with a speech at a high-profileindustry conference in Moscow.

Body: ANKARA, June 23 U.S. oil firm ExxonMobil is in talks with state-run Turkish Petroleum Corporation over aventure to explore for shale gas in the country's southeast andnorthwest regions, a Turkish energy official said.,ANKARA, June 23 ExxonMobil is in talkswith the state-run Turkish Petroleum Corporation on exploringfor shale gas in the country's southeast and northwest regions,the head of the Energy Ministry's General Directorate ofPetroleum Affairs said.

Body: * Investors fret over Argentina default fallout, Russiatensions,* Investors fret over Argentina default fallout, Russiatensions,* Investors fret over Argentina default fallout, Russiatensions,Exxon Mobil Corp , the world's largest publicly traded oil company, reported a stronger-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday as higher prices for its crude and natural gas offset a 6 percent drop in production.,(Adds Breakingviews link, updates share price)    By Ernest Scheyder    July 31 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, reported astronger-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday as higherprices for its crude and natural gas offset a 6 percent drop inproduction.    Exxon has struggled in recent quarters to replenish itsreserves quickly, investing in massive new projects in Russiaand Papua New Guinea that take years to develop.     Meanwhile, man,* Jobless claims rise more than expected in latest week;wages rise,* Indexes down: Dow 0.7 pct, S&P 0.8 pct, Nasdaq 0.9 pct (Updates to open, adds Chicago PMI data),* Futures down: Dow 132 pts, S&P 16.5 pts, Nasdaq 35.25 pts (Updates prices, adds jobless claims data),July 31 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world'slargest publicly traded oil company, said on Thursday itsquarterly profit jumped 28 percent on higher prices for crudeand natural gas.

Title: Seadrill wins $497 mln Exxon contract in Nigeria
Body: OSLO, Aug 8 Seadrill, the world'sbiggest offshore driller by market capitalisation, won atwo-year $497 million contract from ExxonMobil for oneof its newly built rigs, the firm said on Friday.

Title: Alaska voters get their say in state's oil tax system
Body: JUNEAU, Aug 19 Alaska voters will decide inTuesday's primary whether to repeal or uphold a new law thatcuts taxes on oil production and is worth up to $1 billion ayear to companies such as Conoco Phillips, BP Plc and Exxon Mobil Corp.

Title: UPDATE 1-Alaska voters narrowly backing tax cut for oil industry,Alaska oil tax supporters fending off repeal efforts,Alaska oil tax supporters fending off repeal efforts,UPDATE 1-Alaska voters get their say in state's oil tax system
Body: JUNEAU, Alaska, Aug 20 Alaskan voters appear tohave narrowly upheld a new law that cut taxes on oil productionand is worth up to $1 billion a year for companies such asConocoPhillips, BP Plc and Exxon Mobil Corp, according to results available on Wednesday.,JUNEAU Alaska Alaska voters looked on track to narrowly uphold a new law that cuts taxes on oil production and is worth up to $1 billion a year to companies such as ConocoPhillips , BP Plc  and Exxon Mobil Corp .,JUNEAU, Alaska, Aug 20 Alaska voters looked ontrack to narrowly uphold a new law that cuts taxes on oilproduction and is worth up to $1 billion a year to companiessuch as ConocoPhillips, BP Plc and Exxon MobilCorp.,JUNEAU, Aug 19 Voting ended on Tuesday eveningin an Alaska primary election that in part will decide whetherto repeal or uphold a new law that cuts taxes on oil productionand is worth up to $1 billion a year to companies such as ConocoPhillips, BP Plc and Exxon Mobil Corp.

Title: Alaska's new oil tax faces repeal vote during state primary
Body: JUNEAU, Aug 12 Alaskans will vote on Aug. 19 torepeal or uphold a new law that cut taxes on oil production andis worth as much as $1 billion annually to North Slope producersConoco Phillips, BP Plc and Exxon Mobil Corp, depending on oil prices.

Title: Exxon Mobil unit to pay $1.4 million penalty for Louisiana oil spill,Exxon Mobil unit to pay $1.4 mln penalty for Louisiana oil spill,UPDATE 1-Exxon says shutting FCC at Baytown TX refinery for work,Exxon shutting FCC at Baytown TX refinery for work -IIR
Body: WASHINGTON An Exxon Mobil Corp unit has agreed to pay $1.4 million to resolve U.S. government claims over a 2012 crude oil spill in Louisiana, the U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday.,WASHINGTON, Aug 26 An Exxon Mobil Corp unit has agreed to pay $1.4 million to resolve U.S. governmentclaims over a 2012 crude oil spill in Louisiana, the U.S.Justice Department said on Tuesday.,(Updates headline and text with company confirmation of plannedwork),HOUSTON, Aug 26 Exxon Mobil Corp beganshutting down a 125,000 barrels-per-day (bpd) fluid catalyticcracking unit (FCCU) and a 21,000 bpd alkylation unit this weekfor planned work at its 560,500 bpd refinery in Baytown, Texas,according to energy market information firm IIR Energy.

Title: UPDATE 1-DCC eyes further expansion of energy division after Esso deal
Body: LONDON, Aug 28 Support services group DCC said on Thursday it saw further opportunities to expandits energy division after agreeing to buy Esso's motorway retailnetwork in France, its biggest ever acquisition, for 84 millionpounds ($139 million).

Title: Exxon's European refinery play piles pain on pressured plants,Exclusive: Exxon eyes expanding Texas refinery into biggest in U.S. - sources,EXCLUSIVE-Exxon eyes expanding Texas refinery into biggest in U.S. -sources,Exxon's European refinery play piles pain on pressured plants
Body: LONDON ExxonMobil is pouring $1 billion into modernising a European refinery just as others are fleeing the sector, making life even more difficult for older plants struggling to stay afloat.,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp is considering a multibillion-dollar  plan to expand its Beaumont, Texas, refinery into the country's largest, the first major refining investment of the U.S. shale oil boom, people with knowledge of the deliberations said.,* First major U.S. refinery project since shale boom (Adds reactions from refinery consultant, mayor),* Exxon's $1 bln investment shows some confidence inlong-term future

Title: Romania president says Exxon, Petrom gas investment at $4-5 bln
Body: BUCHAREST, Sept 3 Romania's top oil and gasgroup Petrom and U.S. major ExxonMobil willneed to invest $4-5 billion to extract gas from a Black Seafield, provided additional data confirms their find, PresidentTraian Basescu said on Wednesday.

Title: Exxon invests more in European refining,Exxon invests more in European refining
Body: LONDON ExxonMobil is to pump more money into European refining, with the upgrade of a unit at its Slagen refinery in Norway, bucking an industry trend which has seen some plants in the region closing, and others on death watch.,LONDON, Sept 4 ExxonMobil is to pumpmore money into European refining, with the upgrade of a unit atits Slagen refinery in Norway, bucking an industry trend whichhas seen some plants in the region closing, and others on deathwatch.

Title: U.S., EU ready new sanctions to stop oil exploration in Russia,UPDATE 1-U.S., EU ready new sanctions to stop oil exploration in Russia,Exclusive: PDVSA seeks bids for Citgo in potential $10 billion deal - sources,EU, U.S. ready new sanctions to stop oil exploration in Russia -Bloomberg
Body: WASHINGTON The United States and European Union plan to stop billions of dollars in oil exploration in Russia by the world's largest energy companies including Exxon Mobil Corp and BP Plc, U.S. government sources said.,(Adds details on aim of planned sanctions, changes dateline toWASHINGTON),NEW YORK Venezuela's state-run oil company PDVSA [PDVSA.UL] is seeking preliminary offers for its U.S. unit Citgo Petroleum Corp [PDVSAC.UL] by the end of September, a deal that could fetch up to $10 billion, according to two people familiar with the matter.,NEW YORK, Sept 10 The United States and EuropeanUnion are poised to stop billions of dollars in oil explorationin Russia by the world's largest energy companies, includingExxon Mobil Corp and BP Plc, according to areport on Wednesday.

Title: U.S., EU ready new sanctions to stop oil exploration in Russia
Body: WASHINGTON The United States and European Union plan to stop billions of dollars in oil exploration in Russia by the world's largest energy companies including Exxon Mobil Corp and BP Plc, U.S. government sources said.

Title: Indonesia expects output from Exxon Mobil's Cepu block to peak in July/Aug 2015
Body: JAKARTA, Sept 15 Indonesia expects crude outputfrom Exxon Mobil Corp's Cepu oil block to peak in Julyor August next year, an official from the country's oil and gasregulator said on Monday.

Title: Exxon halts Arctic oil well drilling on sanctions -Bloomberg
Body: Sept 18 Exxon Mobil Corp has halteddrilling an offshore oil well in Russia's remote Arctic just afew days after the United States and European Union barredcompanies from helping Russia exploit Arctic, deep-water orshale-oil fields, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.
