Title: State Street funds ramp up support for climate-change measures,CORRECTED-State Street funds ramp up support for climate-change measures
Body: BOSTON State Street Corp funds backed a majority of shareholder resolutions on climate-change issues this year, a swing from past proxy positions that a company executive said reflects a growing appreciation of environmental risks facing companies whose shares it owns.,BOSTON, Sept 6 State Street Corp funds backed amajority of shareholder resolutions on climate-change issuesthis year, a swing from past proxy positions that a companyexecutive said reflects a growing appreciation of environmentalrisks facing companies whose shares it owns.

Title: MEDIA LINK-Exxon Mobil Backs Out of Proposed Alaska LNG Project -WSJ
Body: Aug 27 Exxon Mobil Corp has decided to scrapfurther investment in a proposed natural gas export terminal inAlaska and will work with its partners to sell its interest inthe project to the state government, the Wall Street Journalreported late Friday.

Title: U.S., Montana to make announcement on 2011 Exxon pipeline spill,U.S., Montana to make announcement on 2011 Exxon pipeline spill,REFILE-SEC investigating Exxon over accounting practices-CNBC, citing DJ,BRIEF-SEC investigating Exxon Mobil on climate change - CNBC, citing DJ
Body: WASHINGTON The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday it would join officials from Montana and other federal agencies on Wednesday to announce a "significant development" toward restoring natural resources damaged by a 2011 crude oil spill from a pipeline owned by Exxon Mobil Corp.,WASHINGTON, Sept 20 The U.S. Justice Departmentsaid on Tuesday it would join officials from Montana and otherfederal agencies on Wednesday to announce a "significantdevelopment" toward restoring natural resources damaged by a2011 crude oil spill from a pipeline owned by Exxon Mobil Corp.,Sept 20 The U.S. Securities and ExchangeCommission is investigating Exxon Mobil Corp on climatechange and accounting practices, CNBC tweeted, citing Dow Jones.(http://bit.ly/2cWRikt),* SEC investigating exxon mobil on climate change,accounting practices; sec also exploring how exxon valued assetsin price crash - CNBC, citing DJFurther company coverage:

Title: Oil industry welcomes Indonesia's tax reform, but says it's not enough,Oil industry welcomes Indonesia's tax reform, but says it's not enough
Body: SINGAPORE/JAKARTA Indonesia's removal of taxes on oil and gas explorers is a good first step, but more is needed to lure investment from companies that have cut budgets and laid off staff after a precipitous plunge in prices, industry analysts said on Friday.,SINGAPORE/JAKARTA, Sept 23 Indonesia's removalof taxes on oil and gas explorers is a good first step, but moreis needed to lure investment from companies that have cutbudgets and laid off staff after a precipitous plunge in prices,industry analysts said on Friday.

Title: RPT-Exxon probe faces uphill climb amid ambiguous accounting rules,Indonesia eyes 22 pct rise in crude output from Exxon's Cepu block in 2017
Body: NEW YORK, Sept 16 New York Attorney General EricSchneiderman faces an uphill climb in building a case againstExxon Mobil Corp for not writing down assets amid theoil-price slump because of the broad leeway that energycompanies have enjoyed reporting under U.S. rules, accountingexperts said.,JAKARTA, Sept 19 Crude oil output from ExxonMobil's Cepu block in Indonesia is targeted to reach200,000 barrels per day (bpd) in 2017, the head of Indonesia'supstream oil and gas regulator said on Monday, up from a targetof 163,910 bpd for this year.

Title: Exxon Mobil preparing to put Montana refinery on block: sources,Exxon Mobil preparing to put Montana refinery on block - sources
Body: NEW YORK Exxon Mobil Corp is in the first stages of seeking a potential buyer for its Billings, Montana, refinery, one of the company's only U.S. plants that is not integrated with its chemical operations, according to people familiar with the plans.,NEW YORK, Aug 30 Exxon Mobil Corp is inthe first stages of seeking a potential buyer for its Billings,Montana, refinery, one of the company's only U.S. plants that isnot integrated with its chemical operations, according to peoplefamiliar with the plans.

Title: UPDATE 2-Mozambique energy minister sacked ahead of huge gas deals,Russia's Gazprom plans to launch third LNG train at Sakhalin-2 in 2021,WRAPUP 1 -Russia's Gazprom plans to launch third LNG train at Sakhalin-2 in 2021
Body: MAPUTO, Sept 29 Mozambique Energy Minister PedroCouto has been sacked, the presidency said on Thursday, a monthbefore Italy's Eni is due to finalise an offshore gasproject worth tens of billions of dollars.,YUZHNO-SAKHALINSK/PRIGORODNOYE, Russia Gazprom said on Thursday it plans to launch a third liquefied natural gas (LNG) production train at the Sakhalin-2 LNG plant in 2021, possibly fed by a newly drilled field, as Russian companies seek to boost their share of the global LNG market.,* Platform for Yuzhno-Kirinskoye field could be from China-Gazprom exec

Title: BRIEF-InterOil provides update on exxonMobil transaction,Russia's Rosneft plans to take final investment decision on Far East LNG in 2017-18,Russia's Rosneft plans to take final investment decision on Far East LNG in 2017-18
Body: * Completion of transaction prior to end of sept wouldrequire issuance of final order no later than close of businesson thursday, September 29,YUZHNO-SAKHALINSK, Russia Russia's Rosneft plans to take a final investment decision on its Far East LNG project in 2017-2018, according to a presentation by Rosneft department head Alexander Zharov at a conference on Wednesday.,YUZHNO-SAKHALINSK, Russia, Sept 28 Russia'sRosneft plans to take a final investment decision onits Far East LNG project in 2017-2018, according to apresentation by Rosneft department head Alexander Zharov at aconference on Wednesday.

Title: Shell to increase Norway's Ormen Lange output capacity with new compressors
Body: NYHAMNA, Norway, Sept 27 Royal Dutch Shell plans to raise the output capacity at its giant OrmenLange field offshore Norway by installing two new compressors,the operator said on Tuesday.

Title: South Africa to name preferred bidders for gas projects in March
Body: CAPE TOWN, Oct 3 South Africa will announcepreferred bidders for multi-billion dollar gas-to-power projectsby the end of March as part of efforts to diversify electricityproduction away from more environmentally damaging coal plants,a government document shows.

Title: Exxon partners with NBA in U.S. and China,Exxon partners with NBA in U.S. and China,BRIEF-NBA, ExxonMobil announce new multiyear partnership in U.S., China
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp  said it has entered a multi-year agreement with the National Basketball Association (NBA) to be its official marketing partner in the United States and China.,Oct 5 Exxon Mobil Corp said it hasentered a multi-year agreement with the National BasketballAssociation (NBA) to be its official marketing partner in theUnited States and China.,* NBA and ExxonMobil announce new multiyear partnership inU.S. And chinaSource text for Eikon: Further company coverage:

Title: Exxon has pipeline ready for Nigeria Qua Iboe crude export
Body: ABUJA/LONDON, Sept 15 ExxonMobil has a pipelineprepared to export Nigeria's Qua Iboe crude oil, with the firstcargo expected to load as early as the end of September, tradingsources said on Thursday.

Title: ExxonMobil to pay $12 million in Montana oil spill settlement,ExxonMobil to pay $12 million in Montana oil spill settlement,UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil to pay $12 million in Montana oil spill settlement,SEC probes Exxon's climate, reserves accounting: report,SEC probes Exxon's climate, reserves accounting -report,UPDATE 4-SEC probes Exxon's climate, reserves accounting -report
Body: ExxonMobil Corp. has agreed to pay $12 million to Montana and the U.S. government to restore natural resources damaged or destroyed by a pipeline rupture in 2011 that spilled oil into the Yellowstone River, according to a settlement proposed on Wednesday.,ExxonMobil Corp. has agreed to pay $12 millionto Montana and the U.S. government to restore natural resourcesdamaged or destroyed by a pipeline rupture in 2011 that spilledoil into the Yellowstone River, according to a settlementproposed on Wednesday.,Sept 21 ExxonMobil Corp. has agreed to pay $12million to Montana and the U.S. government to restore naturalresources damaged or destroyed by a pipeline rupture in 2011that spilled oil into the Yellowstone River, according to asettlement proposed on Wednesday.,The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating how Exxon Mobil  has valued its oil reserves in the wake of low prices and potential curbs on carbon emissions, the company said, confirming an earlier report.,The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission isinvestigating how Exxon Mobil has valued its oilreserves in the wake of low prices and potential curbs on carbonemissions, the company said, confirming an earlier report.,Sept 20 The U.S. Securities and ExchangeCommission is investigating how Exxon Mobil has valuedits oil reserves in the wake of low prices and potential curbson carbon emissions, the company said, confirming an earlierreport.

Title: BRIEF-Exxon Mobil and Stewart-Haas racing extend partnership with multi-year deal,BUZZ-Kashagan oil output to average 150,000 bpd in 2017 -WoodMac
Body: * Exxon Mobil and Stewart-Haas Racing extend partnershipwith multi-year deal,** Production from the giant Kashagan oilfield in Kazakhstanis expected to average more than 150,000 barrels per day in 2017and 230,000 bpd in 2018, according to consultancy Wood Mackenzie

Title: UPDATE 2-PBF Energy cited for excessive flaring at Torrance, Calif.  refinery
Body: HOUSTON, Oct 14 PBF Energy Inc hasreceived a violation notice from air regulators for excessiveflaring at its Torrance refinery in Los Angeles, just days afteran outage at a local utility knocked the facility offline yetagain.

Title: BRIEF-Interoil Corp says supreme court of Yukon approves pending transaction with Exxon Mobil Corp
Body: * Interoil corp -  supreme court of Yukon approved pendingtransaction with Exxon Mobil Corporation

Title: UPDATE 10-Oil up over 2 pct; U.S. crude at 15-month high on big drawdown,Exxon boss, Saudi minister differ on oil supply outlook,Exxon Mobil CEO says doesn't see big oil supply crunch
Body: * Saudis says market balancing; Exxon says shale will return (Adds Enbridge's layoff announcement, paragraph 14),LONDON, Oct 19 Exxon Mobil's boss RexTillerson and Saudi Arabia's energy minister on Wednesday tookopposing views on declining investment in the oil sector settingthe stage for a possible major supply crunch.,LONDON The world is developing enough oil resources to avoid a big supply crunch in the next few years, the boss of Exxon Mobil said on Wednesday, adding he saw no major further declines in U.S. oil output either.

Title: Exxon lifts force majeure on Qua Iboe, Nigeria's largest export stream
Body: LONDON ExxonMobil has lifted force majeure on Nigeria's Qua Iboe crude oil, the country's largest export stream, a spokesman said on Friday.

Title: Saudi's SABIC says starts commercial ops at part of new rubber plant
Body: DUBAI, Oct 23 Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC) said on Sunday that it started commercialoperations the previous day at the polybutadiene industrialrubber part of its KEMYA joint venture with a unit of ExxonMobil.

American fleet card contract for 10 yrs
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp  is weighing building a full-scale trading division as it looks to counter a more than two-year rout in oil prices, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.,Oct 27 Exxon Mobil Corp is weighingbuilding a full-scale trading division as it looks to counter amore than two-year rout in oil prices, the Financial Timesreported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.,* ExxonMobil eyes setting up large-scale trading division-FT, citing sources,* ExxonMobil begins production at port allen aviationlubricants plant,* ExxonMobil announces significant oil discovery offshoreNigeria,* FuelCell energy and ExxonMobil announce location for fuelcell carbon capture pilot plant,* Wex Inc and ExxonMobil extend North American fleet cardcontract for 10 more years

Title: Exxon Mobil profit drops 38 percent but beats estimates,Exxon warns low oil prices may dent reserves nearly 20 percent,WRAPUP 1-Exxon warns low oil prices may dent reserves nearly 20 pct,UPDATE 3-Exxon Mobil profit drops 38 percent but beats estimates,BRIEF-ExxonMobil to perform assessment of major long-lived assets in light of upstream weakness,Exxon Mobil quarterly profit drops by $1.59 billion,BRIEF-Exxon Mobil reports Q3 earnings per share of $0.63
Body: HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp, the world's largest publicly traded oil company, on Friday reported a 38 percent drop in quarterly profit that still beat Wall Street's expectations as cost cuts partly offset declining crude oil prices. |Â ,HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp, whose oil field assets are being investigated by the U.S. government, warned on Friday it may need to slash proved reserves on its books by nearly 20 percent if oil prices stay low for the rest of 2016.,HOUSTON, Oct 28 Exxon Mobil Corp, whoseoil field assets are being investigated by the U.S. government,warned on Friday it may need to slash proved reserves on itsbooks by nearly 20 percent if oil prices stay low for the restof 2016.,HOUSTON, Oct 28 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's largest publicly traded oil company, on Friday reporteda 38 percent drop in quarterly profit that still beat WallStreet's expectations as cost cuts partly offset declining crudeoil prices.,* In light of continued weakness in upstream industry,company will perform assessment of major long-lived assets,similar to exercise undertaken in 2015,HOUSTON, Oct 28 Exxon Mobil Corp, theworld's largest publicly traded oil company, said on Friday itsquarterly profit fell by $1.59 billion due to declining crudeprices and refining margins.,* Quarterly upstream earnings were $620 million in Q3 of2016, down $738 million from Q3 of 2015

Title: Exxon Louisiana refinery poorly maintained, environmentalists say
Body: HOUSTON A Louisiana environmental group said on Tuesday that ExxonMobil Corp's Baton Rouge, Louisiana, refinery, where four workers were burned in a November 22 fire, has been poorly maintained for years.

Title: Judge says Exxon owes $19.95 million for Texas refinery pollution,Cox: Proximity to Trump no blessing for stocks,Judge says Exxon owes $19.95 million for Texas refinery pollution
Body: HOUSTON A federal judge ruled on Wednesday thatExxonMobil Corp should pay a $19.95 million penalty forpollution from its Baytown, Texas, refining and chemical plantcomplex between 2005 and 2013.,NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - The first 100 days of Donald Trump's presidency are shaping up as either a bust or huge. That's how politics rolls: success or failure is in the eye of the beholder. The stock market offers a bit more precision. One message from the 65-odd trading days since Trump took office decrying "American carnage" is that perceived proximity to the Oval Office is no blessing for companies' stock prices.,HOUSTON A federal judge ruled on Wednesday that ExxonMobil Corp should pay a $19.95 million penalty for pollution from its Baytown, Texas, refining and chemical plant complex between 2005 and 2013.

Title: Nigerian oil workers extend Exxon Mobil strike to Chevron, Agip and Shell,UPDATE 1-Nigerian oil workers extend Exxon Mobil strike to Chevron, Agip and Shell,Nigerian oil workers extend Exxon Mobil strike to Chevron, Agip and Shell
Body: ONITSHA, Nigeria Nigerian workers from an oil labor union have extended a strike to oil majors Chevron, Shell and Eni subsidiary Agip in protest over the sacking of members from Exxon Mobil Corp, the union's general secretary said on Tuesday.,ONITSHA, Nigeria, May 16 Nigerian workers froman oil labour union have extended a strike to oil majors Chevron, Shell and Eni subsidiary Agip inprotest over the sacking of members from Exxon Mobil Corp, the union's general secretary said on Tuesday.,ONITSHA, Nigeria, May 16 Nigerian workers froman oil labour union have extended a strike to oil majorsChevron, Shell and Eni subsidiary Agip in protest over thesacking of members from Exxon Mobil Corp, the union's generalsecretary said on Tuesday.

Title: Exxon says to open gas stations in Mexico, invest $300 million,UPDATE 3-Exxon says to open gas stations in Mexico, invest $300 mln,BRIEF-Exxonmobil to launch Mobil-branded service stations and fuels in Mexico,Exxon plans to invest $300 mln in Mexico, cites energy reform
Body: MEXICO CITY Exxon Mobil Corp announced it will bring its Mobil-brand gas stations to Mexico, pumping $300 million in the coming decade as it seeks to gain a foothold in the country's retail fuel market.,MEXICO CITY, May 17 Exxon Mobil Corpannounced it will bring its Mobil-brand gas stations to Mexico,pumping $300 million in the coming decade as it seeks to gain afoothold in the country's retail fuel market.,* Exxonmobil to launch mobil-branded service stations andfuels in Mexico,MEXICO CITY, May 17 Exxon Mobil Corpplans to invest about $300 million over 10 years as it entersMexico's retail fuel market, citing the country's energy reformsas opening the door to new opportunities, the company saidWednesday.

Title: Nigerian oil labor union suspends Exxon Mobil strike in Rivers state,UPDATE 1-Nigerian oil labour union suspends Exxon Mobil strike in Rivers state,Nigerian oil labour union suspends Exxon Mobil strike in Rivers state
Body: YENAGOA, Nigeria A Nigerian labor union that had called for the shutdown of all Exxon Mobil Corp facilities in the Niger Delta has suspended its strike at its Rivers state branch in the oil production hub, two union representatives said on Saturday.,YENAGOA, Nigeria, May 20 A Nigerian labour unionthat had called for the shutdown of all Exxon Mobil Corpfacilities in the Niger Delta has suspended its strike at itsRivers state branch in the oil production hub, two unionrepresentatives said on Saturday.,YENAGOA, Nigeria, May 20 A Nigerian labour unionthat had called for the shutdown of all Exxon Mobil Corpfacilities in the Niger Delta has suspended its strike at itsRivers state branch in the oil production hub, two unionrepresentatives said on Saturday.

Title: ExxonMobil secures Qatari condensate for Singapore unit - sources
Body: SINGAPORE, May 18 Exxon Mobil Corp hasoutbid other Asian buyers of deodorised field condensate (DFC)in a tender floated by Qatar Petroleum, to secure supplies for anewly purchased refining-petrochemical complex in Singapore,sources with knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

Title: Exxon vote shows Wall Street diverging from Trump on climate change,UPDATE 3-Exxon shareholders approve climate impact report in win for activists,Exxon vote shows Wall St diverging from Trump on climate change,Exxon climate vote puts sector on notice,Exxon shareholders approve climate-impact report in win for activists,Total, Exxon express interest in oil and gas exploration off Crete,UPDATE 1-Total, Exxon express interest in oil and gas exploration off Crete,Greece receives oil and gas exploration interest from Exxon, Total, Hellenic Petroleum,RPT-Exxon steps up efforts to sway shareholders on climate-report vote,Exxon steps up efforts to sway shareholders on climate-report vote
Body: BOSTON Major investors put U.S. industry on notice on Wednesday that climate change matters, even as reports emerged that President Donald Trump plans to withdraw the United States from an international pact to fight global warming.,DALLAS, May 31 Exxon Mobil Corp's chiefexecutive said on Wednesday the company would reconsider how itcommunicates the risks its faces from climate change aftershareholders approved a measure calling for increasedtransparency.,BOSTON, May 31 Major investors put U.S. industryon notice on Wednesday that climate change matters, even asreports emerged that President Donald Trump plans to withdrawthe United States from an international pact to fight globalwarming.,DALLAS (Reuters Breakingviews) - Exxon Mobil shareholders have finally won a long-sought climate-change victory. Over 60 percent of them backed a move that forces the $340 billion oil giant to ramp up global-warming disclosure, up from under 40 percent in a similar attempt last year. Exxon already embraces the debate more than most. But shareholders want the company to be more forthcoming. Holdout industry peers will have to follow or risk investor ire.,DALLAS, May 31 Exxon Mobil Corpshareholders on Wednesday approved a proposal calling for theoil company to disclose the impact on its business of compliancewith global climate change guidelines, an issue at the heart ofa probe by two state attorneys general.,ATHENS A consortium that includes Total and Exxon Mobil has submitted an expression of interest in oil and gas exploration and exploitation in two sites off the Greek island of Crete, the energy ministry said on Wednesday.,ATHENS, May 31 A consortium that includes Totaland Exxon Mobil has submitted an expression ofinterest in oil and gas exploration and exploitation in twosites off the Greek island of Crete, the energy ministry said onWednesday.,ATHENS, May 31 Greece has received interest forhydrocarbons exploration and exploitation in two sites off theisland of Crete from a consortium of Exxon Mobil,France's Total and Greece's Hellenic Petroleum, the energy ministry said on Wednesday.,HOUSTON/BOSTON, May 31 Exxon Mobil Corphas stepped up efforts to persuade  investors to vote againstclimate-related proposals at Wednesday's annual meeting with acampaign of calling, writing and lobbying shareholders inperson.,HOUSTON/BOSTON, May 31 Exxon Mobil Corphas stepped up efforts to persuade  investors to vote againstclimate-related proposals at Wednesday's annual meeting with acampaign of calling, writing and lobbying shareholders inperson.

Title: Exxon says Qatar LNG not affected by Arab states tension,Exxon says Qatar LNG not affected by Arab states tension,Qatar's dispute with Arab states puts LNG market on edge
Body: Exxon Mobil Corp  said on Tuesday that production and exports of liquefied natural gas from Qatar have not been affected by rising diplomatic tensions in the Middle East.,June 6 Exxon Mobil Corp said on Tuesdaythat production and exports of liquefied natural gas from Qatarhave not been affected by rising diplomatic tensions in theMiddle East.,SINGAPORE/LONDON Saudi Arabia and key allies on Monday cut ties with Qatar, the world's top seller of liquefied natural gas (LNG), stoking concern over any supply disruptions to neighboring countries spilling over into global gas markets.

Title: Qatar's emir meets Exxon Mobil Corp CEO: agency,Qatar's emir meets Exxon Mobil Corp CEO -agency
Body: The emir of Qatar met with Exxon Mobil Corp  chairman and CEO Darren Woods in Doha on Saturday for talks on "cooperation," state news agency QNA reported, following a rift between four Gulf states and Qatar that has raised worries about energy supplies.,June 25 The emir of Qatar met with Exxon MobilCorp chairman and CEO Darren Woods in Doha on Saturdayfor talks on "cooperation," state news agency QNA reported,following a rift between four Gulf states and Qatar that hasraised worries about energy supplies.

Title: Exxon, BP support Republican elders' climate proposal
Body: BOSTON Major oil companies like Exxon Mobil  and BP Plc  have thrown their support behind a carbon tax plan proposed by a group of elder Republican statesmen, according to an advertisement published in the Wall Street Journal on Tuesday.

Title: Oil firms could waste trillions if climate targets reached -report,UPDATE 1-Oil firms could waste trillions if climate targets reached -report,From Middle East to Argentina, France's Total bets on cheap resources
Body: LONDON Energy giants including Exxon Mobil  and Royal Dutch Shell  risk wasting more than a third of their budgets on projects that will not be needed if climate targets are to be met, a thinktank report shows.,* More than a third of Exxon, Shell budgets seen at risk by2025,LONDON As the world witnesses spectacular growth in oil and gas production from the U.S. shale deposits, the boss of French energy giant Total paradoxically says this is one area where he doesn't want to expand.

Title: Qatar LNG company postpones layoffs amid diplomatic crisis
Body: DOHA, July 19 Majority state-owned Qatari gasproducer Rasgas has postponed a round of job cuts after thediplomatic crisis which erupted between Qatar and its neighboursin early June, people familiar with the matter have toldReuters.

Title: Exxon sues U.S. over fine levied for Russia deal under Tillerson,UPDATE 3-Exxon sues U.S. over fine levied for Russia deal under Tillerson,BRIEF-Exxon Mobil to challenge finding by OFAC that it violated U.S. sanctions against Russia in 2014â€‹,U.S. fines Exxon Mobil over Ukraine-related sanctions violations
Body: WASHINGTON/HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp suedthe U.S. government on Thursday, blasting as "unlawful" and"capricious" a $2 million fine levied against it for athree-year-old oil joint venture with Russia's Rosneft.,WASHINGTON/HOUSTON, July 20 Exxon Mobil Corpsued the U.S. government on Thursday, blasting as"unlawful" and "capricious" a $2 million fine levied against itfor a three-year-old oil joint venture with Russia's Rosneft.,* Says â€çlaunched legal challenge to finding by treasurydepartment's office of foreign assets control that it violatedU.S. sanctions against Russia in 2014â€‹,WASHINGTON, July 20 The U.S. Treasury Departmenton Thursday announced a civil penalty against Exxon Mobil Corpand its U.S. subsidiaries for violating sanctionsregulations related to Ukraine in May 2014, fining the globaloil company $2 million.

Title: ExxonMobil says will drop discussions over Indonesia's East Natuna gas field,UPDATE 1-ExxonMobil says will drop discussions over Indonesia's East Natuna gas field,ExxonMobil says will not continue discussions over East Natuna gas field in Indonesia
Body: JAKARTA The Indonesian unit of ExxonMobil on Tuesday said it "no longer wishes to continue further discussions or activity" involving the country's East Natuna natural gas block, believed to hold one of the world's largest reserves of untapped gas.,* Pertamina says still committed to developing East Natunablock,JAKARTA, July 18 The Indonesian unit ofExxonMobil on Tuesday said the company "no longer wishesto continue further discussions or activity" involving the EastNatuna gas block in the country.

Title: Exxon blocked from enforcing Venezuela arbitration award: U.S. appeals court,Exxon blocked from enforcing Venezuela arbitration award - U.S. appeals court,UPDATE 1-Exxon blocked from enforcing Venezuela arbitration award -US appeals court,U.S. appeals court voids Exxon enforcement of Venezuela award,BRIEF-U.S. appeals court voids $1.6 billion Exxon judgment against Venezuela,DIARY-U.S. refinery operations-Exxon Beaumont refinery shuts HCU due to leak -sources
Body: NEW YORK A U.S. appeals court said on Tuesday that Exxon Mobil Corp  cannot enforce a large international arbitration award against Venezuela stemming from an asset seizure in 2007, when the country was nationalizing its oil industry.,NEW YORK A U.S. appeals court said on Tuesdaythat Exxon Mobil Corp cannot enforce a largeinternational arbitration award against Venezuela stemming froman asset seizure in 2007, when the country was nationalizing itsoil industry.,* Venezuela had seized Exxon assets in 2007(Adds details from decision, comments, background, casecitation, byline),NEW YORK, July 11 A U.S. appeals court said onTuesday that Exxon Mobil Corp cannot enforce a $1.6billion international arbitration award against Venezuelastemming from a 2007 asset seizure, voiding a lower courtjudgment.,July 11 DECISION ISSUED BY 2ND U.S. CIRCUITCOURT OF APPEALS IN NEW YORKLAWSUIT STEMMED FROM VENEZUELA'S 2007 SEIZURE OF EXXONMOBILASSETS IN CONNECTION WITH THE COUNTRY'S NATIONALIZATION OF ITSOIL INDUSTRYu.s. Appeals court grants venezuela's bid to void $1.6 billionjudgment that had been won by exxonmobilAPPEALS COURT SAYS LOWER COURT JUDGE ERRED IN EXCUSINGEXXONMOBIL FROM COMPLYING WITH PROCEDURAL REQUIREMENTS TOENFORCE THE JUDGMENT,    July 10 The following is a list of refinery incidents reported in the UnitedStates on July 10:         * Shell Convent refinery restarts gasoline, alkylation units -sources                           * Total Port Arthur refinery shuts reformer for repairs -sources                                * Marathon Texas City gasoline unit shut for repair -sources                                    * Exxon Beaumont, Texas plant reports control valve malfunction on July 9

Title: Exxon sues U.S. over fine levied for Russia deal under Tillerson,After false dawn, Big Oil to double down on cost cuts
Body: WASHINGTON/HOUSTON Exxon Mobil Corp sued the U.S. government on Thursday, blasting as "unlawful" and "capricious" a $2 million fine levied against it for a three-year-old oil joint venture with Russia's Rosneft.,LONDON, July 21 After a brief respite at thestart of the year, the world's top oil and gas companies are setto double down on cost cutting as a recovery in crude pricesafter a three-year slump falters.
